reviews.text: Tucked into a little hole in the wall with some outdoor seating, this food here is amazeballs. Some really exquisite lasagne with house-made pasta that is super super thin. Light and guilt-free; love this place. I also love the enthusiasm of the staff and owner.
Hands down the very best lasagna I've had. Wonderful service too. I can't wait to go back and try some of the other things...
I finally made it to try this wonderful hand-crafted, authentic and delicious Lasagna!

Tried Marcella's for the first time yesterday with a friend. This is an owner-operated establishment, and the father and son were both very friendly and helpful and it is clear they take a lot of pride and pleasure in their work--really a breath of fresh air in SF. The experience was very pleasant, and the lasagna was wonderful. The prices are reasonable and service was quick. I wish more businesses in SF were like this. Will definitely be coming back!
I can't find the words to begin this other than: this place has the best food I have ever tasted, and is the least pretentious restaurant I have ever been to.

This place is AH-MAZE-ING!!! Fresh lasagna made daily with super fresh ingredients! Excellent service with a smile. Family owned and run. Gian Franco was very friendly and helpful. He knows everything about the menu because he literally made it himself that morning. Best Lasagna in San Francisco hands down. Delicious meat and vegetarian options! They also do catering and large pans for parties.
The mushroom lasagna is outrageously great! John, the owner gives you a "welcome home" service. It's worth my drive from Silicon Valley.
I've worked in the Dogpatch for 2 years, and this is one of my all-time neighborhood favorites for lunch. Family-owned, daily specials, everything freshly made, super friendly service.
First time here and loved it!! Customer service was on point. The lasagna and pasta was simple and delicious as it was all hand made. This spot is no muss or fuss place which is a refreshing break.
Simply the best!

10/10. As a lasagna lover I haven't had lasagna this good ever. The thin homemade noodles is probably what makes it so good, but holy shit. Good atmosphere, family owned, friendly service. Absolutely love it. Lasagna is usually a pretty heavy dish but it was really good here and you could pick apart all the flavors and components, instead of eating one cheesy goop of tomato sauce.
Tasty and delicious Italian food. Ive had several different lasagnas. On point each time. Some Italian coffee after is a great way to end the meal. Very authentic and family Italian feel.
Honestly the best lasagna I've had in my life. Try the verdura lasagna!

I have not dined here, but have had the mushroom lasagna from this place at a friends house. My friends Vince and Jonathan know the owners of this place well and for a special dinner at their home a month or so ago, they ordered the mushroom lasagna and baked it at home. They prefaced it with how unique and amazing this was going to be and it will be unlike any lasagna I have ever had. I was super excited while at the same time having no clue what could make any lasagna so different from the numerous lasagna I have had throughout my existence!

What a gem! I was in the neighborhood and stopped by for take out. I got 2 orders of lasagna, one with pesto and one with red sauce. Both were amazing. My guess is that you can't go wrong with any of the lasagna options.

I absolutely love this spot! Everything about it! I treat myself once a week to their AMAZING caprese salad! In between my weekly lunch I crave the mozzarella! This charming family owned and ran business has been around Dogpatch for years and it a hidden gem! The vibe of the restaurant is really casual but perfect for lunch meeting. The black truffle ravioli is to die for as well!!

As many have said, this is the best lasagna I've ever tasted.  Service is friendly and personable.  The only time you should stray from the lasagna is to try the day's special.  Everything is hand-crafted and you can really taste the quality.
Let me keep this simple: I think this was really hands-down the best lasagna that I have ever had.

THIS PLACE. I can't even describe how delightful the food and service is. I don't even like lasagna. Or I didn't till I came here. The people who make the food here are artists, and they made a lasagna lover out of me. :D
I didn't expect much from this small place when I walked in to find I was the only one there, but it blew my mind.

The lasagna is incredible. Probably the best I have ever had. The pasta layers are super thin and the bottom has this crisp texture. I will be back. Love it when you  unexpectedly find a gem of a restaurant. It's very casual, but family run and very friendly.
Incredibly great service, great portions & good food. They have a decent vegetarian selection. It is nice sitting outdoors in good weather. This place is family run.

My husband and I usually aren't able to have lunch together during the week. Since we could today, we wanted to go somewhere special, recommended by friends. The restaurant has indoor and sidewalk seating. It's an unpretentious place- everything is served on paper plates. It's owned and run by a family that fairly shine with love for what they do. The son greeted us, mom was on the register, dad was cooking and everyone was watching over the tables together. We overheard the dad tell another table that they name the restaurant after his daughter. They were all attentive, warm, and generously spirited - very genuine in how they made us feel like old friends. We ended up spending along two hours eating lunch, though I felt like we'd been there for only 30 minutes or so.
Food speaks for itself. Amazing. You're cheating yourself if you don't try it.
Great spot for lunch with a  great staff. Never let down by the quality of the food or service. Get the lasagna, its filling and will require a 2pm nap but worth it.

I've been meaning to try Marcella's... pretty much ever since I moved to the neighborhood. This proved to be fairly difficult, given that they're only open during work hours, and, well, I usually work. But! Thanks to a concussion I received a few weeks back, I ended up getting to finally try their oh-so-famous lasagna during one of my rest days.

I can't say I've ever had AUTHENTIC Italian before until now. My first time here, I was blown away. I got the zucchini lasagna and the mushroom soup and it was to die. I came here today to pick up food for my co-workers and while standing there I noticed a picture of the owner on the wall towards the front. Cutest thing everrr. Og Italian. His sons so handsome too and soooooo nice and corteous. Father and son look so much alike. I love this place because of the environment. It's so welcoming and the small interior really invites you in. However, the outside is gorge with outside seating. So you can wine and find outside. Food is Delish. Perfect and creamy..  5 stars! @cuteguy teamwork makes the dream work!!
We just stumbled into Marcella's yesterday, had never heard of it before.   We were hungry and it was the closest restaurant.  What a happy surprise.

Small neighborhood trattoria of sorts. Everything made fresh each day. I'm not a fan of lasagna but the owner assured me that it wasn't like any other. No ricotta which is a good thing for me. I ordered the eggplant lasagna. Several layers of the thinnest freshly made pasta sheets accompanied by bechamel and a red sauce with eggplant throughout all held together with mozzarella. It happened to be the best lasagna I've ever had!  My colleague has the caprese salad which appears to have been served with freshly imported burrata.

Well it's kinda kooky to compare this to a burrito joint as many 3 star reviewers mentioned. I'm 6'3" and solid 185 and a slice sets me straight for two meals. With a salad.  I've only done take out.  Once you cook food it must bee refrigerated.... Food safety 101!  Gosh some yelpers.  The poor reviews disappeared?
Incredible! We ordered a variety of items figuring we would have leftovers but every bite was tooooo good. Talk to the owner and feel the passion in every dish.
Lasagna paradise!

Lasagna! Who doesn't love lasagna? Anything with layers of pasta, hearty fillings and cheesy toppings and I'm sold. Well lucky me, I've found this father- son, hole-in-the-wall business specializing in making lasagna.
This place has great food AND amazing people making it. Loved the mushroom lasagna and eggplant pizza.

try the black truffle ravioli. I have to go back again and again. Took my husband for lunch there. I just wish they stay open on weekends . Recommend it to all my friends.their sauces are awesome and available at whole-foods in sfo

This place has outstanding food, service, and character! The food is authentic with no yuppie interpretations and served in perfect proportions--just like my nona used to cook for me! The mushroom lasagna is my family's favorite and the pizza was delish! The father-son duo make everything by hand and treat you like family. Gianfranco is especially sweet and thoughtful. He found a special spot for us to sit and propped up my injured leg on a pillow!!! I swear I have been treated so badly by other servers in the city when I walk in using crutches.

A friend and I ordered 2 paninis and drinks...and then got talked into ordering a "pasta" dish by the waiter.....we split a "butternut squash lasagna" - it was alright but the paninis were barely warm since all the food was delivered together - I'll assume the paninis waited on the lasagna.
This place has the best lasagna! Not a lot of people even know this place is around I found out about it from family bringing over leftovers and as soon as I had it I was hooked!

Yum!  I ducked into this place because who wouldn't want to visit a "Lasagnaeria".  It was amazing.  Very delicate but hearty lasagna, and the owners are very nice and friendly.  A great neighborhood joint.  The owner's son John even put a couple of cold packs into my to-go order so that the lasagna could keep cool in my car until I would get home several hours later.  Nice place!

I'm a realtor in SF and Tuesdays are a day of hunting for parking and double parking as I preview properties for my clients. I went to see a property in Dogpatch today and saw a sort-of space that jutted me into a buildings drive-way. I quickly ran I to the corner eatery and asked if I could please semi-block their driveway for a few minutes and I promised I'd come back in to look at their menu. I was fortunate enough to have an extra half hour and sat down and ordered their mushroom lasagna. Man, it was REALLY good, and I'm half Italian!  The thin layers of noodles, the yummy sauce filling but not heavy and just enough. I will be going back. I love lasagna and they have 6 other types. What a nice surprise for me just because I didn't want to piss them off and block their driveway without permission. My tummy is happy.
Service is great, parking is easy but the food is just ok.  The scallops were ok.  The chickpea calamari was ok.  The burger was ok.  The pumpkin cheesecake is ok.
Latisha made the night with her great service and recommendations . The food was amazing!!!!

Don't miss the weekend brunch. Sure, there can be a wait, but HOUSE SMOKED SALMON BENEDICT is all I have to say. And they take reservations. The "ho-so-good hollandaise sauce is not to be missed. The bartenders make a strong cocktail too. Can't wait to visit there again!
Here's a tip: get a reservation. 1 hr waits to those that try to walk in. This is not the reason that the restaurant gets 4 instead of 5 stars, though. That was my bad for not being more prepared.
As painful as long waits usually are, it's actually a piece of cake here when there's ice cream and alcohol literally within a 1 block radius.

Been here a few times now for dinner and it never disappoints!  Friendly staff, quick service and delicious food.  Could do with a few more vegetarian options, but they were happy to adjust the delicious pasta to make it veg, so can't complain. 5 stars!

Ok, I've been here twice and I'm feeling like I'm missing something. Our friends love love love this place for brunch. They rave about everything, especially the red flannel hash and the smoked salmon Benedict. I've tasted both and felt that they were ok, but nothing too special...I tried the steak and eggs this time and it was meh. The breading from the steak fell off the steak and looked liked someone picked through it before coming to me. Also had the buckwheat pancakes and that was good, but not memorable. Given that the wait here is long, I wouldn't rush to return for just mediocre food.

Love this place. I had the crab benedict once and the salmon benedict another time. Both were on top of a biscuit with a side of arugula and crispy HEAVEN potatoes. That's right. GET THE POTATOES! It's crispy to the right texture! The portion size is a good amount, not too little, not too much. Boyfriend had the hash once and then the country fried steak with biscuit, crispy potatoes and arugula. That hash was pretty good. Not sure about the steak, meh. I've had better. Overall, this place rocks. To make it all even better? My favorite ice cream place is right next door!
Heard Me So Horny by 2 Live Crew and Give My Money by ODB with in Minutes....5 Stars.

The hash and the bloodys were fantastic! My boyfriend got the country fried steak but didn't like the gravy or breading. The space is great and I really enjoyed getting to listen to 80's/90's hip hop classics while we ate. Definite will be back!

This review is for brunch only. I came here with two friends on Saturday and got seated within 15-20 mins. I got the smoked salmon benedict or something like that and it was okay.. I felt that the smoked salmon was already quite salty so why the hell would there be hella capers added?! I think the capers were too much and just made me really thirsty. Do not think I will be back for brunch but i do wanna try dinner!

Red flannel hash was mouth watering. Bicyclette refreshing. Would have been 5 stars but the service was luke warm and slow. Nevertheless, I will have to go back for the hash, my God, that hash! Maybe our server was having a bad day
This is our neighborhood go to restaurant. It is CONSISTENTLY good and the cocktails are amazing.
A nice find while trying to take a leisurely stroll to the ballgame.  We came here for brunch and couldn't have been happier to find this place!

Delicious pulled pork & polenta but the lamb sandwich had tasteless lamb and the "muffins" were a poorly executed hamburger bun. Orange juice isn't homemade either. Staff was OK,  a bit cold & hipstery.

Came here for brunch on a Saturday and the wait to be seated probably took 5 minutes. The tables are fairly close to each other and you can somewhat hear your neighbor's conversation. Music was playing, but can't really hear it since everyone was talking all at once, so yes, the place gets really loud. The ambiance is nice with high ceiling- kind of reminded me of a warehouse/loft. The menus are on a clipboard and they seem to be printed daily on what they are offering only for that time being. They have a full bar with minimal seats if you decide to eat there instead of the tables.
Ok. Serpentine was better the second time around. Brunch wasn't spectacular and actually forgettable. The menu was small and concentrated. But dinner!?
So happy I finally got to come here. I was so lucky to able to have met my friends my LA here and thank god I got there at 10am on a Sunday because right after I was seated it got packed.
This place really is A-OK. Nothing super interesting, wine pairing okay but not fantastic. My money would have probably been better spent at Tartine or St. Vincent.

I know this place gets a lot of great reviews and is a Dogpatch favorite... However, I really feel like this restaurant has some serious fundamental problems with service. Upon arriving, the greeter was pleasant, but the restaurant was completely booked in reservations. We opted to sit at the bar, which only had three other guests. Upon sitting down, the bartender was cleaning glasses and looked to be organizing a bit, but took over 5 minutes to greet us or even look at us. When he finally got us menus, he didn't smile or say anything like "good morning" or "how are you"... We ordered a mimosa and Bloody Mary, which he made quickly, but again, no smiles or small talk. When we asked for suggestions on house favorites, and in particular, the corn beef hash, his answer was curt and unwelcoming "I personally don't like it... It's ok." We ended up ordering the polenta and pork and the fried chicken, both which were kind of bland. Nothing to write home about. And the very end of the experience, he got our check, didn't ask us how our food was, and never said thank you or have a good day.... Not exactly the most pleasant dining experience...
lunch here was a pleasant surprise. cool warehouse interior, good service, and it was nice to have fresh, healthy food instead of being drowned in grease.

Brunch is always solid here.  (Menu rotates frequently, so my suggestions may not exist).  I've tried the tri tip hash and the dungeness crab benedict.  Both were delicious, fresh and generously sized.  Their biscuits are delicious!

Nice little place in Dogpatch!  The food selection was good, ambience good for meal with friends (not too loud or quiet), and service was friendly.  I had their scallop dish, which was delicious - scallops cooked well and the sauce was a great blend of flavors.  We did have a little bit of an issue with the staff and our service dog, but it was all in the best interest of safety.  The other people we were with are regulars and had the burger - they said it was excellent as usual.

Banging! Well the drinks are that is. I cant wait to return and try some of the food. We had 5 cocktails off the list. Fuego, Arcadian, Smokey, Monice's and the Shrub Runner. All were equally perfected and totally different ranging from refreshing (Monice and Arcadian) to bold (Smokey and Shrub Runner). Great drinks, friendly service and a great atmosphere.
Love this place.
Had a fabulous meal. We enjoyed the duck and a flat iron steak. Service was excellent. They also make a great Manhattan. The space is a bit noisy, but we were still able to have a conversation.

Perfectly cooked hamburger worthy of applause. Full of flavor and juicy.  Served in a setting bursting with energy.  Waitstaff pleasant and attentive.  A+ on the cocktails.  Highly recommend. Did I mention the excellent service?
Place is small so the tables are really close together. There is more outdoor seating than indoor seating do its great on a nice day.

Serpentine is a brunch gem in the up-and-coming Dogpatch. It features natural lighting paired with exposed brick and industrial details. It's also across from Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, which serves up some of the best artisan ice-cream in San Francisco. I came with a friend for brunch on a beautiful Saturday on an OpenTable reservation. You can probably come without a reservation - there were a number of empty tables when we were there at 1:30PM.
Excellent Service - International Staff - Awesome Chef. OMStars.... Fusion Food - really do it......The City is alive with GEMS.

Went for brunch and it was great. Had the hash with the brisket. Don't remember the exact name. THe meat was tender and not dry at all and the flavors worked well together. Would go back to try other menu items.
This is the best food I have had in California.
great food

Honestly id put 3.5. The place was decent, i checked out the menu, ordered the fried chicken and waffles with the buckwheat pancakes. It wasnt anything special, my fried chicken was underseasoned(the batter), but my pancakes were decent.
Would definitely come back. Nice industrial rustic kind of atmosphere. Soup was yummy! Salmon was good needed a little more salt.
Pretty typical progressive American. Went here for dinner.
Please put the Veggie Burger on the dinner menu! I absolutely love that chorizo spiced, chickpea deliciousness but never get to taste the vegetarian glory because you eliminate the opportunity.
Another hip little place in fierce competition with the SF brunch scene.

i was hoping for amazing things here given all of the reviews. maybe its because we went for dinner instead of brunch but the food was underwhelming, the lighting was way too bright for dinner (making the vibe less than ideal) and prices were too high for what we were getting.
Despite my New York culinary chauvinism, this placed rocked. Food was delicious, friendly and attentive servers, and the physical layout of the restaurant was open and inviting. A gem!

Fantastic pizza place with a cozy feel. Love that there is parking nearby and no wait in hour long lines. :). Originally from NYC, I've been spoiled by delicious thin slice NY style pizza that is close to no where to be found on the West Coast. However, Long Bridge is 1 of 2 of my favorite pizza joints that I have come to love and enjoy.

Really, really great quality toppings.  Perfect crust.  Not a long wait at all, even during lunch rush.  Great beer selection.  By far the best pizza I've had in San Francisco.  Soppresata on the Loading Dock Pizza is the ish!
Thin tasty crust, perfect amount of topping/cheese/sauce ratio. Not so much that you lose the flavor of the basic pizza, but you get the flavor of the topping with each bite.
Great little pizza shop in Dogpatch. We need more of these! Carries a San Diego IPA . Bonus!

This pizza was terrible.  And expensive.  Doesn't look like the pictures at all.  No flavor, dough is bland, sauce is bland.  Doesn't deliver.  They must be manipulating their yelp score because it's terrible.
Great Pizza. The crust is really what makes this pizza great. I went here with friends the other night and we got 4 small pizzas to share.
This place is great! I have loved their pizza since they opened now they have booze! Bonus points!  Pizza is European style wood fired, fresh ingredients; Delish!

Best pizza I have had in awhile. Got to meet the owner who is super great too! Simple menu you can't go wrong. They close between 3pm and 5pm so check their hours. A must if you are in the neighborhood!

This place hits a home run with it's pizza.  Fresh local ingredients with a lot of love put into the sauce along with a very fair price makes this place worth the trip from Sacramento.  I recommend this place over and over.  The owner is very cool too!
excellent sauce, first and foremost. it's got that bitter finish most upscale-y  pizza places totally whiff on.

Very tasty pizza! If they had slices to go, I'd be a regular. OK, maybe I'll be a regular anyways: I went back the next day & tried the margherita pizza. Mmm. The crust is supposed to be sourdough, which I could barely notice but what I love is the chewy/crisp texture you get from a perfect fresh baguette, moderately thin and beautifully browned with some burnt bits. Mmmm.
Easily the best pizza I've had in SF.  The sourdough crust is really outstanding.  We got takeout to being to Triple Voodoo Brewing a block away.
This is officially now my favorite pizza place in ALL OF San Francisco. It's SOO GOOD! I hesitate to write a review, because I know this place is going to...
Awesome neighborhood pizza place. Casual and great for takeout. The only thing better would be if they delivered.

Simple pizza place with a clean decor. My girlfriend and I ordered a large (half Margherita and half Loading Dock) and were very pleased. The ingredients were fresh and generously distributed. We were impressed at how fast the pizza was prepared and cooked for us. I liked how the staff checked in on us to make sure we liked the pizza (cashier and one of the cooks).

This is officially now my favorite pizza place in ALL OF San Francisco. It's SOO GOOD! I hesitate to write a review, because I know this place is going to blow up and I'll have to wait in a 2 hour line to get pizza. But It's just so good!

I was excited about this new addition to my neighborhood and WANTED to love it, but wasn't too impressed. We shared the sausage pizza and both of us thought it was just OK. It was a bit bland and might have been better with a little more salt. I will probably come back and try one of the other pizzas before writing this place off, since they do have a lot of good reviews. I would also LOVE to see them expand their menu to include some salads and appetizers.

This is the best pizza I've ever had. Their special of the day included fig, prosciutto, gorganzola, and shredded parmesan amongst other things. I haven't had these on a pizza before and it worked together magically.
The staff is great, the pizza is amazing and the small beer list is solid. They have done a great job with this space and the service is always on point.

Fresh tasting and served with a smile. Enjoyed the sausage pizza and the daily special which had pesto and ricotta. Sausage wasn't too salty which I enjoyed. I think the pesto balances out the sourness of the red sauce though. Portion size is good but may need to order a bit more for the hungrier person. Crust is crunchy, chewy, and just tasty enough to finish.. Both pizzas came out fairly quickly too.
Great fresh ingredients!!

Cute pizza shop with limited seating, no reservations - order at the counter and get a number (no slice pizza, no appetizers, minimal desserts). They sell bottled beer and wine ($10 corkage) but no hard liquor, however you can take your pizza to a nearby bar.

Thought the sausage pizza was just ordinary.  The ingredients tasted fresh, but the flavors were just so-so.  The sauce was a little too acidic for me without any sweetness, and the cheese was a little sparse.
Eh.  Quick and polite service but I've had better pizza from my freezer (granted freezer pizza has improved over recent years). Nice embiance but definitely not worth $20.

I really enjoy the pizza at Long Bridge. It's super fresh and tasty, with just the right balance of flavors on each pie. The White Pizza and Loading Dock are my favorites. Great service. Definitely recommend.
The pizza here is AMAZING! Perfect blend of tastes, thin crust, large and for the right price. :) This place was amazing and I'll be back.

Pizza is definitely worth checking out, but I've had better in my lifetime. What can I say, I'm a pizza connoisseur. I had the long bridge pizza, and it was pretty tasty. My problem with the pizza is that it's just a tad too chewy....

Great addition to the dogpatch. Ordered a white pie last night for pickup.  Great texture and taste to the crust. I read somwehere that they use a tartine starter for their dough. Good balance of spinach, garlic, and ricotta. Yes, its $30 for a large pizza after tax and tip. But its an amazing pizza and reheats well the next day. The dough will definitely be a  emerging pizza trend that you'll see everywhere soon.
So glad this place opened up in the neighborhood! It gives the area a little more variety than what it has already and to top it off their pizza is actually really amazing.
Delicious pizza and great service.

A classic little pizzeria complete with great thin crust style pies. Lots of different options on the menu; a good choice for a group. Pies come out fast and is an excellent lunch spot. They're serving alcohol now too with a great selection of beer. The prices are more than fair and the pizza itself is better than anywhere else in their price range in the city. The owners are knowledgeable and friendly guys. My new favorite spot for pizza in SF

These guys are doing it right. Simple is the key word for this classic pizza joint. Simple decor, simple pizza and classic simple service. There are no frills at this local restaurant. I have never tasted such FRESH sauce, amazing (yet simple) toppings and quality ricotta/mozzarella.  I respect entrepreneurs in the city and these two young men know what it takes to open a quality restaurant. I have been twice and have been recognized at the register for my return. Personable, amazing quality and all-round great ambience!

We had our latest dinner club here and were not disappointed.  It's a no frills place with not a ton of seating.  They don't serve any alcohol but they're working on that.  Once they do, this place will even be that much better.  The staff was super friendly.  We had a large group and ended up getting four different pizzas.  The sausage, Margherita, White Pie and Loading Dock were all amazing.

I ordered 2 pizzas over the phone for pickup.  While i was making the order, i talked with the pizza guy (?owner) about pizzas cooking unevenly if there are different toppings on each side, etc.  He made sure to mention to come right at 15 minutes.
DAMN GOOD PIZZA! clean space & friendly service. Crust is thin, crispy and the sauce has just the right acidity. Damn tasty and I will continue to return for more pizza.
Finally, a quick/takeout pizza place that serves delicious pizza made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. Love this place!

Look, I don't often opt for pizza, but when I do, I want it to be authentic- and what can be more San Francisco than a pie with a sourdough crust?  This is SF perfection!  These folks toss wonderful pies... and they are nice too.

If you're in the area and you want pizza, this is a good place to try out. I'd be exaggerating if I said the pizza was amazing but it's definitely a level-up from your chain pizza restaurants like RoundTable and Patzi.

The pizza's pretty great, as is the location for parking, which is always worth a mention. I wish I had gotten the margherita on my maiden voyage, instead of the loading dock, so that I could get a better feel for the pizza as a whole, rather than a vehicle for meat.
I practically cried when I ate Long Bridge for the first time this Saturday.  After 12 years in SF, I'd given up on ever tasting decent thin crust again.  This stuff is thin crust perfection.
Totally worth the 30-45 min wait. Great food, friendly staff. Arguably, one of the best egg benedict in SF
I thought Plow to be a fitting place to begin my Yelping;
Waiting in line is never my idea of a good time. Unlike most San Franciscans, I avoid most hyped up bars/restaurants/grocery stores/ice cream shops that require an hour to simply enter the premises.
I'm still not a big fan of brunch, but I really enjoyed brunch at the Plow on Sunday morning. I struggled to pick one out of its various choices, so I ended up choosing the plow!
Have eaten at Plow about 15 or 20 times -  including with partner who's very perspicacious about food (i just had to see if i could write out that word).

I came here on a Tuesday morning at 830am and there was a 30 minute wait. Yes a 30 minute wait on a Tuesday morning! My friend had warned me of the popularity of this place, but I was still surprised to see so many people waiting around.

On your mark, get set...wait. Yes, I have waited several times in front of Plow with other hungry members of the community, waiting for their awesome fried egg and bacon sandwich, lemon ricotta pancakes and a host of other excellent breakfast and lunch items--most all of which is source locally. Even on cold days, it's worth it, because the interior is warm and friendly, and the coffee's damn good. Is it even worth sitting outside when the cold Potrero winds whip down 18th street? Damn right it is!
Plow is great.  The food is delicious + the space (though tight) is well done.
Wow!! So worth the wait. Food is consistently amazing and we have eaten there at least a dozen times.
The Plow Breakfast is amazing ! Minus 1 star for the horrible wait time on the weekends..
As awesome as advertised!  Everything we got was delicious.  It's a bit on the expensive side, but definitely worth it.  It's not a very big place, so try your best to go on a week day.
I had the plow, it was ridiculously tasty! The lemon ricotta pancakes were the fluffiest, most delicious cakes I have ever had.
I'm going to keep this review short and quick, which is the complete opposite of the waiting time/procedure to get into Plow (ooh, BURN)
Well worth the wait!  Possibly the best breakfast I have eaten out!  Lemon Ricotta pancakes, the size of a coffee cup saucer were INCREDIBLE!!!

This place is not all that. Don't believe the hype.  The breakfast is mediocre at best.  I tried to order Steak and Eggs but was told after ordering they didn't have steak and eggs.  How do you not have steak and eggs??  Finding a curly hair in my potatoes and undercooked pancakes in the "PLOW" was just lovely.  What a waste of $130 on breakfast for 5 people.  I wish I would have just gave the money to a homeless person who would could have had a better breakfast at McDonalds for 2 weeks.  Not worth the wait at all.  Just plow yourself to Denny's or IHOP.
Plow served up a breakfast against which all future breakfasts will be judged...

So I am a HUGE brunch lover. Very few things make me happier. And holy moly this place is my new favorite. I have been looking for the best brunch ever and I found it! I got the dish called the plow which comes with 2 lemon pancakes, their house sausages, 2 eggs, and their potatoe fry things that I swear we're made by god himself. Literally so good I can't even.

Came here 10 minutes before they opened on a Saturday and the line wasn't too bad at all.  Ordered The Plow and it was enough food to share with my friend...with leftovers.  Portions are huge and delicious.

I absolutely LOVED this place. I highly recommend getting "the plow" your first time there. You get a good assortment of different items on the menu (sausage, pancakes, exquisite potatoes, eggs).  The LEMON RICOTTA pancakes were just divine. I'm still dreaming about them...

Husband and I hit up this place after reading the Conde Nast article on Plow, entitled "San Francisco's Best Brunch. It's Worth the Two Hour Wait." I think the title is a bit generous, I mean its a very good brunch and maybe worth a 15 to 30 minute wait, but 2 hours? Folks, this is not manna falling from the sky.
The food is delicious and definitely worth the long wait! Definitely get the ricotta pancakes, they are fluffy and heavenly.

The wait is short if you get there early. The french toast and The Plow plate are good. The drinks are good too. The lemon ricotta pancakes are delicious, especially when paired with the crispy potatoes.

Aside from the people walking by outside and giggling at the name (not easy to explain to my 7-year old), our experience with Plow was unparalleled. It is a small place in a discreet neighborhood but the ambiance and friendly service more than make up for the ride from the center of town.
You MUST get The Plow. You'll thank me later.
FINALLY went to Plow on a Sunday for brunch. Arrived around 10am and was told the wait will be 2-2.5hrs. Yikes.

I have visited Plow several times and have been blown away each time by the quality of the food. Every time, I get the Plow breakfast. Every time it is amazing. On my most recent visit, I discovered that you figured out how to make the potatoes even more awesome! Also important to note, the lemon ricotta pancakes are amazing. Totally worth the wait!

A great breakfast / brunch spot when you are in the area. The place is small so be prepared for a wait or come when they open. They have some tables outside as well.  Their crispy, crunchy, oh so yummy potatoes is a MUST order. If your getting something that doesn't come with it, order it as a side. Trust me! You can thank me later. They get most or all their ingredients from local farmers. Coffee is always good when it comes from Equator. I've had their fried egg sandwich, avocado toast, lemon ricotta pancakes, french toast, and the plow. Everything so far has been great! Parking in the area is a bit of a challenge especially if you come on a busy time. Prepare to walk.
Yum, sunday brunch with the best!
Best roasted potatoes ever. I haven't had any potatoes that come remotely close to being as good as Plow. I could come here just for the potatoes.
Decent enough food, but not good enough for a 2-hour wait on weekends. Nice potatoes. Kinda tech-douchey customers.
5 stars for their potatoes
Plow - how do I love thee?  Let me count the ways...

My cousin and I came to the Plow a few months ago, and I believe it was  Friday morning. We had to wait about an hour, but it wasn't a big deal because we walked down the street to this super cute coffee spot and the wait went by super quick.
Good food but a bit pricey.

Put our name down for a table of four at 11:15 on a Saturday, went to the gym for an hour, came back and got seated at 12:30. Prepare for a wait, but it's WORTH it. I got the breakfast sandwich with bacon and it was amazingggg...as are the crispy potatoes and lemon ricotta pancakes. This place is the bomb.
-Arrived at 12:00PM on a Wed, seating in 5 minutes. It was a beautiful day so we sat outside
GODDAMN THIS PLACE IS EXPENSIVE.
Plow is the epitome of a perfect brunch spot!

This is one of the cutest brunch places I've been to. The inside is just so French, like effortlessly cool. And the food is simple but elegant in a rustic way. I always get the plow at plow (haa) since my love for lemon ricotta pancakes is just as strong as my love for nueske bacon. The fluffiness of the pancakes are just not recreate-able. If they were, I'd be making them every morning.
I had a very good brunch here...
Great southern food & their fried chicken is crispy and perfectly seasoned. Get the Mac & cheese & collard greens. Great beer!! My husband for the chicken fried steak & he loved it.
Ordered: three piece fried chicken, chicken and waffles, collard greens, mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, country fried steak, yams, etc.
Food - I was recommended to get the fried chicken. And I must say it was really well done. I like their crispiness and flavor. Their sides were pretty good too. The caramelized yam was pretty sweet.

WORST SERVICE EVER!!  I sat alone at the bar, for lunch before work, and waited 5 minutes for someone to bring me a menu then, after ordering ONE SANDWICH, I waited for THIRTY MINUTES before having to leave to go to work WITHOUT EVER GETTING MY FOOD. So now I get to go to work on an empty stomach, after WASTING MY TIME at this place.  The employees don't give a crap about customer service. EXTREMELY DISSAPPOINTED.

I love this place! The location is so-so but the food is really good! Came here with some friends for dinner on Halloween night. We waited a bit for a table since the place is kinda small. I would guess that it seats around 25 people or so. Anyway, I shared the pulled pork sandwich which comes with a side (I got mac and cheese) and ordered another side (collard greens). The portions are pretty big so it could probably be shared. I really enjoyed everything I got and was super full after even though I shared. There's just something about the bun that's really good! Also the mac and cheese was really creamy and tastey! My friends liked their country fried steaks which I thought was okay and their Arnold Palmers are really good here as well! I would definitely eat here again if I am ever in the area!

Whenever I want some southern cooking I come here.  It's easy to get to and the people are super.  My favorite  is the fried chicken.  Everything on the menu is worth trying.  I have ventured to try other places for some southern fried chicken and it was all a waste  of time.  Hard Knox is my favorite
Awesome soul food! Loved the oxtails which fell right off the bones. Will return here whenever I come back to SF.

This is some pretty damn tasty fried chicken, and well worth the twenty five minute wait just for carryout.  I'm finishing this tasty meal of collard greens, red beans and rice, and fried chicken, now.  My one complaint, a minor point given how good the rest of the meal was, is that they forgot to include the cornbread.  As my grandpa used to say - a pie without cheese is like a hug without a squeeze.  Seriously - try eating a slice of apple pie with some cheddar cheese on top - it's freaking delicious.  Same goes with southern food.  Gots to have some cornbread with southerns style cooking.  And they forgot.  Minus one star, but I'll be back.
I'll say this-- the one on the other side of the city is better. But this place is pretty darn good.

Went here last night and the service staff refused to take our order even after we waited 25 min and asked twice politely. The guy sitting next to us said the same thing had happened to him as well. We watched them take the order from 2 groups who were clearly regulars who walked in after us, the waitress even looked over at us while she did it as if to make a point....we get it. The bartender was embarassed and kept apologizing but said he could only take drink orders, not food. We eventually gave up and left....bartender gave us a drink for free and we tipped him a buck. We asked the guy sitting next to us who had waited 20 min to have his order taken and eventually got his food if it was worth it...he said the fried chicken was good but he wouldn't be coming back...neither will we.

This was my 4th or 5th time here. I love all things soul food. Today was absolutely the best experience to date. The staff made our day. The food was perfect and we really enjoyed ourselves! Great job to all the friendly wait staff who made us feel at home!
Small spot, always busy whenever I go. But I love this place, it's as good as roscoes in SoCal. Their cornbread is bomb!
Came here on a Friday date night with the boyfriend because he was craving ribs. I searched up some rib places and fell upon this place.

I recently moved to San Francisco from southern California and needed my fix of chicken and waffles.  There aren't any Roscoes' up here, but I think that Hard Knox is some fierce competition.  That's saying a lot from me since I love Roscoes and it's listed as one of the last things I would eat before I die.

Best fried chicken ever. I just moved into this neighborhood and am so glad it's an option for lunch and dinner. Really charming diner with great service. Have been a few times already and have ordered the fried chicken with two sides. I love the mash and gravy, and collard greens. Yum! Will be a regular here that's for sure.
FORGET FAST FOOD FOR A CHANGE!

It's taken me 4.5 years, but I'm finally writing my 100th Yelp review!  I was waiting until something special came along because I didn't want to waste this moment.  And Hard Knox Cafe in the Dogpatch is definitely worth this milestone.
I LOVE me some chicken & waffles!
A friend and myself came up for the Giant's game, and he talked about this place a lot, really hyped up that chicken. Why not, let's check it out.
I like this place. The food reminds me of any number of "family cooking" restaurants that I used to go to growing up.

Great neighborhood restaurant and bar with friendly staff and good southern food. The restaurant is small, so I recommend avoiding peak hours, unless you are willing to wait. We went and were able to score the last two seats at the bar. This is a no frills establishment that has large portions and good prices. I loved their cornbread muffins that are complimentary!

One of the best southern food restaurants in the Bay! I love their sides --mac and cheese, greens, cabbage, and yams. I absolutely love their short ribs. Their smothered gravy is good too if you're down for some Thanksgiving-like meal. They give you TWO cornbread muffins with your meal! HECK YES.
I really, really wanted to like this place. I've heard great things about it since I moved here 5 years ago.  And the owner is an Asian American from Texas, like myself.

We ordered Chicken & Waffles and the Oxtails dish. The fried chicken was pretty flavorful and crispy. But the waffles are not crispy enough. The oxtail dish was pretty good. It was very tender & falls off the bone.

If you're looking for locally-frequented Southern cuisine spot, you've found the right place. Hard Knox is a small gritty restaurant with corrugated metal sheet walls and TV screens behind the bar. The tables were full at 6PM on a Saturday, but we snagged two seats at the bar. Entrees come with two sides and two cornbread muffins.
Good food and service. Great for watching Sunday football - TV, food and mimosas along with a great selection of beers.

This cozy cafe stood true to its 1500 plus reviews. I went here today for late lunch. The parking although street parking was easy to find. This place servers corn bread muffins and 2 sides with entrees and the corn bread muffins were served fresh out of the oven and were delicious ( I am still drooling when writing this review). Their fried chicken was juicy, soft and so crispy, I could not stop eating it. I nibbled on the chicken for almost 10 minutes after I was full. I had to tell the waitress to take the plate away from me ;). The gumbo special (chicken and shrimp) was great and so was the country fried steak. The sides we ordered were Mac n cheese( really yum), yams( very tasty but I could have done without the cinnamon) and the potato salad( good). The portion size is really big! Next time i would not order more than 2 entrees for 3 people. And yes I am definitely going back!

BEST BBQ SAUCE EVER! Their service here is amazing. Really southern hospitality. Everything is said with a smile and anything you ask for is brought quickly. The ribs did take a while but that's because they are prepared AMAZINGLY. My bones shined they were so clean... I had to almost eat them with a fork because as soon as I picked them up the meat fell off the bone. No exaggeration. And the BBQ sauce is to die for. It's a small whole in the wall but the food is seriously the best BBQ especially since Big Nates closed. You will not be disappointed
I order smothered pork chops with collard greens and candy yams .... my husband ordered the chicken n waffles woth mac and cheese and rice with gravy.

This place deserves 5 stars, why? Let's start with customer service. Everyone here is friendly! I went here with my boyfriend and an Asian lady was our waitress. She was super nice and no she wasn't the type that's OVERLY nice and fake. She would start up conversations with us and making jokes. She served us our food, I had the fried chicken with mac and cheese and mashed potatoes and gravy. their chicken is everything. Perfect Not too salty, add some Louisiana hot sauce . After my boyfriend and I finished our dinner we paid, my forgetful ass forgot my debit card on the table. We were walking out to our car, our waitress running out to us screaming "EXCUSE ME!" And we looked back and she was holding my debit card. I was soooooo thankful and relieved! I hope their are more people like her in this world, cause that's true customer service. Thank you again to that lady if she ever comes across this review, I truly appreciate

This place is amazing. The corn bread is fresh out the oven and the BBQ chicken is made just right. Always have this with Mac and cheese and candy yams. Tried the waffle and chicken plate was also delicious but wasn't a big fan of the combo. Macy time I'll either get the fried chicken with the sides or just waffles.

Service was great the waitress funny. Good job jazmin.  The fried chicken was great very hot (temp). The Mac and cheese was creamy, I also had the red beans and rice that was cooked perfectly. My company had the sweet tea he was very impressed  he had like 3 glasses. He was also digging the yams.

BEST MAC AND CHEESE I'VE EVER HAD! The regular fridled chicken was good but it was a bit on the dry side to me. And the fries reminded me of in and out fries just a larger version. The cornbread was so yummy and sweet especially the top part where its crunchier. The service was nice and friendly. Although being seated so close next to two noisy women wasn't too great and kinda ruined my appetite, although there wasn't anything that we could do about it. Really wish I could've been seated further away.

First time going was yesterday.. service excellent.. very nice waiters/waitress.. I had the mac and cheese and catfish.. and potatoe salad.. mac/cheese good.. potatoe salad was good.. catfish.. could have been more seasoned..but was fried excellent..
Fried Chicken. Waffles. Mac and Cheese. Satisfy my hunger hard Knox!!! My go to place on lunch break. Staff is really nice. Food is better!!! ;)

The place seems a little dirty in the places when no one looks but I notice it. Ordered the fried chicken with mash potatoes and macaroni with cheese. Thought the mac was really cheesy in flavor. The fried chicken was pretty good and it came off the bone, I suck it right off. The 2 pieces of corn bread is so good with butter and it's my first time having the real deal. I've had packaged ones but this one changed my perspective. The flavoring was just so good in my mouth I wanted more and more. Didn't really like the waiters attitude on of them but not a bad experience.
I love this place.  First of all, the floor reminds me of a bowling alley or the gym floor in grade school.

Friend took me here just now.  Spare ribs were fall off the bone with a delicious sauce.  Great mac-n-cheese.    Great yams.  Real friendly service.  Oh and the corn bread was hot and pretty darn good too.
Service is quick. Chicken and waffles is my go to dish. Come early, it gets crowded in the Eve.

I love this place. Great food reasonably priced and served with a smile. The fried chicken is about as good as it gets and it's impossible to pick the sides. They are all great. It's not a trendy place. Just good simple comfort food. I'm running back.
Great spot, I go there frequently
Funghi Pizza DELICIOUS!!!! This was my favorite dish.

We always seem to come here for brunch.  Parking is easy.  The walk around the Dogpatch on a sunny day after a tasty brunch is perfection.  I enjoyed the french toast - hearty and not too sweet.  The baked egg and polpette is great and nice that it's served with some toasted bread.  Lastly, we always order the funghi pizza - if you enjoy mushrooms, you have to order this!  Service was prompt and always with a smile.  The decor is modern and the space is open which is great if you have children in the your party.  Last thing you want is your child bothering other patrons in a cramped dining area.
6mo - 1yr ago I would've given 5 stars but this place has sadly gone down hill.
What a good night .... there are so many places around the globe that do Pizza, however few do a great one. Well Picconi serve Pizzas that are truly outstanding and I just wish I lived closer.
I like this place. It's pretty casual, reasonably quiet, the food is good and the staff is patient and friendly. The margarita pizza's great.

Would be giving them 5 stars, but they failed the 'p2p' ratio - the price to portion ratio.  Portion sizes were just too small, especially if you plan to share.  I don't mind paying for great food, just make sure your customers aren't leaving hungry at the end of the meal.

Beautiful thoughtful food.  Wonderful decor and calming ambience ... a little bit of taking you on an adventure and out of your daily life for a couple hours..   We had a pasta (fig, chili, mint)  pizza, and starter to share.  All were excellent.  The funghi pizza was to die for.  You don't need to go to Italy to experience the best of Italian food.
Great food! Went on a Thursday night and the place was pleasantly busy. Very nice service and ambiance!
Back in July, as I was prepping to begin a 2 month-long vegan dietary lifestyle, I looked up the "internet" for best pizza places in San Francisco...
Fancy and cute af decor. You're gonna love the outside dining in good weather, and the lovely modern design and cool chairs inside.

Came here with some friends for pizza and were underwhelmed by both the pizza and the apathetic staff. The funghi was awesome, but the others were just average. I haven't been since they had the small cafe, so I did like the "ski chalet" vibe of their new restaurant.

Went in at 3pm ish, unfortunately missed the lunch. But what got me was how the server came out...she was a bit terse & rude in her way of saying they're only serving snacks.  Pity, I bookmarked this place to try, but am turned off now. So that's okay, we went to try the coffee as a chance of redemption, but didn't know who was working because employees kept coming in and out but not taking any orders...until a line formed after waiting a few minutes for an iced cup of joe ($3.50, tastes alright).

What a gem of a place this is! We stumbled across this place quite by accident when visiting a friend in Dogpatch & now we seek it out. Great pizzas & wine list, and the atmosphere is that of a small bustling cafe. Our favorite spot is sitting at the bar, where we can watch all of the activity in the open prep area. Cool spot. Will be getting my repeat business.
I was into this charming spot a few weeks ago for dinner with a friend.
I came here after reading Cherylynn N.'s review, she is my fave yelper to date! So go read her reviews if your feeling down, since they never fail to make me laugh and are informative as well.
Loved the mozzarella and the roasted cauliflowers!

An outstanding place with great food and the possibility to eat outside ! I loved going there for brunch on a beautiful sunny Sunday. Small portions but for an ok price, and the food is really delicate with a lot of attention to details - plus if you really want to get THAT stuffed, cross the street and check in at just for you. You should try the beignets they're absolutely great!

The squid salad was so good- acidic and salty and creamy all at the same time. Their pizza crust is great; I think that's what carries the pizza. The Bianca was good too, not too cheesy but not bland. The Margherita was a good basic pizza, but probably won't order it again. They gave us a fruit pizza coz they made it instead of a Bianca (it had nectarines, basil, bacon). However, I found a piece of hair in mine. Can't complain because it's free, and because ironically it was my favorite. Will still go back. Good stuff.

Simply put, the food is better than ever at this parkside hotspot in the dogpatch. We chose to dine outside on this very warm evening, especially since we were accompanied by 2 four legged companions.

So many delicious dishes, though a couple of misses. Loved loved the tagliatelle in a light creamy sauce with sweet and spicy notes (mint, fig, chili). The funghi pizza is for mushroom lovers! A puréed mushroom sauce with mushrooms and just a hint if cheese (wish there was more cheese actually, but still tasty). The meatballs were also very tasty but slightly overcooked on the outside - but the flavorful chunky tomato sauce made you forget about the burnt edges. I wasn't a huge fan of the picked vegetables. The waiter had praised the tomato salad but there were only about 4 tomato slices. Disappointing. Desserts were decent - ice cream sandwich and a deconstructed peach cobbler. We ordered all of that for 5 people. Didn't leave stuffed so you get a sense of the small portions. Very beautiful restaurant and delightful service.

Uneven. This is a cute bustling Dogpatch restaurant with potential, airy interior and open kitchen, high ceilings, nicely dressed casual crowd. We popped in on a busy Friday for a quick light bite. It was busy and we opted for immediate outside seating, though it was chilly.

Awesome, awesome, awesome. Had the squid appetizer which was delightful, the Funghi pizza (really good but not as amazing as the Salciccia), and the Salciccia pizza (to die for). Then for dessert had the warm stone fruit, cornbread crumble and creme fraiche ice cream which was also so good. Definitely coming back!!
The food here is precious, but equally importantly, the service here is second to none.  I love this place, and will drive all the way across town for a meal here.

Great wine selection and helpful server. We had a couple of starters that we good. The pizzas sounded delicious, but they were both too greasy/oily. The crusts were great, but they were too fatty to enjoy.

Some times athletes have good days. And some times even the most talented athletes have not-so-good days. Case in point, Colin Kaepernick's recent performance against the Chicago Bears. The same can be said about certain restaurants.
Love the ambiance, great service and delicious food.Easy parking.
Thanks to Cherylynn N., Piccino has become my FAVORITE place for gourmet pizza!

A great spot in the dog patch. we made reservations and were seated promptly. our server made some great recommendations for starters and shared plates - I actually cannot remember what we even got from the seasonal menu, but it was delicious. And we also got the bianca pizza which was also great. I also love a place that does wine carafes! We will be back.

Glad we got a reservation on an early Sunday evening, because this place got packed 30 minutes after we were seated. Upon stepping in, I thought the service would be a bit uppity and pretentious, but our server was actually nice and made sure we were okay with everything we needed. Our glasses were always filled.

Love the food here! I went with a friend there for a quick weekend lunch. We got there at around 12:30 and the restaurant was just getting busy. The space is very simply decorated with clean lines, but feels very comfortable. The broccoli and faro salad was really delicious and the prosciutto panini was outstanding! The bread was perfectly crusted and complements the prosciutto so well. The services were that good. We had to wait for over 20 minutes for the panini. However, when it actually came, it was worthy of the wait.

this is a great neighborhood restaurant. the place is bright and inviting, the ingredients are fresh and the food is tasty but not overly contrived. i've been once for dessert only and once for brunch and would love to check out dinner. i will say that their brunch egg dish was very small and was definitely not enough food to fill any man's hunger (my boyfriend had to eat half of my pizza to make up for it). still, it was a great meal overall. the french toast looks awesome so i'll be back for that!

My review is way overdue.  To put it mildly, I enjoy the abundance of great restaurants we have in SF and this has been my overall favorite for several years now.  The food is consistently innovative, beautifully seasonal and begs to be savored.  The wait staff is unfailingly interested in the quality of my meal...and, since their wine menu has many offerings I'm unfamiliar with, I now figure out what I want to order then ask the server for what would best complement.  They nail it every time - and, yes, it's fun to expand my wine knowledge.   Last, I have to mention the vibe of Piccino - welcoming, informal, and a place they make it so very easy to hang out and enjoy.  Thank you Piccino!

Review is for the coffee. Specifically the cold brew. AWESOME. Best cold brew I've had in the Bay Area. I think it's even better than the cold brew I've had in NYC. It has a ton of caffeine though so be warned. :)
Twice in one day? It must be pretty good.

Stopped by without a reservation but seating was available outside for dinner. Ordered an iced tea, homemade sausage pizza and zeppole for dessert.  Everything was fresh and delicious. Even my iced tea was better than I've had in a long time.  The zeppole are a must have so don't pass on them.  The service was excellent in the beginning but slowed considerably during prime dinner time.  The servers were very friendly and professional.  I'll definitely be back.
Solid, imaginative food every time.
One of my favorite spots. Consistently good food, love the ambiance, great service. Been coming here since they opened in the new spot and appreciate the architecture and space design.

Popped in for a seriously late lunch with my momma to this cute restaurant. Without a reservation, the only spot was at the chef's counter which was so much fun! Bianca and margherita pizzas with beer, then zepolis with Meyer lemon and huckleberries! Super great service, and the executive chef was so nice! Thanks guys!

We had malagousia zafeieakis,erbaluce castaldi,malagousia zafeirakis ,luwa and Financier.It is a nice hole in the wall restaurant in dogpatch area in SF.We went for desserts and it was brimming with people even at the bar.
Best chicken sloppy Joe I've ever had!

We used to love this place a lot and visit once at least every weekend. They had one of the best pancakes I've ever tasted, it was called the strawberry pancake with a side of lemon curd, it was the bomb, turned two non-pancake fans into pancake fans. The other place that makes super nice pancakes is Herbivore, I found the one in Berkeley makes better ones, but it's a bit far for every weekend.
Best tacos in SF! HH tacos for $2 mmm. (Get the pork or beef). Breakfast is amazing as well
Best BLT I've ever had. Seriously. Very, very yummy and memorable sandwiches. I am not a native of San Fran, but if I was - I'd visit here for lunch any day.

I've been to this place a couple of times, and it's great for a couple of reasons. First, the food is very good. My go-to brunch dish is the pork hash with eggs benedict, kale, and carrots. Pretty delicious.

I always get their famous fried chicken sandwich. I don't even look at the other items on the menu because I want every opportunity to have it. The brioche bread is filled with coleslaw and 2 slabs of fried chicken perfectly breaded. However for dessert I don't mind trying everything! I have had monkey bread (not my favorite but worth trying if you are interested), the cinnamon toast crunch, raisin and oatmeal cookie (basically an oatmeal cookie), and the apple jack cookie (sugar cookie with apple jacks, my personal favorite).  Baked goods are 50% off an hour before closing so plan accordingly. Enjoy and see you there!

A really great order and take a number joint. I was impressed with the smoked salmon dish. Generous with the salmon and served atop a latka-like potato zucchini base. The environment encourages soft brunch time conversations and the staff are friendly. In addition, the price is right. At $16, I handled salmon, a drink and my plate. I can see me spending more time and $$ here in the future.

I had heard of this place from one of my co-workers and she insisted I try their fried chicken sandwich.  She boasted about the great flavors and the amazing dressing; but having heard all of this before and getting throughly disappointed I didn't pay much attention.  As luck would have it, the next day I didn't have any other ideas for a lunch place so I decided to try this place that I had heard so much about.

whoever sets the menu back there and prepares, this is exactly my style.  healthful, wholesome, seasonal, fresh,creative, and tasty!   quality food.  plenty of vegetarian options too.  Last Sunday it was butternut squash scramble. yum!    a hidden gem.  much better than pretentious Whole Foods takeouts.
I came here for brunch with a friend. You order at the counter then grab a seat. There was plenty of indoor and outdoor seating available with no wait.

The atmosphere is great, have an artsy side to this place and a great place for a hangout and has outside seating and inside also. It offers from salads to pastry the pastry looks delicious and I should have got one.

O.M.G. Just had their Parmesan brussel sprouts for the first time and they are to die for. I'm not kidding. Even if you don't like BS, you will love these. They had a fresh balsamic-y dressing, hot peppers and topped with parmesan cheese. Leave work right now and go try them.

5star lunch spot. Quite original. Great distance from anchor brewing. Best burger I've ever had and that's saying something. Great menu. Great food to go. Brussels salad was well caramelized deliciously acidic with an appropriate but gratifying amount of of Asiago. The chix sandwich was moist and crispy and the slaw was a delightlful addition being both moist and crisp. Burger was just perfect: bacon perfect, egg perfect, dressing not too much and not too catsupy, brioche bun amazeballs. Both the fries and onion rings with accompanying sauces were perfect. Great lunch joint. Goddamn goddamn!!!!!!

I make it a point to go there once a week to get one of their sandwiches or salads.  The crusted fried chicken sandwich with slaw is to die for.  I share with others and they are equally in awe!  I also love the chicken sloppy joe with fritos and melted cheddar.  If you live in the Potrero Hill neighborhood you probably know about this great place; if not- make the trip and enjoy.  You won't regret it!  Fab desserts as well!
Straightupepic.

Quite possibly my favorite brunch place in SF!!  I hate paying 12.00 for breakfast that I can make myself for 3.00.  Market and Rye makes delicious brunch items that there is no way I could attempt at home!  Points for being fairly affordable.  Extra bonus points for being unpretentious! High quality ingredients, exciting flavor combinations, at a reasonable price and comfortable atmosphere.

This place looks great from the outside and once inside it's decorated nicely as well.  I love places that have board games you can grab and play.  We came here for an early morning breakfast on the weekend and it wasn't too packed.  We got the chicken sausage biscuit and the portions were enormous.  Unfortunately the flavor was lacking  and there wasn't anything standing out so much that would make me revisit or recommend this spot.
Biscuit breakfast sandwich is life changing.

lunch was horrible,  bun was old and crumbled off my corn flake fried chicken sandwich,  we ordered 4 different lunches and they were all suppose to come with fries, none of them did.  Definately NOT worth the wait,  or the money.  Will not be going back.
Loved the sandwich and salad.
This place is GOOD and CHEAP! Always very clean and efficient service when I come in the mornings.

I specifically came here for the cornflake crusted fried chicken sandwich and it was every bit amazingly delicious as I had hoped it would be. Also tried the churros with chocolate coffee dipping sauce and ate the whole thing even though I was already stuffed from the sandwich. Great place for brunch and there is outdoor seating!

Ordered  2-Mexicano-Mole Chicken Burgers ($10 each), 1-Large Fries ($4.00), 2-Pellegrino (($2.25)- $30.72!!! First off the "mole" sauce tasted more like French dressing and this is suppose to be the highlight?? The fries were mostly little stubs kinda like when you get to the end of the frozen bag of fries!!

What is a 5 star rating? Friendly service and a flavorful product. These guys have a great spot. Their menu is diverse. The food is hot. Large portions. And it tastes great (I got the breakfast burrito.) The price is good for what you get - you could easily split a meal between two people.  Parking is decent too. I will be back for sure.

This place rocks!!!! Good hours open when nobody else is, I had their BLT and the bacon has rosemary and brown sugar!!! My buddies had the fried chicken sandwich and they went back for seconds. The service was great and friendly to add.
The short:
The fried chicken sandwich here was money. Lightly breaded, thin sliced chicken breasts, fresh bread, and a heaping topping of coleslaw on top made this a perfect stop off for a yummy lunch! Yum!

I have tried very hard to like this place. I have had several bad experiences here, yet I come back. I think today was the last day I attempted to eat here. I have had several orders wrong. I mean not even close to what I ordered. I even came back once and they screwed it up again. Then today their register wasn't taking credit cards. Rather than reboot the system they continued to take cash from a long line of customers while I waited... And waited... And waited. They never rebooted the system. Now I have to go to work. I asked to speak to the manager. The man at he register claimed that was him. If he is management, I'm sorry for your business.

The baked eggs were pure good.But their service is pure slow and incomplete.. I don't need your arms around me,but a good customer service will help a lot and I'll certainly come back to give it a second chance..

Great Sunday Brunch with better than average food and servings. The kids that take your order and make shire that the ship stays on course do a fantastic job. If I had a restaurant, I would be trying to steal them for employment.  Excellent value.
Baked eggs a delicious. Let's just get that out of the way first.
Another day. Another 30min wait in line just to place my order.
Best freakin sandwiches ever - we had the corn flake chicken & the mojo pulled pork. Both awesome - worth waiting in line.
The fried chicken sandwich was great, but a bit on the dry side.
Yassssssss.
Tasty! Everything is made in house and if you sit upstairs you can watch the cooks do their thing.

The sandwich I had here was quite tasty. It was the pulled pork sandwich they had and the flavor combination was sweet yet savory too. Quite satisfying since I actually wanted to go to Kitchen Mojo, but they were closed and I really didn't want a sandwich. The place is quite big too. There is seating upstairs, outside, and downstairs. It looks a lot bigger than you expect. Recommend it! Especially if you're in the mood for a sandwich.
What's great here:
$5 breakfast burrito? Yes please! Went for breakfast, got the burrito and a side of potatoes and onions ($2). Super bomb, fairly priced no reason no to go.

Market & Rye has really good lunch sandwiches and I've been here many times for these delicious sandwiches. The staff here is also friendly and I like the casual cafeteria style ordering system. On the not-so-pleasant side, their brunch menu was a little disappointing. Maybe I had high expectations because of their delicious lunch sandwiches, but next time I am there for brunch, I'll order a pastry.

Our first time! Wonderful place in an eclectic neighborhood! Took my mom out for dinner and wanted a hip and cool place to take her. Poquitos fit the bill! Friendly and nice service! Tapas were fabulous! Our favs were the patatas  bravas and chorizo sliders and topped off with the plantain bunelos! We'll definitely come back for happy hour with friends when we return to SFO!
We came here after volunteering at the Food Bank and it was great.  I liked all the food, especially my pulled pork sandwich.  BF's steak was pretty good too.  Service is excellent and friendly.
This place gets one extra star for their ridiculous number of gluten-free options which are all helpfully marked with a little icon.
Food and drinks are the highlight of Poquito, which is a necessity as the decor and vibe are just ok.

I always come here for dinner. This time I tried their ceviche which btw was not great. It was cooked shrimp in cocktail sauce...NOT ceviche. Their chorizo sliders on gluten free bread was very very good! The red sangria was very tasty and they actually give you a full glass unlike other tapas places like lolo. The Chicken tacos was also yummy but nothing special. The churrasco was very good. If you can only try two dishes max then try the Churrasco and the chorizo sliders. The poquito fritos was a very good appetizer :D

This place totally made me rethink my perception of them.. Upon walking in on a Thursday night in the peak of dinner hour, the restaurant was nearly empty. We decided to stick around anyway and give it a go, and boy were we surprised! The drinks were really good -- I had a spicy mescal and also a classic margarita. Both were fresh and delicious. We got a variety of small plates -- the sliders, the Cuban sandwich, empanadas, to name a few. Everything we had was honestly pretty good, my only qualm is that I felt the price was a bit high for how small the portions were. Overall, I left a happy camper!
My cousin was in town for a conference near the ballpark so I picked this place since it was close by and got some good Yelp reviews.  I was pretty happy with the decision.
Environment, hospitality; things that should be considered. Couldn't even consider just one drink before wanting to leave. It's too bad.

Tonight I celebrated partner's b'day at the wonderful neighborhood gem. I had no idea that it had been in Dog Patch for the past 4 years. I was pleasantly shocked. Loved the place. We had chorizo sliders that were so good I almost took a bite out of my hand when it was gone; shrimp tacos with a jicama wrap, shrimp ceviche, coquettes and ended it with a guava empanadas that left me smiling. I had a sangria which was incredible and my partner had a St. Jen -gin, st. germain elderflower liqueur, bitters, cava. Service was great and owner Richard was warm, friendly and a damn good creator of splendid drinks and food.

Service, Drinks and food were excellent when my husband and I had dinner recently. We were looking for a place not too far from AT&T Park, to have dinner after an event on a Friday night. We arrived at 6:30 pm, just in time for Happy Hour. I was excited when I heard it was an Ecuadorean restaurant, having lived in Ecuador some years ago.

Maybe I am just so grateful to be back in the land of seasoning and fresh produce after a sojourn in bland Berlin. Maybe it's because this places reminds me of things I like about Spain as well how much I love all the different kinds of Latin American cuisine that San Francisco has to offer.

Poquito is a regular in our date spot rotation, as well as one of our favorite places to take friends and family. The food and drinks are consistently delicious and the staff is always friendly and accommodating. Some of our go-tos off of the menu include:
Hit or miss w/the drinks and pretty solid food.
Went to this place on a Tuesday evening and  several tables were available. Parking is really easy in the area since there isn't a lot of traffic, and the whole experience was enjoyable.
This place is great! Came here last night with a few of my girlfriends and we left completely satisfied.
Great food, awesome drinks, and friendly staff.  They are also good for events, if you rent out the bar, as I have done on more than one occassion.

Great cerviche, strong drinks, good presentation. We live nearby and my mom eats gluten-free, this place was perfect! I had the churrasco - Amazing, and huge, enough for two people for sure. The only thing I would suggest for them is to make sure the plates come out around the same time, especially entrees, instead of sporadically without explanation. One plate did come out pretty late into the meal, but they were apologetic and didn't charge us for it.

Delicious tapas and excellent, personable service. We tried the cubano sandwich, arepa con relleno, shrimp ceviche, and maduros--all delicious. Our waiter paid close attention to our needs and even took the time to learn our names. The place is small and dimly lit, which makes for a cozy atmosphere. Great place to go for dinner and conversation with friends.

Last minute decisions to go out for a nice dinner on a Friday night usually spell out disaster in San Francisco. Cue nightmares of packed restaurants, overflowing bars, reservation lists booked months in advance. But not here!

We found this restaurant on yelp after searching for gluten free options in SF on a Saturday night. Most places shut down by 10pm but this place was open. As we pulled up we were a bit apprehensive as they were winding down but after talking with our charming waiter and the owner, Richard, we soon discovered we were in good hands.  Richard explained the concept of Ecuadorian/Spanish food he experienced in his childhood and walked us through each dish- to our surprise most dishes were gluten free and we had an amazing meal.. Will definitely be back.
Best Fritada, empanads de viento(aire) and sweet plantains. Their Naranjilla juice is also quite good. Fish tacos are one of my favorites and I can't forget to mention the pisco sour (really good).

Solid place for Tapas and drinks. Extensive cocktail menu. The red snapper tacos were some of the best I've had; highly recommend. The sangria pitcher was tasty and a good value. The corn pancakes stuffed with cheese and green onions were awesome too. Service was pretty laid back and slow.

As a true ecuadorian (raised only, but born in New York), I can tell that Richard and Co. are doing a great job bringing the unique taste of Ecuadorian food to San Francisco. The tostado is so deliciously soft and tasty that you can just stop eating it, it is the andean preferred snack food. The Fritada, that amazing form of slow fried pork, is something that reminds me of my mom's house-made cooking. The Llapingachos are very well cooked, these potato cakes have to be very consistent and savory to hold the pan fried process. The "Empanadas de aire" (empanadas filled with air), are so traditional in my home town Quito as the perfect bite size snack to stop your hunger in the afternoon but not to fill you up in order to get you to "la merienda" (dinner), later.

Disappointing.  I came for the famous Happy Hour but a word of advice--Happy Hour some food is 1/2 off   BUT it's also 1/2 the size (seriously, the server told us this).  SO It seems like it's not a happy hour at all.

We were able to get a dinner reservation for two at the last minute on a Friday night.  The menu is basically Latin tapas.  We shared five plates between the two of us, and it was plenty of food.  Everything was pretty decent , but nothing was exceptional.  For the price and selection, this is a pretty good spot to grab a casual dinner.
The staff was nice but the atmosphere pretty dark and the food barely ok. It's a bar that has a few tables, not a restaurant.
Super sweet staff and good food. Loved the empanadas and the potatoes.

We had the fava beans, beet salad, mushroom empanada, potato pancake, and red snapper tacos. Nothing stood out -- not terrible, but all a bit greasy. The bartender was really nice though, and the St. Jen was a decent drink. Perhaps we ordered poorly. 3 drinks + food for two came to $80.

Stumbled upon Poquito while in San Francisco doing some pre-wedding partying with friends. We were seated right away and soon after met the owner Richard who explained and recommended some of their best dishes. Food and drinks were amazing but even better was the personal attention and conversation with Richard. He made us feel welcome and appreciated and even brought a round of drinks for the table when he heard we were getting married. Poquito was definitely a highlight of our trip. Thank you for the great time Richard!!

I came across this decent restaurant in Dogpatch recently while looking for a Latin/Tapas place.  And it totally hit the spot! I honestly have never been in this neighborhood before and was a tad curious. It was Friday night, the place was buzzing filled with young professionals.. reminds me of soma/mission probably. Anyways we were promptly greeted and seated, after inquiring about specials we ended up ordering:

Great little spot in the Dogpatch with delicious food.  We came in yesterday and got there early with our son.  We were the first ones in and it was perfect.  Our waiter was super helpful and gave us recommendations on what to get.
Unfortunately, Poquito was an underwhelming experience. The food was unmemorable and the atmosphere of the restaurant felt unfinished.  Perhaps the bar experience is a better one.
We love Poquito! Excellent Latin America tapas, great cocktail menu, friendly service, and usually has a free table, unless it's a little later on a weekend evening. Highly recommend!
