Had high hopes for this place because a friend had recommended it. We had reservations, and when we were seated, there were only 2 other occupied tables. 10 minutes went by before our drink orders were taken, another ten before we were told that the "Bloody Mary mix was out" and I needed to order another drink (um, don't  tell customers that you use a mix to make Bloody Mary's, it's gross), so I ordered a Sangria. ANOTHER 15 minutes go by before I get my drink. By now, most of the other tables were occupied and it was busy. EVEN so, after all that, no one came by to take our food order...however most of the tables that arrived way after us already had their drinks and food. Overall, poor service, uninspired food, "meh" drinks and uncomfortable stools.

I'd probably give this place 3.5 stars if that option existed... I met a friend there at 6:30 on a Thursday and the place was not crowded at all, so it was perfect for conversation. They have a nice bar and table seating up some stairs. If crowded, it would probably be noisy. We ordered coquetas and the maduros for appetizers, Fritada tacos and chicken sandwich for main.  We quite liked all the food, but the waitress got the order wrong and brought the chicken platter we inquired about, rather than the chicken sandwich we actually ordered.  In the end they took off one of the appetizers to compensate us for this, and for the record they offered to take the platter back and supply the sandwich, but we were short on time. The one waitress was a little spotty on checking if we needed anything. The way the error was handled was a little strange in that the waitress, obviously not having authority, first said nothing, then said the owner would "come talk to us", and finally just brought the bill with one appetizer credited. It was a small mistake and it should have been handled in a more straightforward way. All in all the food was good and I'd return for a meal.

Came here while visiting SF with a couple friends. It was a good place to pop into for a couple drinks and a snack. We tried the croquetas, maduros, and the shrimp tacos. Everything was tasty, but my favorite were the shrimp tacos. They're a little messy, but good. The cocktails are definitely worth a try. The place is clean and our server was pleasant. We went in during an off time, but looks like it could get crowded since there isn't ample amounts of seating.

Terrible service from overworked team. Empanadas were OK, drinks took FOREVER, they had to ask us a gazillion times what we'd ordered. Just a little empathy and follow through gets you to 3 stars. Try something else!

Food is decent but could have been better, less greasy and more meat in the empanada (sp?) fillings.  Bartender was nice and had good happy hour tips; don't bother ordering happy hour food because the portions are smaller.
Love it! Every restaurant in the Dogpatch is a winner. I intend to enjoy it now before the hospital opens & the Dogpatch becomes another overcrowded, can't find any parking neighborhood in the city.
Staff friendly, but overworked. Took forever to get food (actually had to remind server of what we ordered). Food was just average at best.

Seriously the best single origin Ethiopian and Guatemalan coffees I've had in my life. Bought several bags and took them back to my coffee shop in LA and said, "Make this." It kicks Ritual, Sumpton, Temple and Handsome's asses.

This place is cute. Love the ambiance of  it all. However, I was a bit disappointed that I couldn't get any of their espresso drinks iced and I'm not a big fan of just ice coffee. Only downside to the place. I like that the seating is outdoors, but I wonder what they do in the rain as the outdoor seating I think is the only seating.
Pricey but the best coffee in town! The ice coffee looks pretty good, and fancy. Haven't tried it yet.
Step right up! Get your hipster coffee from your hipster server and sit with your fellow hipsters on our cute little patio at Front Cafe! Hip Hip Hooray!
Great coffee, super friendly people, nice little laid back pocket of trees and tables.  I dig the small(er) drink size, at least with the lattes.  Heading over there now :)
Yum yum yum yum

great coffee, great service, very friendly and helpful staff. And, a pistachio croissant that is heavenly. all pastries are fresh daily and made in the neighborhood. a great alternative to some other potrero hill cafes that are not as good as they once were.

Right when my honey and I got there, they were so nice.  We usually like our coffee black, but the menu had fun concoctions on it.  That espresso float sounded spectacular, but I opted for the mocha.  It was super yum, not sweet but still rich.  The chocolate was an upgrade from the chocolate tablets that are used in filipino champorado.

I had an almond mocha and thought it was very sub par. That was the only milk substitute I was offered. This is the 3rd time I have noticed a "new" cafe not offering soy. I think that's a poor decision on their part. I didn't ask the reasoning behind it, but probably due to some "soy is bad for you" rumor that is going around. The prices of the drinks are high enough that they can buy organic/non-GMO soy milk and wouldn't have to sacrifice taste with gross almond milk lattes. Caffeine and sugar are bad for you too, didn't you hear?
Very nice everything: location and service. I can't wait to return!

The most mentioned phrases in reviews include: hipster, iced coffee, and mason jar.  Pretty much sums it up, but my Yelper soul mandates an extensive review instead of just quoting the top 3 Yelp recommendations.
Seriously, best coffee in the city, y'all. Cold brew is amazing, and every espresso drink is, too.

Really love the vibe and the coffee, but the experience can vary based on who is working  (i.e., there is one slower, incompetent woman who is a bit of a bummer). Really glad that they are in the neighborhood and impressed by their commitment to wearing ties.
Love love love it.

Love this little spot for a quick coffee run post-workout!  The cold brew iced coffee is delicious (don't get put off with the glass deposit included in the pricing) and I absolutely loved their ham & cheese sandwich and the granola! The neighborhood feel is real here and the latte was divine.  I'll definitely be back!
Fast service, and friendly too. Wr ordered cold brew coffees which came with mason jars for keeps. I recommend drinking them as is vs. adding milk as it changes the taste. Add sugar only.

How's my day going? Well, it started out with delicious cold brewed coffee in a takeaway mason jar + a kimchee pastry with Gruyere and black sesame seeds, so I'd say it's going awesomely. Go here, now.
I love the atmosphere and the ambiance of this little garage cafe. I would give them 5 stars if the coffee was not so expensive. I have had AMAZING coffee in the city for a few bucks cheaper!

A very cool and hip cafe...the staff are really friendly and very hip a bit on the pricy side... What the heck I was in the area anyway.  Would have giving it 5 stars..... No bathroom in sight. I have never heard of a high end cafe with no restrooms.....will be back if they fix that problem....

I'm being gracious with this one.  After all, there is no bathroom in the cafe, and that's not really "A-OK".  That's right!  Coffee is a diuretic.  I imagine after all of the research they did in order to roast and prepare coffee, they must have come across this fact.  What must have been their reasoning behind this?  Is it to keep out the nasties?  What about people that... drink coffee?  What to think if some one had more than one cup?  Certainly I won't find out about that.  Pity too, as it was a decent brew.  I guess they expect me to find another 'hole in the wall' after ordering.  Unfortunately, that would cut severely into my schedule (e.g. searching, parking, ordering again...).

I'm happy to have discovered this great little gem of a coffee shop. Neat, clean, industrial, hipster without the attitude (friendly staff), very much to the point. I would be a regular here, but I'm not in the neighborhood often. They make wonderful pour-over coffee and my colleague raved about the cold-brew. I didn't get a chance to buy their beans but they sell a few fancy single origin beans. Based on the pour-over I tried (yirgacheffe) the beans should be great as well.
Chemistry class.
Very cute , well designed space, stylish, hipster, small w/ sidewalk bench tables etc. great service, coffee & presentation. I love it all.
Hipster coffee at its finest.

Great iced coffee complete with a fancy ice cube in a mason jar.  Made me feel like a movie star.  Can't wait to try the affogato made with the best ice cream in town - Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.  Workers are super nice which can be a rarity at such a cool hipster spot.  Love love love.

Honestly, this placed sucked. I asked for iced coffee to go and after I drank out of the glass already the lady decided to tell me that they only serve to go drinks in mason jars that you have to pay for... So i was forced to pay like 5.25$ for a shitty ass coffee in a jar i didn't want. The only reason I am giving this place 2 stars is because the interior was cute...
Cute little coffee shop.

For the artisan coffee lovers of the world, this place rocks.  Small selection of brews/pour overs but enough that you still have to make a choice.  They also get the espresso drinkers a fix but unprentiously rename the latte/cappicino fad with the simple "espresso + milk" in two delicious sizes.  Highly recommend this spot.  Cool outdoors and awesome indoors too.

Hands down the best coffee I have ever had.  I would like to say 'best coffee in the universe' but I have only left the planet in a metaphorical sense, and sampling intergalactic coffee was not on my mind at the time.
Beautiful space, delicious cold brew. Excellent experience! Can't wait to go back again.

This place is literally situated in a garage, but it's one of the most charming coffee shops I've been to! It looks nice and clean inside and don't worry, it smells like freshly brewed coffee, not gasoline. Outside, they have several benches to sit at, each with a vase of fresh flowers.
Yummy latte and really friendly people!
The food is amazing! Chile relleno grilled cheese? What the what?! Great service.

Took a walk over here after a nice brunch at Plow.  It was a little hard to find, away from the restaurants on 18th St.  It was a warm day so tried the ice coffee.  They said the ice coffee is naturally sweet.  The coffee is strong and a little bitterness at the end.  Much better than watered down ice coffee at most places.  It comes in a mason jar (needed to leave a deposit) and with a single large cube of ice.  So if it is a little strong, let the ice melt a little.  I thought it was great on a warm day.
why won't they do affogatos to go?!
Excellent coffee served in a very cool converted garage space.  The iced coffee will keep you wired for hours!
Coffee over-extracted and bitter. Hot chocolate watery and dull. Nice foam art doesn't make up for it. I've had better in a suburban Subway in Melbourne.

I would give this place 6 stars if Yelp would offer it. It's very cool and the barista Christopher was extremely knowledgable and eager to educate me about coffee and brewing method. I ended up ordering 2 different drinks during my first visit.
nice new local spot, drink coffee out front at long picnic benches. nice people, great coffee, say hi.
Wow!

I ordered a veggie quesadilla on OrderAhead. The quesadilla was delicious, until I found a chunk of chicken in it. I'm vegetarian. It's extremely unprofessional and negligent to put meat into a vegetarian dish. I shouldn't have to comb through my food for meat. I sadly won't be going back.
Super tasty fast mexican food in the Dogpatch area.  And they give a lot of food too!

Came here after trying to go to Smokestack down the street (fail) and was pleasantly surprised! The food was delicious, although there weren't very many options to chose from. We ordered the chip and dips appetizer, its just a lot of salsa. So, it was pretty expensive for getting a lot of salsa and almost no guacamole. We also each got a taco plate with a mix of different taco meats. No complaints there!
This place is good, although funny thing is I have yet to try a burrito from here. Whenever co-workers and I are craving Mexican we order from here.
Great spot for a quick bite. Taco salad was a little smaller than what I am used to, but Im a big guy and I like to eat.
This place rivals any of the burrito joints in the mission but it's in the dog patch! Yum!

I love The New Spot! It's one of the top two best burrito places in Sf. Great prices, fresh meat, vegetarian options, great parking, friendly staff, very clean environment. Owners of this place are super cool and know how to do Latin food with excellence. Go out of your way to make a visit to this place.

I live close by this restaurant, and it's become my go-to place when I want some good filling food and I don't feel like cooking. I've been here quite a few times since my first review, and the service has never been friendly or fast or very good at all, but the food is delicious, and I like it so much that I can't help but give this place four stars. I'm a sucker for good Mexican food. If the service were friendly, I'd give this place five stars.
Bomb local food in our neighborhood. Salad burrito is super good for a light and tasty lunch.

This is my first yelp review. I like to stay anonymous with my eating out and food experience but this is the first time that I have felt compelled to respond to particularly rude service from the staff.
Came in for a late lunch with a friend on a thursday.

Little hole in the wall with surprisingly great food. Got 2 chicken tacos for $5.50 (not the cheapest, but it's SF) - perfectly grilled meat (and a lot of it) served like a traditional street taco with diced onions and cilantro. Fresh fried chips are fantastic, though I wish they served a chunky pico do gallo to go with them rather than a watery salsa.

The New Spot use to be my favorite go to spot here in Dog Patch until today. I have been gone for a year and I was utterly shocked when I picked up my burrito today.  I requested refried beans but instead received no beans at all in my burrito. It was also the worse burrito I have ever eaten.  I am so sad and angry to receive this type of food.  The service was also less than pleasant for me.  It's the last time that I will frequent the New Spot.  I really wish the owners were back in the restaurant.  Very, very disappointing.  If I could give it a zero star today it wouldn't be low enough.
This is one of my fav brunch rotations. The Juevos Rancheros are excellent!

This place is delicious. I had 2 fish tacos and a carne asada taco. The fish tacos were so good. The carne asada taco was just alright. It's definitely not your hole in the wall type of Mexican restaurant. This place is actually quite nice and it's a good ambiance. They plate their food really nicely and water is in a bottle here. That should give you an idea of how nice this place is. Although the place itself isn't super nice, the presentation of all the food is. Taste wise, it's not like Mission district good, but pretty good. I would come back since I don't work too far from it.
Im Salvadorean and like to venture off to new pupuserias every now and then.
So far I've tried and enjoyed very mucho!

Went to the new spot for lunch and called in a order was told it would be ready in fifteen minutes and got there paid and had to wait another 15 more minutes. The heavy set cashier looked and saw my order and ignored it until I asked someone else to get my order. By the time I recieved my order it was cold. So I give the customer service two stars. And the food was not that great do to the long wait....

Throwing this out there for fellow Keto-ers.  The New Spot Salad is Keto friendly, tasty, and filling.  Chicken, egg, avocado, cheese, fresh lettuce... tomatoes too, but just a few and you can pick 'em out.

My boyfriend and I always come and get chimichangas (I get chicken with everything,  he gets steak) and they are always beautiful AND delicious.  They grill their meat so its not greasy, and everything tastes so fresh. Its never extremely busy but there isnt much parking... I'm willing to walk lol
I love this place. Can you please please please be open Tuesday nights for dinner??? That would be amazing.
What a great place!  Wow, best food in the hood!  Excellent lunch spot.

Delicious breakfast burritos without beans. Bacon and chorizo. Avocado. The way I like them. I am such a pig, I had two today. Reminds me of Mexican food I ate in Santa Cruz. And their salsas are good!
I have only had take out from this place so I cannot comment on service or atmosphere.
Cheese enchilada (I asked for a veggie option) was absolutely incredible. Heaping side of guac, sour cream and pico de gallo with a bowl of beans and rice.  Definitely would recommend.
The carnitas burrito here is excellent.
I have been surviving off of their grilled Chicken breakfast burrito for years. So happy they are open later now! Carne asada Chimichanga blew my mind. Get it.
From what I have found in the Dogpatch, this is the best Mexican Food I can find on my lunch break!
So freaking good! Reasonably priced, Legit, authentic food. My fiancé & I had 2 pupusas & an order of panuchos & were full for dinner in under $20 including tip!
Tasty! I'm glad to hear that they've extended their hours because they are inevitably closed when I try to go :)
They now have extended hours as next door is The Third Rail and around the corner is Triple Voodoo Brewery where they'll deliver New Spot delectables right to your table or bar stool.

This place should be "The Wanna Be "! Simply, it sucks balls, royally! Customer service is beyond bad & the food has no authentic taste. Waste or throw your hard earn money on this trashy food is your choice. Just look at all the reviews which come from white people but they don't know authentic Mexican or Salvadoran food.
Almost $10 for a super burrito that is the same size as a regular burrito?  You gotta be kidding me.  Downtown price with kid's portion.  "Señor, I need a taco truck over here!".
Just a simple chicken burrito with pinto beans and their amazing salsa. PERFECTION. There's something about that chicken. Get it in a burrito, a taco, a salad, who cares it's FRIGGING AMAZING.

It was a cold day and this place was close by..so I decided to get  a soup...! I wanted a soup so badly since it would make me warm on this cold, cold, COLD (yes I know I'm good with words) day!!! I asked the server how big the soup was and he was like "it's huge!" so I was expecting a nice large soup.. maybe like other restaurant's large. Huge, but it's soup, so how could that fill up a fatty like me? So I also ordered an extra taco...carne asada..
Best Breakfast Burrito in this ca-razy town.  Get it with no meat and plantains.  SO TASTY!
had a carnitas torta.  not bad but quite soggy.  hard to taste the meat, which didn't seem like there was too much of.  i guess for $6.50 i can't complain too much.

This place is fantastic! I had the special "Crab Enchiladas" and it was so good! The enchiladas were stuffed with delicious crab meat! The plate came with guacamole, salsa, beans, sour cream and rice! I would highly recommend it! It was well worth it's price.

Alright folks.  If you haven't tried this hidden gem then you are in for a treat.  One of my favorite burrito spots in the city.  Everything on the menu is good.  If you're counting calories, try the burrito salad.  Hopefully they won't get pushed out of their location.  It seems the entire neighborhood is being knocked down and rebuilt.
Excellent burrito.

I got some shit treatment there last night. I just got out of a movie, and I was riding by on my scooter and heard some really massive sounds. I thought to myself, I'd like a whiskey and to listen to some live music. There was no doorman, I got confused, and entered the building. This dude literally pushed me physically out of the building, and checked my wrists for a wristband. I was like "I don't have one, but I'd like to come in." Doorman looked confused at me, and I was like "this is the front door, right?" And he said "hold on" and went back inside. At this point, I'm like, fuck this place. So I left. Look, Parkside, if you have a concert going on, fucking put a doorman outside the building so customers don't get manhandled as they try and enter and feel unwelcome. It's really uncool.
The good:
This place totally blows man, don't go, just stay home. The food is trash, the people smell bad, it's dirty and dicey and you don't belong man, you just don't.

I've seen quite a few punk shows here, and proximity to BotH makes it a good space to stop for food and drinks. All are at least fair and decently priced. The outdoor area is a good spot to meet with friends. I like the B movie projector too. Not sure about any reference to a biker bar, unless by that you mean little children bring pink tricycles with rainbow tassels on the ends of the handlebars to the back door to trade them for beer.
A typical biker bar. Not for the faint hearted. Drinks are cheap. Stickers everywhere. Nice outdoor spot. Again - not a dress nice place.
Gotta love tots and a beer on a sunny Saturday afternoon at Parkside! The outdoor area is covered and creates an atrium-like feeling, which most welcome once the wind gets blowing.

Thee Parkside is the cheapest, most unpretentious, food-loving place to see your favorite bands (or bands you've never heard of but will end up enjoying for the low, low price of... less than $15 if you stick around).

I would come here usually after work at UCSF. Been coming here for a couple of years now and a lot has changed. They used to have this bomb mac and cheese which they stopped serving. What I used to like about this place is that they used to allow you to spark a stogie in their back patio and eat/drink while you conversed with your friends. No biggie tho! I understand that the fire marshall probably started to be more strict about combusting near indoor environments.

The bar is cool and the bartendress sweet.  The food in the back kitchen was borderline hideous.  Fries appeared refried (at least twice), that margarita panini tasted like a glob of olive oil dumped between twice slices of bread with no real basil flavor.  The Caesar should have been foolproof, but even that was soggy and boring.
This place is great... But there's no more Mac and Cheese.

This was the first place I discovered on my own after relocating to The Bay. I enjoy Twang Sundays, free live folk music. The selection of events is impressive. I also like their brunch, Chiliquilles on point though they did once run out of champagne and wish they had offered me an alternative to my bottomless mimosa. Will be back again soon.
I have to agree with another reviewer that's missing the Guinness, but the new porter is o.k. It's not Guinness, but it's o.k. That being said, here's what Parkside has going for it.
Terrible food, rude staff, shitty acoustics. And overpriced alcohol. Not to mention no more smoking in outdoor patio, not even e cigs. This place is reaaaaallllly punk rock
Place seemed cool but staff had a stick in their ass and they served me a burnt chicken sandwich. Any place that serves up burnt food is not as cool as it seems.
If you are around the place you may come here to check great test of foods here for cheap price. Decoration is ok and nicely impressing first time T am sure.
Despite the flies that swarm around the trashcans that are near the serving window, it's a chill bar in Portrero Hill. The bathroom also smells surprising pleasant - I'm dead serious.
Straight up.

This is the only place in SF I know of where on certain nights you can hear authentic punk rock music. Really, where else? Not only that but the bartender remembers what we drink. It doesn't matter if months go by, she remembers us. Oh, and tater tots. Whats not to love?
This is a Dog-Friendly Bar that allows dogs who ARENT FRIENDLY.
One of the best burgers in the city. Very friendly prices.

Look, I am not a tough grader. But we had a terrible experience there last week. I love dive bars and live music, but the band on stage was AWFUL. We showed up on time, no one was ready, we got asked several times where our stamp was, we were held at the door even though we had tickets, the tap beer was skunky and the music sucked. I could SEE how it could be great, but it just wasn't. I'll try again with a different band and hope for better.
This place pulls old memories out of me.

If you're in it for the music this is a cool place to see a show.  Up close and personal.  The stage is low and the space is limited, so you have to pay attention to the music.  This is a good thing.  Many good bands have played at Thee Parkside.
they do not have a ping pong table anymore! but it's a legit dive bar with good burgers.
4 for the bar

I went to watch some live music and the place was packed. Thankfully we got their early and got to order some appetizers and drinks. The drinks were affordable and food was good. The service was quick and friendly.

BEWARE!!! Let me start this out by saying I love dive bars and this is the first time I'm writing a negative yelp review. I'm from Canada and was in town for a couple of days and tried to see a friend's band that was playing here. The door guy was extremely rude and laughed in my face while he took my ID and put it in his back pocket telling me it was a fake. Unfortunately because I was leaving the next morning there was no way to get it back and I had to go pay for a replacement when I got home. The bouncer there was definitely the most condescending powertripping bouncer I have come across.

This is definitely a dive bar, but a dive bar with some pretty tasty food. Love their tater tots! They are so crispy and crunchy. The sandwich I got and the burger my friend got weren't too bad either.
Frustrated one thing that there was no staffs service at the place.
i'm grimey, so I don't care that this place is also grimey and the bathroom doesn't have any lighting and is totally filthy and the bartenders are usually dicks. What I do care about is whiskey.
TOTAL DIVE. Totally great.

Went here to see The Dickies in July.  I had never been before.  It is a small cozy dive of a venue.  The music was loud and good.  The Dickies are punk icons and I can not believe I was able to see them, but also in a venue like this.

I've been back to Thee Parkside many times since my first review and it always feels a little like coming home--it reminds me so much of the places we used to see shows back when Sam S. and I were crazy young things.

I went to the this place with no expectations as well as little idea of what the place would be like...and left having made new friends - one of which was a man who shared his tater tots with me. SCORE!

Food was great. Global Soul Corner by chef Josie. I ate the spicy chicken sandwich, seasoned fries, and it was delicious! I saw a monster southern rock burger with pulled pork, fried onions, and corn battered bacon. Enough burger to feed 4. Great food.

I came to this place for the first time the other day. Loved the music, the place was not super crowded and the drinks were between 6-8 dollars. They also serve food and they have a back area where you can eat. The bartenders were very nice as well as the girl that took my food order. Dedinitely coming back!!
I came here in February to see The Dollyrots. (Check them out; they're awesome.)
TP's a dump, but it's fun to go to.  Variety of live music offerings for diverse audiences.  We enjoy "twang Sunday" afternoons - it's relaxed.
This place is awesome!  I've been here for drinks before softball games at Jackson Park, after work, on a Friday night and I've seen one show here.
$10 pitchers are gone.  Prices still aren't half bad, but damn.
I live close by and the staff and food are amazing!  Great place to come after a night of partying!

My first time here today. I came here to get some breakfast. There wasn't too many parking available . I had to circle around a few times. There was a waiting list I had to sign when I got there outside the door but the wait wasn't too long about 10 minutes. I ordered the Greg's scramble. It had onions spinach chicken apple sausage and cheese.  It was pretty good. Service was good. I would come here again to try the other things on menu.
Worth the wait on weekends for sure! Where else can you get beignets like this in San Francisco? So good!

Wow last review I wrote for this place was 2006, prior to that I've been frequenting this place since 1997, what more to say but I love this place! Cypress or regular mimosas in a pint glass mmmmkay girl, they know how I like my brunches!  Now that  the neighborhood has become a hotbed of real estate and crowds have changed with a  little mix from the OG's & the newbies, I will gladly wait in that new sunny parklet of theirs to be seated.  Just for you, feels just as it states it's name, yup I leave there feeling it was just for me. ***grins***
Clyde is the man. Good food. Good service. You will leave this place glad that you came.

An FYI to those dining alone: don't bother outside of off hours. They've recently changed their policy to only seat single diners at the counter and there are only 4 counter spots in the entire place (so be prepared to wait an hour).

We had a large group meeting here for breakfast today before a volunteer event. The cafe was absolutely wonderful to work with.  We kept going back and forth on how many people we'd have and they were really flexible. We had a reservation and sent our orders ahead of time so that we could make sure we were out in time to start our event.   I think we ended up around 20 and everyone was coming in at a different time.  They were really accommodating and even packaged up the meals for those that were late so we could take them to go.

I tried this place again for brunch with a friend, and my experience was even better than last time. The service was friendly, and the special I ordered was great. The beignets and scone were delicious, as always.
Long wait - pack your patience and you will be rewarded.

A long wait awaits you! But it's brunch in a trendy area in SF, so it comes with the territory. The beignets are pretty good, but overall it's just breakfast food. As much as I appreciate it, overall, my thing with brunch is that I can make most of the stuff on my own. My girlfriend got the veggie breakfast burrito and it was sopping wet- as if they cooked the veg and didn't drain the liquid before putting it in the burrito, gross. My chorizo and eggs were fine, nothing special. The chorizo didn't have much spice to it so I had to load it up with cholula. Service was great though.

What struck me the most about this place is that the employees seemed to truly like working there. They worked quickly, and yet, were really friendly. They also filled in for each other as needed, so there was never a wait for any part of the service. Why is good service so rare these days? The vibe is relaxed and I enjoyed the show posters  for decor.
DONT COME HERE THE OWNER HAS A HORRIBLE ATTITUDE!!!!!!!!!

We order the Beignets and oh my god! Def try it :) we ordered some to go too! The Egg Benedict was good. I had a combo of oatmeal and buckwheat pancakes. I liked the oatmeal one more. Also the Bleu Scramble was tasty as well :) above all, their customer service is amazing!

This seems to be THE brunch spot in the Dogpatch. They have a large brunch menu. I ordered the huevos rancheros. The sauce is supposed to be HOT, and as a plus, they offer a vegetarian version. Mmmmmm, it's not hot, but it's thick and they're not stingy with it. Unfortunately, it's a lil' too tomatopastey for me. Ranchero sauce should be loaded with onions, garlic, and tomato chunks (my mom still makes the best I've ever had). The tortillas weren't fried and crunchy, so it left me feeling like I'd just eaten a lazy version of huevos rancheros. On the plus, they hooked me up with egg whites and massive amounts of cheddah for this dish, service was polite and efficient, and we got to sit outside and take in the hood. I'd go back to try something different, but not any of their Latin offerings.
so far i've only tried the beignets.. they are B average. Next is the main dishes .

UGH!!!!!! This place is so horrible. The design of the restaurant is asanine. Standing out front waiting for a table was the beginning of the lamest dining experience I can recall. The tables outside are on each side of a coffee cart across the sidewalk from the door. It was cramped, people sit right on the sidewalk, and the servers have to walk across the sidewalk to get to them.

My girlfriend and I were originally going to go to Serpentine for brunch this past Sunday, but the Cowboys game ran late and we missed our reservation. Instead, we walked across the street to get brunch, cuz by this time, it was almost 2:30pm.
Hubby and I went Friday late morning,  no wait. :) in short- Great service(!) and yummy food.
Ohh this cafe is really just for me!!! Love having breakfasts here. Big variety of delicious menu selections! Always fast and friendly service.

Best beignets!  Far better than Brenda's French Soul Food, and worth the three-mile walk from Polk Street.   Eggs Benedict are served on choice of English muffin or whole-wheat bread, but the Hollandaise sauce could use a touch of lemon juice.   Friendly and solicitous servers.  Great place for an afternoon breakfast.

In a city where start up / tech douchery is quickly eroding authenticity and replacing it was the status quo and the "idea of cool" there is hope...the Just for You Cafe. This small diner embodies all that was right about San Francisco. Simple but creative menu, corky decor and the perfect amount of cynicism, efficiency and friendliness from the staff. I love it there. Keep doing what you're doing. Yay!
Awesome, our entire group really enjoyed everything.  Really nice employees today. (finished review from 5/17/2014)
One of my favorite breakfast/brunch spots.  The food is consistently good and the homemade cornbread, biscuits etc. are yummy.  Don't miss the mimosa served in a pint glass!

Beignets.  That should be enough of a reason to come here.  If it is not, then the rest of the San Fransico inspired menu should have at least one thing to fill you up.  Their daily specials are inspired.  Parking is their only problem.

Came here on a Sunday for brunch. The wait was not long at all. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. The food was alright. I ordered Greg's scramble with chicken apple sausage. It came with home fries and corn bread. The dish was alright. Nothing to rave about, but also nothing to complain about either.
I wanted to like this place. The food wasn't bad (I had the eggs on cornbread with chili con carne). As I was sitting waiting for my food, a roach crawled across the table.

Great breakfast spot with delicious menu options. We got beignets to start and they were fresh-made and still warm. So delicious with the (heavy) dusty of powdered sugar. Loved the fresh OJ and the scrambles, etc. The only thing I wasn't too thrilled about was the chocolate chip scone. It was more of a chocolate chip bread than scone.
Amazing place to get brunch!! Friendly staff, excellent seevice, cool vibe and sweet posters on the walls. Cozy neighborhood. Food is delish!!

Of all the breakfast spots I could go to in SF, this is the only joint I'll hit up. The coffee is strong & always refilled, every breakfast option will not disappoint, and the staff is unpretentious. It's definitely a great place to start your day.

My husband and I have been here a couple of times and the food has never disappointed us.  Great flavors, well cooked and a cozy atmosphere.  The beignets take us back to new orleans and we always get a plate to share each time we go.  The wait is never too long on the weekends and there is outdoor seating for those of you with dogs.

My friend Jay and his lady Carla, took me here the last time I was in the Bay area. I ordered the eggs benedict with home fries. Amazing. The server was also nice. Its an intimate cafe so it was kind of tight and noisy.  Pretty small, so we had to share our table with 2 strangers that were on a date. They kept interrupting our conversation. They also have 2 tables in front of the cafe if you wanted to eat outside. Overall it was a good experience. Carla was also nice enough to pay for our meals.

Great off the beaten path NON tourist trap brunch spot.  Neighborhood is definitely a bit run down, but this was a great find.  Beignets were great, scramble was fantastic, service was wonderful.  We loved it.  Nice to go somewhere in SF and find parking easily and feel like we were eating among locals, not among a bunch of tourists from Kansas City.

Hands down this place has it right! The food is well thought out yet whimsical! A huge feeling of home. Mimosas are out of this world along with everything else! We are from LA and will come back every chance we get! Most excellent!
I absolutely loved this place! I have checked out a few other brunch places in SF and this is definitely one of my favorites!
In the absence of a good Malaysian oyster omelette anywhere in SF, I am so happy I can find a decadent alternative in Just for You's hangtown fry. Crunchy, eggy, and seafoody. Glorious.
Sunday morning brunches are one of my favorite things in the world.

Beignets are the bomb diggity. I ate an entire order of three last time... They're that good. Not too much of the rum aftertaste like in other beignets. The other food is kinda flavorless though. Not enough seasoning

I'm a huge fan of eating breakfast out -- like a little mini vacation!  I had heard about this place from several people, including a couple seated next to us at the Kabuki watching "Chef" -- they told us the Beignets were the best they had ever tasted outside of the Cafe du Monde in New Orleans.
You don't get 1,000 reviews for sucking.

Homemade sandwich bread made from pizza dough? It was my first time at Just For You and it had that bustling, friendly feeling of old San Francisco with all kinds of awesome retro posters (including for an old Berkeley punk band). My friend didn't clue me in about their bread made from pizza dough (which you can buy to do). Drool.

Went to the 'tasteProject: Mushroom last night and was blown away! The dishes were unique, adventurous, and highlighted the main ingredient in delicious ways. The Wagyu Beef Carpaccio was the star of the evening both in presentation and complex, balanced taste and texture. The wine pairings were well executed. The King Trumpet Tarte Tatin was a solid dish until I took a sip of the Brooks Tethys Late Harvest Riesling and everything lifted and brightened - the caramelized cocoa nibs sealed the deal. The finale (Candy Cap French-Style Macaron) left a maple taste in my palate which stayed with me for hours as I enjoyed my nightcap(s). The owner of Far West Funghi, Ian Garrone, was there to talk about the product and his process - I had no idea mushroom were so interesting!

I went to this restaurant at the suggestion of a family member who is a SF police officer. I got a simple and excellent pastrami sandwich. Parking was easy. Even better, the same family owns the chocolate store two doors down so that is where I got dessert.

REVIEW #300.  I know it makes no sense to write a latergram review now, with theLab currently on hiatus until Aug 31st, 2014 as they are performing experiments--pun intended--to try out new concepts.  As one of my SF favorites in being a one-stop-shop combining my two favorite things i.e. science and food (Isabella B., I agree with you!), I've been saving my 300th review for this geeky culinary masterpiece of a place.  And in the spirit of theLab, I'm going to write this review in the format of a scientific manuscript.

As a science geek and a foodie, this place hits the spot in more ways than one. Luckily I was able to enjoy such a spot with two other fellow science geeks/foodies, the No1DP (IT) and a friend/classmate/Yelper (CLS). Nerds unite!
This hiatus seriously affects my quality of life in Dogpatch because these guys know what to do with food. I am mourning their absence.

I planned to go to the museum in Dogpatch and so as usual I searched around on the Internet for any good food there I would want to try and then I saw theLab's ice-cream with brownies looked really great!

Recently rebranded as theLab from the original chocolateLab, probably because they want you to know that this is not just a dessert place. And it isn't. The regular food food is also fantastic, in spite of the fact that it is all prepared in a tiny kitchen not much bigger than a food truck.

My friend and I were trying to go to Just for You for brunch but the line was cray. We came in here, got a table immediately, and I got a delicious polenta, egg, veggie assembly. It was utterly delicious. The server was no-nonsense and awesome.
very interesting menu...had a great selection of beers that I wasn't familiar with, and the food was really good. Didn't save room for dessert, but it looked like it'd be pretty darn good.

Admittedly, I only had two of the beers here - but this place is awesome!! Two of my friend work here, so there's that. One of them is from a family involved in producing alcohol and the other is one of the biggest foodies and lover of good food I know. Sitting outside is just about as pleasant as can be. Great colors around and comfortable intimate seating. Heaters abound above because even though you're enjoying that slight breeze it is indeed a bit chilly as you look out at the neighborhood trees. The beers were so excellent. The beer that I and a friend split were the cheapest (around 7$ each I believe, but they were so worth it!) on the menu and wow they were delicious. A whole new type of beer. If you're around the studios or near third street at all, it's worth it to travel West a little bit and hit up this tiny little spot that packs a punch!

We usually go to Just For You across the street but the wait was too long so we decided to check out The Lab. What an amazing brunch. The pastries and dishes were delicious. Every dish. The quiche, eggs and polenta, the French toast. Delicious. We are definitely coming back again and again.
CHOCOLATE GENIUS!!
This would be a five-star had the portions been larger.  Food quality was outstanding but quantity was insufficient.
Delicious!
My buddies told me that a way to a girl's heart is through chocolate, and lots of it...so this is my go to place for a first date.
Excellent place!  Must try in Dogpatch!

I loveddddd their desserts!! It's such a cute place to grab dessert or coffee after dinner! The actual place is pretty small but there was empty seating when I came around 7 pm. Water was served in a 1000 mL Erlenmeyer flask (for the science nerds out there!), which matched their "theLAB" decor. I was sort of sad that the glasses were not beakers and that other drinks were not served in test tubes and petri dishes, and why were the tables like lab benches? Why didn't  the servers wear lab coats and lab goggles! So many potential opportunities to make this restaurant like a lab! But on a more serious note, the chocolate lab cake was beautiful! The presentation was gorgeous and too pretty to eat! The cake was on one side topped with chocolate pearls and there was a chocolate bowl with chocolate ice cream in it. I also ordered the affogato (espresso shot with ice cream). That was really good! Definitely hit the spot. I would have just ordered that as a dessert and skipped the cake, but if you're going to come here, you might as well get the cake because that's what they're famous for.

I guess Chocolate Lab is now theLab. Maybe people were thinking it was a dog groomer? Or more likely people didn't know that this place has wonderful savory options in addition to their fantastic desserts and cocktails.

Decadent, rich, neighborhood chocolate hit joint. It's one of those blink-and-you'll-miss-it places, nestled on the corner of a not oft-traveled street. I love the warmth of the interior and the quirkiness of the service. The tables are lab-bench like, and the water is delivered in beakers! Too cute. My friends and I came here after dinner and everyone wanted chocolate. This place knew how we were feeling.  The lab cake, brownie a la mode, and carrot cake (which actually had chocolate mousse!) were superb. I couldn't have asked for more or less. The servings were great for sharing and for satisfying that chocolate itch! I only wish they had given me a little chocolate pitcher like all my friends who ordered the brownie.....

I encountered this cute little restaurant one night when my honey and I were craving some dessert after a dinner date. We wanted something chocolatey and after some Yelp searching, we decided to check this place out. It's location in the Dogpatch means that we did not have much trouble finding parking. The restaurant is small, but we were seated right away.

I was in the area all day. First I stopped in for coffee and a so so muffin. I was talked into coming back for dinner by the people I was with all day.  WOW.  GO for dinner or dessert.  I had a lovely lamb dish with perfect polenta and asparagus. A very nice a different spinach soup with a lemony tang (lemon grass? verbena?) very friendly service and got to watch the chef at work.
People, Listen! Open your mind sometimes.

Only came here for dessert, after having dinner in the local Dog Patch area.  They have a decent dessert selection.  We went for the brownie with one scoop of salted caramel ice cream  and one vanilla and it was amazingly simple and good. Side car of hot fudge to taste for your liking/licking was nice too.  The dessert portions are not super huge, but definitely shareable.  The regular dinner menu looked interesting and worth a look next time I'm in the area.

I've been to Chocolate Lab several times, but I waited until now to write the review. Great concept for a restaurant, friendly staff, and, .... chocolate! The desserts are inspired and you can tell that the chef puts great care and thought into them. This place is a gem, and a one-of-a-kind find for SF, a city with so much to offer when it comes to food.

I had a salad which tasted fresh and yummy! But I mainly went for the chocolate desserts, and I was not disappointed. If I'm ever craving some delicious chocolate desserts I will go straight to the Chocolate Lab.

Just a little too precious for me... The pot pie had nice big chunks of crunchy carrots and tender chicken, but overall the broth seemed a little too thin and healthy. I'm not asking for the fat and cream of a Swanson's TV dinner, but for $14 a pot pie the size of a teacup better be one of the most scrumptious ones I've ever had.
this review is specifically for the ice cream sundae.

Today I was craving for something sweet and of course my body headed to the best place to have some sweet unforgettable  dessert. I love this place, it's small but still has lots of charm and of course the entire menu is wonderful (I had been here more than once). I ordered today the Sunday ice cream. The dish was rich and at the same time refreshing. The dessert was with brown caramel ice-cream (which of course was made from scratch there ), I find brown caramel ice cream tends to be a little bitter, however this one was perfect- since the richness of the caramel mixes perfectly with the dark chocolate sauce.  The dish was balanced with great amount of home made Marshmallow and the Marshmallow's  tenderness made this dish to be the best Sunday dish that I ever ate in my life.

My biggest advice is to keep it strictly dessert when coming here. Dessert is 5 stars. There is a reason they used to be called Chocolate Lab. Came here for brunch today and found the brunch items to be a bit lackluster. But I'll be back for chocolate in the future!

This is a fun place to meet friends for Happy Hour! Had a great selection of cheese and meat along with chocolate desserts. Love the chic and casual atmosphere and service is excellent! You can even bring your furry friends with you and sit outdoors :)

I had the carrotcake with coffee.  My wife had the chocolate sunday.  The carrotcake was almost 2 pretty 2 eat.  Really tasty it came with a tiny bowl of ice cream.  Very smooth and tasted clean..The Sunday was very rich. It was a hearty portion.  If u like chocolate order this..u got ice cream, big marshmallows..Perfect dessert place.. Parking could be a problem.. I went on a rainy weekday. I found a spot on 3rd street .. Service is excellent.. Decor felt clean. I mistakenly called the Sunday a cheez cake and I can't edit the pic.. out
Excellent service with friendly staff.
Wow I was just at Chocolate Lab for the Valentine's Day pre-fixe dinner and it was wonderful!

For pure, unrestrained indulgence, it's hard to imagine a more satisfying experience than taking a fork and spoon in hand and taking a tour through the dessert menu here, a jaw-dropping array of delectables helpfully labeled "chocolate+sweet."   It would be a mistake, though, to limit your horizons to just the chocolate realm, as the Lab turns out simple, tasty -  even light - bistro fare, an acceptably modest tune-up for the inevitable gorging that occurs after the meal.

Actually came here on a Saturday back in December.  No wait, awesome service,  delicious desserts, & great parking.  Everything that is hard to find in the city. My husband & I endulged in the chocolate cake & a root beer float.  Genius to put their own bitter sweet chocolate sauce in the bottom of the glass. Added so much depth to the drink. And to top it off, Virgils root beer is the best. The cake was so moist & the right amount of sweet & bitter from the dark chocolate. Loved how it was wrapped in an edible "pastry wrapper." That too was made of chocolate. We are dying to go back to try the entrees.

Came here with a bunch of science grad students. Food was very good, as was dessert. Reasonable price with nice presentation and environment. Missing the last star because the waiter wasn't totally on his game... he was kind and attentive but didn't give us particularly appealing descriptions of the options for dinner.
Love this place, their menu is limited but it's quality. I got their bacon, polenta and vegetables with a sticky bun and oh so yummy in my tummy.
Fantastic food, fantastic service, lovely atmosphere. You are advised to go now while the prices are reasonable and before the crowds descend (...as they surely will).

Oh Chocolate Lab, how are you so delicious?! My husband and I visited recently with a local friend and split three desserts between us. All were heavenly but my favorite was the s'mores tartine. Amazing.

I came here with a girl friend one night because we were craving desserts. The place is super cute and packed with really dressed up couples... definitely a great place to bring a date or significant other. The carrot cake is to die for.
This place is low key and delicious. It is basic sandwiches made-to-order with fresh ingredients. I like both the chicken salad and roast beef. The Dutch roll has a nice crisp to it.
Dutch crunch was a bit rough;  sandwiches were on average $6/medium size.

We made a point of visiting Ike's place after seeing it on TV - I love a good sandwich but find it hard to find a decent one on Gluten free bread. Well...I can honestly say I was blown away by the 'Tony Soprano' on gluten free bread - tasty beyond belief!!
I would give it a 5, but HappyCow doesn't let you on places that aren't 100% veg. ) :
Average sandwich shop nothing special stood out. Can get the same thing at your local liquor store. Meats weren't as fresh as I'd like, but prices were decent ($6.00-6.50)

In the hierarchy of sandwich places in the city, The Sandwich Shop is squarely, definitively average. Even the price (~$6-6.50 for a sandwich) strikes me as somewhat average, though I agree it's a cheaper lunch option than most places you'll find in the city.

This place is awesome. I went in for breakfast and got an English muffin and croissant with bacon, egg, and cheese. Both were delicious. The prices are cheap, and the service is attentive and friendly. A great place to get a quick takeout breakfast or lunch.

Dude ranting about the meat quality needs to lighten up.  The turkey is the same pressed turkey you find at Togos or that Oscar Meyer puts out.  Is it fresh turkey cut right from the breast of a freshly roasted bird?  No.  Is it poison?  No.  Believe me, you will eat far worse things this week than some processed turkey- and it's still better for you than ham!

I love this place. It is my go-to spot for quick, cheap, no-frills, entirely lovely lunch. The service is pro: these ladies make a huge sandwich fast and efficiently. Yes, there is a line at noon. That's because people in the neighborhood know to come here for lunch.
Wow, seriously gang, if you can't tell the difference between "turkey roll" and real turkey, you should not be posting on YELP.
In terms of value and quality, this place rocks.  I had the chicken teriyaki sandwich to go ... and because of work, I didn't even get to eat it until two hours later.  And it was still amazing.
VERY inexpensive, but the sandwiches are worse than Subway. Don't waste your time here.

It is called The Sandwich Shop but I always order the chicken terayaki over rice meal which comes with a side of vegetables and pot stickers for under $8 out the door. You can get it two ways depending on how you feel, spicy or regular.

Came here for lunch in the Dogpatch as our back-up lunch option was a slightly disappointed.  I ordered a chicken breast sandwich with everything on it.  It was made to order, but I just felt that there was nothing special about the sandwich (felt very much like a more expensive subway).   May come back from time to time, but not sure I would recommend as a "go-to" sandwich place when there are others in the city that are more worthwhile.
First time there today. It was awesome. Try the Chicken Teriyaki sandwich. All of their sandwiches are good sized and reasonably priced. Friendly staff who move the line quickly.

Walked here for lunch one day during work. The place is alright. It's good. They have unique sandwiches which is pretty cool I think. They have Terayaki and the pricing is inexpensive. There's no seating inside which is fine because I was taking it to go. They're pretty nice staff though. There's quite a few sandwiches on the menu. I wouldn't say it's like as amazing as Ike's, but it's good and decent. I would come back as it's better than the sandwiches that are closer to me where I work.
I've been a regular at the Sandwich shop for about six years..... Wow.

Don't waste your time with this sorry excuse of an eatery.  Beyond the fact that I waited patiently in the very cramped line for 20 minutes watching the owner watch his employees do all his work for him. what bothered me most is when I finally got to the counter, there was a thick film of grime over the splash guard, mud on the floor, and the sandwiches didn't even look all that great with the flies laying their eggs all over the food. I don't know why anyone would give this place good reviews (perhaps it's the lack of taste that has recently flooded SF) because the whole experience was rather disgusting if you ask me.  After 20 minutes of continually noticing unsanitary conditions, I opted to simply not have lunch.  save your money and don't support rude, filthy business.  I presume all the 5 star reviews are people who work in the area who are too lazy to bring a bag lunch, considering there aren't any other eats around.

Value, value, value!  Whilst perusing the restaurant/cafe circuit in San Francisco, there is nothing more pleasing than finding a local spot that serves up fresh and delicious ingredients at bargain basement prices.
$6 big sandwiches?  great value. while they don't skimp on the meat, don't expect the finest quality (not gonna stop me).  the $1 avocado add-on is actually a lot of avocado.
Great sandwiches for about $6.00. There is a wide variety of meats to choose from and they definitely pack on the condiments. Went on a Saturday afternoon and the line wasn't long, either.
Pure awesomeness. The service is really friendly and the sandwiches are fresh. Great neighborhood go to.

I've been going here for a long time when I crave a stacked sandwich. Their sandwiches are simple yet insanely delicious, satisfying, and obviously filling. The ladies there are always incredibly nice and offer to a piece of salami for my dog when I show up with him and have to tie him up outside. Favorite sandwich spot in the City, if I had to choose.
Fantastic deli sandwiches. About as good as it gets for a deli. Pastrami is my go to. Korean food is also tasty. Fair prices
Solid sandwiches, better price. They're all about $6-7, and they're very generous with the fillings. This place is great.
Very fresh and good sandwiches. I was a little hesitant of trying the food, because the place doesn't look the cleanest, but it's good!

This place is surprisingly awesome. It's so nondescript that even when I had the address and was specifically trying to find it I walked past it twice. The people who work there are always incredibly cheerful and nice. The sandwiches are really cheap and really good. And they have a pretty big variety. The meat ball sub is good and Korean BBQ was excellent. We order here for lunch from work all the time.
This shop is terrific. I've been twice and really like the service and food!. The Sandwich Shop is serving fresh veggies on great bread topped just the way you like. I'm going back...

Great sandwiches, good prices, friendly staff and good sized portions. The dutch crunch bread is a bit too sweet for me but the soft roll is perfect if the sandwich is warmed up. So far I have tried the turkey, tuna, pastrami, roast beef, and meat ball. Tuna is by far my favorite. Call ahead if you don't enjoy waiting in line during peak lunch hours.
Always love the sandwiches here - great bread, lots of fresh ingredients. Pastrami sandwich and the turkey sandwich are both great.
I love this place!
I don't know how this shop has been around but to me it's a Dogpatch institution. Anyone who works and lives in Dogpatch goes here for a basic, no frills, and generously stuffed sandwich.

Inexpensive, average sandwiches.  Honestly, I'm not sure what all the fuss is about.  I've picked up sandwiches here twice and have been pretty underwhelmed.  I had the cheese and avocado today and it was about as good as a Subway veggie sandwich.  If you want a true 4 or 5 star sandwich, this is not your spot.  I can understand why the Deli Board or Pal's Takeaway have legions of fans, but this place just isn't in the same category.

Had the chicken salad sandwich here and I thought it tasted very good and was huge.  I sandwich is enough for two meals.  It also had a bit more salt than I like because I was dying of thirst most of the afternoon.  Lucky for me, I had plenty of water so didn't end up dying.

Delicious sandwiches at rock bottom prices. $5.50 for chicken salad on dutch crunch,all the toppings, tomato, lettuce, peppers, pickles and more! The friendly sandwich maker topped my sandwich with a slice of salami for my dog meebo. Thursday is korean food day, bibimbap, bulgogi sandos and bowls. Dont know why it took me so long to stop by, i recommend you do yourself a favor and try it out. Take your food to espirit park around the corner for a fresh air lunch.

GREAT sandwich made special by the bread and super fresh ingredients.  Wonderful Dutch crunch and tuna salad.  And cheap for a nice hefty sandwich!  $6 including cheese and tax.  Not the most convenient location, but it's great to know about this place if you're nearby.

Oh snaps cheers and raves.  This is by far my fave sandwich shop. Honestly, there is not a single deli in this town or others that even comes close to comparing! By far the very best service and fresh ingredients and best pricing you will find in this town...Thank you Linda, Beth, Victoria, Terry and Lindas Mom....

Finding food portions that match their price point is quite a luxury nowadays. This luxury can be found at TSS. They have a vegetarian option that is Jaime L.-approved, as it is chock-full of fresh ingredients. All the sandwiches at this joint are filled to the brim and require two-handed action, so come prepared to devote a little TLC to your lunchtime sammie. Indulge and enjoy! This is America after all.

I was visiting SF for 2 weeks from Texas and came here with a friend for lunch. Very generic name: The Sandwich Shop. The place is small and there's no place to sit but their sandwiches are pretty amazing. They are large and full of fresh ingredients, especially the freshly cut avocados (cut right front of you instead of pre-prepped)! I'm a frequent Subway customer and these sandwiches are definitely better. The 3 ladies working there are really nice and apparently they've been here for 5 years already. If I worked in the Mission Bay area, I would definitely come here much more often.
Sandwiches are pretty good but the price is right.
Good fish and quality.

I never really venture out to the Potrero Hill but I went to meet a friend who lives there and am so glad I did. The street Umi was on is so cute, totally remind me of Portland, Oregon which I adore! We showed up right around 5:45 and were able to be seated right away (the restaurant was relatively empty when we got there but filled up by 6:30 or so). The restaurant is nice inside, friendly, laid back feel and there's this little indoor/outdoor porch was is great!

On a night several months back to see Jay Brannan at Bottom of the Hill, this was a perfect occasion for us to eat first at this delicious and romantic restaurant. We got to dine out on their patio with a modern candle at our table. An evening of good sake and great sushi dishes were soon to follow!

Been coming here for years for casual meals or to get takeout and it's always been great. But the truly top-notch experience was when I brought a few friends in for omakase with a sake pairing the owner put together for us. Akiko has nothing on this place except higher prices. 6 stars.

Let me just preface with that being from Seattle I am only now realizing how spoiled I've been in terms of good and most importantly cheap sushi. So this fine afternoon I was as usual in search of a sushi fix. We were in Potrero area so him popped up on our yelp radar. I noticed two dollar signs on their yelp page and figured that a two dollar sign is the same as a two dollar yelp sign in Seattle....wrong. But I'm getting ahead of myself. When we got to the place we were the first customers in the restaurant, the ambience is very pleasant and they have patio and indoor seating. We sat on the patio since the day was pretty warm. My boyfriend and I ordered some beer and Oh man the red ale beer was legit. I recommend. Recently I have been all about uni and scallops nigiri so we went with that, some hamachi Kama from the specials menu and a salmon, spicy tuna and avocado roll. The roll was good but the rest I found just regular. The hotate wasn't too flavorful and the uni was kind of small. I don't know maybe I just need to lower my standards and forget the great sushi life I had in Seattle but man for all those things we paid like $80 and left kind of hungry :/
The food is good. My favorites are the Spicy Tuna, the Beef Neri Maki, and the Katsu Asparagus.

Great service, really friendly! Very cute environment and convenient to my location. Prices are alright, only 1 shrimp when ordering the bento box with shrimp and vegetable tempura, otherwise the food is decent. I will definitely be going back.

Looks like it had good sushi. But I wouldn't know. We waited for about 15 minutes without being acknowledged after being seated. Even if busy, failure to make eye contact or set expectations about when an order will be taken is just bad service.

Good folks here.  The menu is not doctrinaire traditional Japanese-as-sold-San Francisco faire, but the food is excellent, especially the Butterfish.  A strong plus for me, with Celiac Disease, is that they can accommodate the need to eat gluten free, which requires some care on top of the cost.

I've been to Umi twice now. The set up is a little strange; you walk in through the kitchen area (good to know that you can see your food being prepared) and the host will come and seat you inside or outside. The fish is fresh and of high quality, but the menu falls victim to the Westernization of Japanese cuisine. I really believe that I would enjoy Umi more if the rolls were not the Rainbow/California Roll or crab meat-filled stereotypes that dominate subpar Japanese restaurants.
They use sustainably caught fish  and organic produce! I went there for lunch and the service was fast, food was yummy.

Recommend!! This is some of the best sushi in SF and my husband and I go here at least 1-2 times a week. The fish is always fresh and tastes awesome. I really enjoy how they have unique selections of different varieties of fish all the time... for instance, they have different kinds of salmon or different kinds of tuna etc. The service is fantastic too.

Atmosphere was good.  Arrived here early around 5pm, and ordered a few rolls of sushi.  First off, something wasn't right about the sushi.  Not sure if it was chefs, but the rolls was tasteless.  Supposedly with sushi, you should not have to use a lot of soy n sauce and wasabi mixture, and i realized that the rice was not seasoned at all.  It was like white rice with fresh fish.  The quality of the fish just seemed average.  I suggest staying away from Uni.  When Uni is not fresh, it leaves a foul taste in your mouth.  Hours after that dinner, I had to use the bathroom quite frequently.  Not sure how people are rating this place and what their palates are, but they are way off, unless i came on a bad day.
Pretty tasty Japanese food, but tbh at this price point, the experience could have been better.  Either lower your prices or up your food game!

Now this is a great sushi joint! I came here once with a group of friends and everything we ordered was very fresh. Most of the sushi rolls were more traditional, which I appreciated. I'd definitely come here again!

Our order came quickly. We had seaweed salad, Salmon (from Scotland) sashimi, local albacore tuna nigiri, spicy hotate roll, fire dragon roll, shrimp tempura roll, and portrero roll. Wanted to get the escolar too but they were out - sad.  The tempura roll needed the unagi sauce and they only had Sriracha instead of spicy mayo for the spicy rolls.  Though all was fresh and delicious somehow I wasn't really wowed by it. Oh, but they also do have black sesame ice cream which is a rare find in restaurants!

Just fine for sushi. Fish was fresh, and presentation was good, about par for the city. A hair pricey for a casual, neighborhood joint perhaps. They'll provide a small cup of tea if you ask. Cheapest bottle of beer will run you $9.

High qualitaaaaay.  Hard to find good sushi in the city and this place has got it.  If you're a sushi lover then no need for me to explain what's good.  Just get whatever classic nigiri you like and it'll be tasty.  Keeping it simple and fresh.

I found Umi on Yelp because I didn't want to travel to mid-SF during peak hours of traffic.  This restaurant was such a great find!  They are more of a traditional sushi / nigiri restaurant, so don't expect too many extravagant "California" style rolls.  They have really, really fresh fish.  I came here with my girlfriend and it's a great date spot.  It's quite interesting, as they don't serve Sapporo.  All of the beers they have are very unique such as Ichigo and Orion (an Okinawan brew).
Excellent service and fish quality. More variety would make Umi almost perfect.
i had come here once before but this time i wanted to outdo myself and come twice in one week. we walked in on a weekday and were seated right away.

Great service, space and amazing sashimi!  I wholeheartedly recommend the sashimi platter.  A great place for a first date, a get together with friends or a business luncheon.  Small venue, but ample space.  Does that sound weird?  You just have to see it for yourself.

Sushi was fantastic! You'll love this place if your a sashimi/nigiri lover. The fish is very fresh and is not previously frozen or artificially treated for color. Four stars was only due to service which was very average.

My favorite sushi spot in SF. I live pretty far away but always find a reason to make the trek to Potrero Hill. Their fish is SO fresh and everything tastes amazing. I love how small and peaceful the restaurant is as well. They have indoor seating but also a covered patio which is nice if it's warm out. The service is outstanding too. I don't think. Also, I noticed last time I was there that their health score is 100! No one ever gets 100!!
Super tasty lunch- the Combo A was perfect with a small salad (delicious dressing!), mini chirashi and mini anago don. And I love that they take lunch reservations!

Lunch specials are the way to go here. Beef negi maki and gindara misoyaki are really good and come with a plate of white rice and cup of miso, but my uni had a gross ammonia aftertaste--marks of not-that-fresh sea urchin. I was so disappointed with the uni and spicy tuna roll. Skip the sushi. Come for the lunch specials.
Good Stuff:

We went to Umi on a Sunday night, which is historically not the best night for sushi restaurants depending on delivery times.  However, we were hoping to find some good sushi at a reasonable price.  The price was fine: we walked out after a bunch of roles and nigiri less than $70 for two, after tip, with no alcohol.

Love the consistency in the quality of food here. I always order the same things and they always taste good: grilled eggplant, california kani handroll, shrimp tempura handroll, beef wrapped asparagus and enoki.

Oh yelp... You seem to always fail me when it comes to sushi restaurants... I really wanted to like this place and the reviews seemed so promising... But yelp, I've started noticing a trend when it comes to sushi restaurant reviews... If you're smart, you can figure this out yourself. Being the only Asian in an Asian restaurant raises a few flags. Anyway, let's put that aside. The rolls are on the small side along with the appetizers. The sashimi is also a bit overpriced. I think it was 5 pieces for $18 if I recall correctly. Pretty expensive. However, I do have to point out that I really appreciate that they list the location of where the fish came from which is probably the culprit for such high prices. Either way, the food was not very memorable and the service was not that great either. Our waitress didn't check on us very often since we sat inside. When we left, we saw her wiping down the walls in their outdoor patio.

Outdoor seating area was very cool. We sat inside though in a cramped humid and hot 15x20 space. Service was passable but nothing to write home about. Waitress was not very attentive and was cold and off standish. Edamame came out cold- not hot with the sprinkled salt. Also don't know where the sushi chefs were trained, but all the fish slices still had bones and scales/skin.

Cute little Japanese restaurant with a decent sized menu. Portions are small but everything is fresh. We tried the agedashi tofu, blanched spinach and three rolls. Good place to go to for a light meal!

Atmosphere was pleasant, but that was pretty much all to the place. Sushi was not interesting at all. Did not find it particularly fresh. The rice quality was more suited to a sushi buffet, dense and tasteless. Sake was ok and reasonably priced. 1 star for the food, 2 for the atmosphere. Despite good service, would not go back.

Hands down the freshest, most delicious sushi in SF. Actually, because the seafood is sustainable, and the staff and service are stellar, this is one of two sushi restaurants that I eat at in SF. Here is an example of stellar service, which is absent (repeat absent) in most SF restaurants:  after two visits to Umi the waitress remembered to bring me the gluten free menu and to serve water without ice - both without me saying a word.
Living in Soma, this is our go-to sushi place, as it's a short drive, always has parking, and (unbelievably) always seems to have a short or nonexistent wait.  The best things to order:

Awesome sushi in a laid back setting. The uni they have is to die for and the staff are very friendly. Its a great place because you can have both a bit of a crazy sake night and also a very chill evening and you feel at home and natural at both times
This review is based on a weeknight dining experience for two people.
Its a cute neighborhood place, not a destination.

Umi was a hidden gem in Potrero Hill. The atmosphere of Umi was great, I love the open kitchen next door with big windows to see through from the outside. Next to the kitchen is the dinner area. For a warm enough night, it would be fun to sit in their outside dinning area.
A hidden spot in the neighborhoods of Potrero Hill.
JBs Place is a cool deli/diner tucked in ok the back side of Potrero Hill.  The dining room is very clean, they have a fully stocked display case with a variety of beverages.

Ive been hearing great reviews before coming here, so i decided to try them and Im so glad that I did! . They have a great variety of food for breakfast, lunch but I must say their chicken ceaser salad is so good, on top of that it is served hot. Please try it,  you will love it!
The sandwiches are VERY GOOD. Produce is great. Cashier spends too much time talking with customers when other people need to be helped though.

This place rocks. Good food and good people. I love getting the cheese burger here. I love combing here. They also know my name. I also love that this place has free WiFi. I would like to see more JB's Place locations.

Another vote for JB's place! We went to grab a lunch and had  great service and excellent food. Sandwiches and fries mainly, but very generous portions and well cooked. The place was like an oven on a hot day so we decided to take away, if it had been cooler I would have liked to stay and savour the atmosphere. If I am ever in the area again I will be straight back for the steak sandwich again.
Great sandwiches. Pro, they open a 6am, Con, they close at 4pm

If you're looking for a good burger or a bomb breakfast burrito then do yourself a favor and hit this place up. They're a very inexpensive place so if for some freakish reason why you don't like it then at least you didn't spend much money.

So it was my first time and out of town. I'm a home chef and like to think that I know good food... So I used yelp to help me and they did. I had the grilled steak sandwich add tomatoes and lettuce and it was pretty damn good plus it looked like they had many other great sandwiches :) cheers
My wife and I frickin' love this place. We get breakfast and or lunch there whenever we're around Potrero Hill, and EVERYTHING tastes good.

I took my 5 year old here for lunch, it's right around the corner from Jackson Playground in Potrero. He had a grilled cheese and I had falafel wrap. We also shared a package of fresh cut fruit. While appearances make this place look like a run of the mill sandwich/snack shop, everything was surprisingly tasty and made with care. The environment and employees were super friendly. If you get the falafel wrap make sure to get it spicy, the sauce added an excellent dimension to an already solid meal. I want to come back and try more menu items.

Come here almost everyday for lunch! There's no other sandwich place around 17th and Kansas other than Two sons. The owner is nice and so are the workers. Good deli sandwiches. I usually get the turkey on white!
This place is great and is super convenient since it's located right next to my school. The sandwiches are huge and delicious, along with everything else.

JB's!!!!! Love this place! This place takes care of my breakfast cravings! Great breakfast and lunch place! Great service and good hearty food!!! Coffee is great, eggs any style with bacon and hash browns are a must when getting breakfast here! If you're looking for some great food at an affordable price JB's shouldn't disappoint!

This place is a favorite of mine just because its close to my school and its the only decent burger place around. The Bacon Cheeseburger is a perfect fit of mine because the meat is cooked just right,cheese,tomatoes, onions,and comes with crispy fries. Its also quick and cheap too..Lol what does JB's stand for I wonder, could it stand for deliciousness.. Hpmh. The only complaints I have are is sometimes the table can be a little dirty, but besides that nothing else, Honestly I should stop following the hype of my school, but this place is just too GOOd!.
I'm borderline devastated that I've worked three blocks away from JB's for over three years, and I have JUST NOW come here for a sandwich.

I have never ordered anything from JB's that I wasn't completely satisfied with. The staff is very helpful and friendly.Nasir the owner, always has a smile and interacts with all of his customers! My only complaint if you get there during the lunch rush you may not be able to dine in. :)

At first I thought it was an abandoned business from years ago. Commonly walking by in the evening, this "JB's Place" that often popped up on my Yelp searches seemed elusive. It took me many months before I read the business hours and learned they were open for breakfast & lunch. Then I made a point to try it out.
switched to the Bacon, Egg and Cheers (on english muffin)
The Food is great, fresh and yummy. Its a great friendly place to grab lunch....But the biggest treat is Nas...He is the owner, and a great guy. Period. Love it there.
Oh JB's.  How I heart you and your hot lunch specials and cold pasta salads.
san francisco, you have a lot of delicious and wonderful things.  that is true.
I work in the hood. We have lots of options, but JB's get my money.
Love this place! Food is great and there is a lot of variety. Best Turkey Burger of my life. And, cheap!

Great place to pick up a quick lunch.  Had a turkey on sourdough. Service is fast and the place is no frills. Portion size is good. Worked out in a pinch since we didn't have time to try Plow before our tour at Anchor Brewery
Recently went again and ordered the BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich = FTW!!!!!!!!!
Great food and great service. Nasa is such a nice guy, the kids love stopping by to say hi.
A standard deli that does the job. It's a nice, "I want a quick lunch out of the office" place but not a "I want a long, relaxing lunch away from the office" place.
Great cheap sandwiches. My favorite is meatloaf and meatball sandwiches. The service is pretty fast and they have a great range of drinks.
I've never ordered anything here that wasn't absolutely delicious. The staff are some of the friendliest people I've ever met. Go go go!

This is one of our very few options for lunch around work, and is totally solid, sandwich/burger type lunch food. I usually get either a hot pastrami sandwich, or a veggie delight, and am never disappointed.
