After running some errands the other day I was looking for a sandwich place and JB's Place came up so I thought I'd give it a try.  Warning that parking might be difficult around here depending on the time you stop by.  Luckily I found a spot relatively close.  I had read about the Spicy Buffalo Chicken Burger so that's what I got and I was pleased with it.  I would say that it lacked on the spicy part but it was really tasty and the fires were really good as well.

I needed to fill my gullet because it was 10am and I hadn't eaten a thing! While at Concentra for PT around the corner, I asked what was close and they pointed me here....Whoa!  Waaaay above my expectations for this industrial area...but perfect none the less.

It's close to my office. I got a great deal on Google Offers and decided to give it a try. Got the pulled pork sandwich with french fries. A pretty big sandwich and a good amount of fries. The prices are reasonable. Will let the office know.
I'm excited cuz its  one of the few places that serve Pork sausage.

its a cool lil neighborhood spot and the samiches are good.  since my regular burger joint was closed for renovations i came to JB's.  now i really had a hankerin for a fat ass burger wit mushrooms and bacon.  so that s what i ordered.  when the food came about 20 minutes later i realized that my burger was a frozen patty.  totally turned me off.  like i said...the samiches are good but the burgers were a total disappointment...use fresh ground chuck wit your fresh veggies.
This is a great neighborhood lunch place. I had the cheeseburger and french fry combo. Tip: call in your order to avoid the wait.

Nice little sandwich shop in Potrero Hill. I have worked within a few blocks of this place for 3 years and have enjoyed getting sandwiches here once every few weeks. The staff are all great and the food is delish- but there isn't much more than sandwiches, burgers, salads and some breakfast food. BUT if you are in the mood for those things this place is perfect.

Nice spot with a full staff, and variety, variety.  Talking about variety of deli salads like Whole Foods or a Safeway, bottled drinks, sandwiches, and burgers.  Its small, and close to a hole in a wall, but definitely has a local feel to it.  Not overly decorated, but just simple and solely based on food and options.  You even have candy bars and chips sold by the cashier, so how "corner store" is that.   A lot of locals come during lunch to fill their tummies.  They serve breakfast till 11 a.m. and lunch.  Limited seating though, get there before noon if you want to grab a seat.  My friend ordered the special.  It was a pork loin sandwich with fries.  He said it wasn't too bad.  I had the tuna melt with cheddar and fries.  Its a tuna melt, so I can't bitch.  Though I got a honest tea with it and it came out to $8. 50. Was hoping they would throw fries in there for me, but it cost an extra buck.  Very clean spot and cute.  Definitely a go to spot to drop by if your craving a regular sandwich or burger, but that's it. . . .food is regular, so that's why I'm giving it an ok.

Not a bad little sandwich shop.  After living in the neighborhood for several years JB's Place has been closed every day we've gone by.  We know that's because we're really not the target market here.  Its open from 6am to 4pm Monday through Friday so I just haven't been awake in the neighborhood a when they are open.  Today I was up early so I went for breakfast with my wife and ordered the churizo and egg plate with hash brown.    Both we're decent and well made.  Neither were spectacular but they were large portions and good.  coffee was average but drinkable.  Typical restaurant coffee,  If you like the local roaster type coffee you won't like it.  But if you normally drink Starbucks,  it'll be fine.

Be careful when ordering over the phone at JBs. I ordered a grilled steak sandwich with meat and cheese only, which I repeated twice when I called in the order. When I arrived to pick it up, I was surprised to find a grilled chicken sandwich with cheese, onions, peppers and mushrooms. Disappointing because that steak sandwich is the main reason I hit up JBs.
Simply amazing! Let's hope the great establishment is around for a very long time. The service was excellent, the food is simply to die for and the deserts were just what the DR ordered.
Visited Aperto on a weeknight and were settled immediately. It's the perfect place for date night, cozy and intimate!

We went for brunch and I'm really glad we had a gift certificate.  Because I would have been pissed if I spent my own money here.  Apparently my reservation was unnecessary since I was asked if I had one, but not asked who I was when I said yes.  The place was packed with strollers blocking aisles, I had to move my table over and try the get the "mother" to move the stroller blocking the aisle twice.  No help from staff.  Never got spoons, had to beg for water refills and cream.  The waitress actually watched me stir my coffee with the knife handle and did nothing.  The volume was loud with screaming children, which I really didn't get since there didn't appear to be a kids' menu and the food was not child friendly.

Aperto is a neighborhood gem in the heart of Potrero. Everybody's standing in line down the street at Plow, but honestly, I think Aperto's brunch is just as great. The benedicts, french toast, specials -- all well-executed with unique twists. And I've rarely had to wait for a table. Also love dinner here; classically-refined Italian fare in a cozy and intimate setting.

Went there for brunch today. I ordered Tagliolini Pepati, which seems to be popular based on the Yelp pictures. The noodle was not al dente, but I like soft noodle anyway. My husband ordered the special, Huevos Rancheros, it was okay, nothing special.

This is, by far, one of our favorite restaurants in the city. We love coming here, deciding on what to get (staring at the specials board for way too long) and then "debating" about getting the chocolate cake at the beginning of the meal (we always get it). The staff is super friendly and the wine selection is delicious too.

Food is great and staff was nice. Everything went fast, a little to fast. We, party of two shared an entrée, had two different mains and dessert with coffee and had the check in under one hour from when we where seated.

Oh man, this place. You know when you walk into a restaurant and you immediate think "I have to take [insert friend/family/romantic interest] here?" I want to take everyone here. It has ambiance without feeling over the top and when the sun is setting the entire place lights up with a warm glow. It's the kind of place you imagine having dinner with your long term girlfriend and realizing over the amazing Pepati that you want to spend the rest of your life with them.
Wonderful, intimate Italian.  But don't try to order yourself!  Follow the Yelp recos, which are spot on:

Got to try the eggs benedict, sweet pepper fritatta and pork belly panini. All were sooo good. The sauce for the eggs benedict was super delicious, the fritatta fish overall was pretty good, and the pork belly..just wow. "They should have a warning on it" -my mom hahaha it was sooo good. Definitely worth coming here
Good food! The grilled chicken sandwich is very tasty!! Their home fries is yummy! !  Fettuccine is tasty tooo and above all services is excellent
Really like it. Tried it four times and was always good.

Figs stuff with gorgonzola wrapped in prosciutto + pork belly with seared green beans & Black Mission fig agrodolce + watermelon & cuke salad + goat cheese sformata  + Risotto, zucchini, squash blossoms, sweet corn, thyme, goat cheese + bottle of recommended wine (they were out of their Pino Noir) = a full-bodied de-light. My boyfriend was dancing in his seat in ecstasy (literally). ZERO attitude at this place, zero- just warm & friendly.
Came here for dinner because my good friend said this was a delicious Italian place that the bookmarked.

After finding this place for mother's day, I've wanted to go back. This cute little Italian neighborhood gem is fantastic. My fiance and I have been back twice getting the burrata, mussels, fish, bacon paparadelle, tagliolini and ravioli. It's a great place to do date nights and take parents to.
YUM. Was pleasantly surprised when I got a table here on a friday night with no wait. Great food, but not super busy. The burrata appetizer is a must.

Italian restaurants usually have a price range that makes me cringe, but we settled on Aperto because Chez Maman was packed even at 10pm and everything else in the area was closed.  What I thought was a last-resort over-priced Italian restaurant turned out to be an amazing dinner worth its price.
Inattentive service, food was bland

Every time I go here it's just what I want, good food, gracious service, an all-around pleasant dinner. We've been going here for about 15 years and the menu changes seasonally and there are specials every night (one fish, one meat). The wine list has gotten better recently thanks to the new maitre'd. And our favorite waiter (Carlos) is still there, charming as ever. The rest of the staff is always attentive and if your waiter is busy, there is always someone else to get you what you need. The food is Italian and this is one of the few restaurants where I will eat risotto, they do an excellent job of it. The prices are extremely reasonable for SF.
This restaurant never disappoints me. From the food to their service, Apertos gets an A+ in my books!

Came across this place before we headed to Anchor Brewing Company for a tour. Had brunch. The food was really really good. I had the Smoked Salmon plate which was grilled bread with lemon marscapone cheese, onions, capers and smoked salmon. My girlfriend had their grilled chicken sandwich with onions and peppers on foccacia. They also gave us a little tasting of their muffins of the day - one coconut and one pineapple. Both were very good. Prices were decent. I was delightfully surprised.
I've eaten at this little Italian restaurant that a friend brought me to, on a few occasions now . Portrero Hill has any fine restaurants undiscovered by people who never go to Portrero Hill.
The kitchen is back! Went back again (another tuesday), and the Pepati was awesome - fresh, succulent noodles, crispy not-too-chewy bacon, and just enough jalapeños for some heat.

Highly recommended!  We dined there on Friday, June 27, 2014.  The two starters were outstanding.  We brought our own bottle of wine, so I cannot speak to the selection of wines offered at Aperto.   We each had the fish entree, and it was outstanding!  The entire dining experience was a pleasure.  We had the opportunity to speak to the chef before we departed.  I will definitely return to Aperto the next time I am in town this coming October.

Longtime clients, we've been coming here for years and have always loved this place, but seemed to be off this time. We always take special out of town guests here, good food, not too precious, great views, cute neighborhood with a great bookstore (Christopher's!) nearby. Sign on door "Help Wanted" might have been a clue. Maître D was not friendly, seemed a bit grumpy when we asked to have window shade lowered. All of us had hard time understanding waiter explaining the specials. Waiter did not remember who ordered what (party of 4!) We are/were greatly disappointed and sad to lose a great place.
brunch is the reason to come
"Meh" is about right - food was fine, not particularly memorable. Pasta was overcooked and flat, my linguini with scallops had a sauce that almost just seemed like they had forgotten to drain it.

There at 5pm on a Sunday evening. Very few people in the joint for dinner, but lots of employees... Questionable, especially when we could not get waited on. Decided to get the $22 salmon special, but no one cared to ask. We got up, crossed the street, had dinner at Goat Hill Pizza. Dear Lord, really? How are your doors open? Front? Oh, and why was there so much wind blowing through the dining room? You are off my radar, even if starving would never ever...
Came by for brunch the other day. Surprisingly, reservations were easy to make via OpenTable and the restaurant had plenty of open tables upon arrival.
Very good italian with a creative approach.
I love this place because it's unpretentious and just plain good. Delicious sauce, not overpriced, solid wine list, and friendly employees.
Aperto is one of my favorite spots on Potrero Hill. You always know what you're going to get--fantastic, yet unassuming Italian food, and great, attentive service.
Before going, Aperto was described as an Italian restaurant without the pretentiousness and my friends were right. What a cute, cozy restaurant with such pleasant service!
We made a reservation for 7:30PM  on a Tuesday but arrived around 15 minutes earlier. The place was about half full so we got seated right away.
Looking for some delicious Italian food this side of San Francisco? This is a great place to find some.
Aperto, you're a 3.5 for now but I plan to return. It's overall a very nice restaurant for cheap! Well, relatively cheap.

Got the taglioni pepati, which was really good.  The pasta was the perfect texture, and it didn't hurt that it included two of my favorite things, bacon and jalapenos.  My girlfriend was less impressed with her scallops linguine, which had a subtler flavor.  The burrata with grilled bread was decent, but only if you're prepared to eat a lot of cheese.

Great little Italian neighborhood restaurant!  We started with the grilled octopus which was a nice light appetizer.  I had the chicken which was tender and delicious.  This is one of their specialties and it makes sense why--it's not your ordinary rotisserie chicken.  The warm chocolate soufflé for dessert is recommended!  Most of all, the service here was wonderful and super friendly.  It truly feels like a neighborhood place and I'll definitely be back.

Having lived in the city for so long, it makes me feel bad to think about the many pockets of SF I've yet to explore.  And by "explore", I mean "eat through".  So, in my efforts to correct that, I figured I would start with 18th St., which is already home to my favorite brunch spot (Plow).  And after hearing so many good things about them from friends, I figured Aperto would be a fantastic place to start!
When I lived in SF I used to drive by this place all the time,and never got the chance to try it.I finally did on a business trip to SF recently and loved it.

The absolute hands down best pizza I have ever had! Made a reservation for 730 and we were seated at 7:29. My son drew on a paper and they hung it on the wall. It was an amazing experience and I will be back as soon as humanely possible.

I can't, for the life of me, figure out why this place is so popular!  I've been here about five times, over about the past eight years, and it never improves, and never impresses me.  In fact, the only reason I ever go here is because it is a favorite of two friends of mine who insist that we go here on Monday nights for the all-you-can-eat deal.
Good sourdough pizza around the neighborhood. Make sure to check in and get free bread.
Good pizza that is also a great place for kids. A neighborhood treasure where I took my kids and now hang with my grandkids.
Very consistent in putting out great food. The house Italian dressing is the ONLY way to do. Pizza is always cooked to perfection. Spaghetti and meatballs looked amazing!

The pizza is good.  The service does not exist.  They treat you like you should be honored to be invited in.   Their home delivery service does not work.  They lost my order and told me to call their other stores.  I was told, "maybe they can find your order".   I finally gave up and ordered somewhere else and had to decline the delivery when it finally showed up because my other pizza had already arrived.
Goat Hill's claim to fame is its sourdough crust, so your opinion on the pizza largely depends on your love for that.

I was surprised because if heard great things about this spot. Unfortunately the ingredients were not fresh. And it was a bit on the noisy end. Also about $20 bucks for that kinda pizza isn't something to be excited about. Other places in the city offer a super fresh and delicious palette for as reasonably as $10. Decide for yourself.
It hit me almost instantly, moments after taking a seat at Goat Hill Pizza:  "It's rare that I'm actually hungry".
Good heavens, this is an overpriced pizza. 45.57 for two mediums. And frankly, I didn't think they were very good. The crust was tasteless and the whole thing was just lackluster.

Since there are literally 1,000 reviews I'll keep mine short. Nothing really bad about this place other than parking (which they cannot help) and it's on the pricy side. Also, their TV is on mute, so closed captioning would have been nice to follow along with the news. Minor, I get it. Other than that, great pizza on sourdough crust with just the right amount of sauce and toppings. I can tell this is the kind of place locals go, everyone there looked like they were from the neighborhood and had walked there. Wish I had a place like this within walking distance!

Being pescatarian isn't the best especially when you love meat and so do your friends. However, I decided that for a month, I was going to eat nothing but vegetables and fish. That was quite hard when my friend had decided that we were going to go to Goat Hill pizza and order the Porky Pie (which has bacon, sadly bacon is not a vegetable or fish). Instead, we ordered a pizza with half of it that was pescatarian approved - Mediterranean. That was delicious with the spinach and the feta.
I loved the sourdough crust! Great tasting pizza and quick delivery too.

Happened to visit here on a Monday.  Turns out that's kind of a big deal.  It's all you can eat pizza and salad bar for $13.  They have a variety of pizzas that they'll keep walking around and shoveling on your plate, should you so agree, and the little salad bar helps you to feel a little bit better.
Their pizzas are service is great. Plus it is near my house.
I order from here all the time and have never had any problems with the deliveries or quality always above average experience
Once again, great pizza and was worth the walk up a huge SanFrancisco hill.
If you love lots of garlic, cheese, and yummy bread this is your spot.

I want to really like this place. I get delivery all the time but the restaurant is not that great. I really like their pizza but not the service. Talk about not being happy to work there. Training in customer service needed.
Fast delivery, tasty pizza that was generous with toppings, and sourdough crust. Need I say more?
OH MAN

Really great pizza! Been coming here at least 15 years and their pizza is still great. Mondays are slammed but it's all you can eat!! Love this local restraunt, beautiful views of the city from the back dining area. Plus they give you crayons and placemats while you wait for the pizza! Great place for a date.

Great for groups. Went here for birthday dinner and I think we ordered quite a bit of food but the bill was not too bad, dare I say cheap pics in SF exists? Not the best pizza in the world but it'll do the job for large groups or if you need a fixing

I really want to give 1 star due to the rude behavior of the woman working there but the pizza is better than that.  The older woman working there tonight (July 28) is simply rude. I ordered over the phone and didn't hear what the price she quoted was. When I showed up to pick it up, I wasn't sure the price and this woman (wearing a shirt saying "in pink" on it) snapped at me saying "I told you the price" over the phone.  Ok, sorry I didn't hear that, what difference does it make, unnecessary.  Why are you snapping for no reason at a polite customer.  I own restaurants and would send her walking if I ever heard such pointlessly rude behavior at mine.  Whoever the manager or owner is, should be aware that terribly rude staff members do your business harm.  No one wants to be treated poorly... especially as a paying customer.  Very unfortunate.  Decent pizza, but this portly older woman isn't helping.
Really great sourdough crust pizza!! The place is pretty small & the inside is nothin fancy, but the pizza is worth it.

If you own a large pizza chain in San Francisco (home to possibly the largest gaggle of code monkeys on the planet) and you can't get your website to work you really aren't playing the game at even a 1st grade level. Also - your "e-commerce" site is hosted by GoDaddy... because everyone loves helping businesses that partner with the worst website on the entire internet. NO SOUP FOR YOU

Sourdough pizza is great. Staff are not so great. I don't want to feel like I'm imposing on someone when they are supposed to be waiting on us. The staff actually made me cringe when my co-worker tried to be friendly.

Definitely a fan of Goat Hill Pizza! Came in today for a work lunch after volunteering. Waitress and staff were super attentive and kind. All the salads, pizzas, and pastas we tried were exquisite! Crust and toppings were well done. Bravo Goat Hill Pizza! Thanks for a great lunch and experience.

18 bucks for a small and that's the littlest amount I can get and pizza and salad only what's the point of having other stuff on your menu this with a Kurt staff that don't even tell me it's all you can eat night till I try and fail to order multiple things. This place sucks

G O A T  H I L L  P I Z Z A -- yummy and Good for Vegans too.  You can get any Pizza you want with Vegan Daiya Cheese.  Any Pizzeria that does this has my full star -- 5 Star -- vote of confidence.  But I'll take it a step further-- they have the best crust in the city.  So go here, fellow plant based dieters.  You won't be sorry!
Really great pizza. You get what you actually order! No fuss, no muss!
My friends and I ordered the extra large porky pie pizza with sausage for take out. The pizza was delicious and the pizza was still hot! I will definitely come back again.

I wish they delivered to me, but maybe it's better for my health that they don't.  The sourdough crust on the pizzas is great, but I love their salads with chicken.  They are very hearty and fresh tasting.

We have been living in the area and heard that this was staple Pizza joint in Potrero Hill and we had to try it. We definitely were not disappointed. The ingredients were fresh and the crust was relish. I am a big crust fan so the crispy yet soft inside crust was exactly what I like. I can see why so many people frequent this place - it really is a neighborhood staple.
Great range of pizza. The sourdough crusts are particularly awesome. My wife, who hates crusts, was eating these instead of leaving them for me. We'll worth a visit.
Great service. Friendly atmosphere and awesome tasting pizza! Feel right at home here!

Goat Hill has been around for many years, my family and I would go there when we lived close by, they were really good then,I  haven't eaten at Goat Hill in about 20 yrs.. I didn't even know that Goat Hill Pizza was still in this location,( since I don't live in the area) until my niece asked me to go to dinner with her and our kids. Service was pretty good, they were pretty busy but, we got seated quickly and that's a big plus (you can call ahead and make a reservation too!) our pizza was delicious and hot..the salad I ordered was huge, and really fresh. I actually brought the rest home. They're prices are fair and the place is clean! And...great for small kids, they accommodate them with paper and crayons. Glad they are still around!!

Goat Hill Pizza gets a good rating from me for excellent service and customer loyalty program. Recently had them cater daughter's birthday party.  Ordered cheese, mediterranean pizza and basic veggie.
Goat Hill reminds me of the kind of pizza place I went to growing up - Formica(-like) tables, wooden chairs and no-nonsense pizza (even if Goat Hill does have sourdough crust).

BEST pizza and service SF has to offer!!!  Love this place.  Fresh ingredients, nice, friendly and gorgeous staff.  Awesome deals on wine by the glass - that actually taste yummy.  GIANT salads with the works.  Pizza is legit, nice thick crust, fresh meat, yummy cheese.  Great little "hill" location in Portrero Hill.  This place hits the spot on so many levels.  Go GOAT HILL PIZZA!!!

Incredible garlic noodles, for which I admittedly have a soft spot. Way above expectations for such a staple dish though. Nice staff, and complementary chocolate bars for dessert. Reliability and the little pleasures in life bring a smile to my face. If you run to the top of the hill, you'll have earned your dinner and the view of downtown :)
This will probably be our new go-to Pho spot!!
My wife and I have been coming here for years and have appreciated the very good food and service.

What a great  place. Was seated  quickly  even though it was very busy. I ordered  the soup with beef. As someone  who has eaten pho and soups restaurant and home made, this was great food.  Very flavorful and plenty of beef. The broth was perfect. The staff is friendly and I will definitely  be going back.
Okay so:

I did not have an opportunity to dine at Sunflower because upon calling them, I found out that a variety of vietnamese dishes that are usually gluten free at other vietnamese restaurants were NOT gluten free here because Sunflower intentionally uses gluten ingredients unnecessarily (ex using gluten soy sauce when gluten free soy sauce is commercially available). Some dishes that I am most sad that Sunflower makes gluten-y unnecessarily include the calamari and the vietnamese crepe. I'm super disappointed that they exclude gluten-free customers from their business, but maybe there's hope they can fix their problems at some point. Vietnamese is one of only a few cuisines that are chock full of gluten free dishes traditionally, so Sunflower's choices are particularly annoying. At least you were warned!

Five stars. This is my go to place for pho. I always get the beef noodle soup with vegetables & am never disappointed. Portions are huge and you can save the leftovers for another meal! The staff is super friendly and very attentive, even when it gets busy. I love coming here and parking is usually really easy to find too! Did I mention you get a great view of the city when you step outside?

I expected good Viet food here from my coworkers' recommendation. This is one more Chinese Vietnamese restaurant in the city. I am spoiled by authentic Vietnamese food from growing up in Vietnam and lived in Orange County most of my life. I had pho bo here. The broth is so plain and the meat/vegetables are just OK. The fried rice and crab soup here are totally Cantonese. I have no problem with that but I would like more authentic Vietnamese food at a Vietnamese restaurant. Maybe this is just not for me :(
Fantastic crispy imperial rolls and beef pho. Good broth with the Pho but wish they offered tripe and tendon too.
They have the biggest fattest juiciest spring rolls ever !!! I know that sounded pretty wrong but trust me they're to die for and super worth the price !!

First off, let me say that I've come here before and had a great experience and love the garlic noodles. However, my poor experience tonight at Sunflower was really unfortunate and compelled me to write this review. It all comes down to the pho. Otherwise known as beef noodle soup on the menu. I was so disappointed. The beef was really overcooked and there wasn't a variety in beef cuts as there would be in more traditional restaurants. This place clearly caters to a more American palate AKA those unfamiliar with Vietnamese cooking. I guess the pho just isn't what you order here. My guest and I finished our soups, but we were still hungry because we were so unsatisfied with the meal. The broth was flavorful, but I would have liked it hotter. So we ordered some imperial rolls -- how can you go wrong with fried yumminess? Unfortunately, the pho had really melted away our appetites. We left dissatisfied and, sadly, have written Sunflower off our list. In addition, the service tonight was very rushed, brusque, and really added to the whole negative experience. I literally got pushed by a server as they were punching in an order as I was getting a toothpick -- all with out an apology. There are so many more Vietnamese restaurants where I can get a solid bowl of pho without all the negative service. I'll be going there from now on.
Solid affordable Vietnamese.   Great atmosphere, fast service, good food.   It's not fancy or high end but it delivers with precision on what it does best.
I am rating this restaurant 5 stars because of the following:

Hi! I'm Penny PA, a film industry Office PA who rates the best & worst places to buy your office lunch. My review, like all my reviews, is based on the experience of ordering for a large group of people - in this case, 45 folks.
I got tricked... 4 stars for this place??
LOVE THIS PLACE!
Walked in and ordered a bowl of pho in Vietnamese and got blank stares. I suppose it's the best you'll get if you're trapped in Portero Hill.

This is my go to Vietnamese joint when I'm in town. Legitimate Vietnamese food, generous portions and you can tell when you peek in the kitchen, that these Asian masters have been cooking their entire life. Plus the place is always crowded at lunchtime. Hence, I do the pickup and eat at home thing. Food is ready in 10 min. By the time I walk up the little darn hill, it's ready!
Great for Take-Out, super quick and always piping hot!
This place gets a 4 because this is what I like about Vietnamese food:
Service: 1 *
Sunflower is a great Vietnamese restaurant on Potrero Hill!

I would love, love, love to give them more stars, their food is good but I'm afraid I can't go anymore because they have horrible customer service.  I wanted to have my 40th birthday party there, with 14 people and offered to guarantee by placing my credit card and they wouldn't help me out.  To me a place is not only about their food but also about how they treat their repeat customers.  This was also a way to introduce my friends to their restaurant so that they would come back on their own but they are too short sighted to realize this, no matter what I offered to guarantee this reservation - they wouldn't accomodate.  14 top table, guaranteed . . . nothing.  Good to know they are doing so well they can turn all this money away . . . and mind you, my group are all in the tech industry and love to eat.  As I told them, I won't be back and they'll miss out on this guaranteed fare.
Great little Vietnamese spot in Portrero Hill. It's slightly more expensive than the Little Saigon spots, but the place is very clean with friendly service.
Shrimp Spring Rolls ::

I agree with all the other reviews who think the food here is bland.  The quality of the ingredients is very good, but lacks a lot of authentic taste.  I was hoping that it would have a decent amount of flavor, but all
My favorite place to get vermicelli! Fast and friendly service to boot!

I don't get it.  the food is not particularly good, nor inexpensive.  Been to this location three times and Im just dumbfounded each time as to why I went back and why anyone else is there.  The food is pretty bland and has neither authentic nor new flavors.  The service is generally poor.  I honestly cant understand how anyone who has eaten vietnamese food (or any food with flavor for that matter) could find this place worth eating at.   This is San Francisco.  We have some of the best restaurants in the world, dont bother with sunflower
We went here for the first time on a friend's recommendation.  We were lucky enough to find parking right in front of the restaurant.

The vermicelli 5 spice chicken was featured as a "big eat" by 7x7. I call it a big disappointment. The chicken was dry and tough with hardly any 5 spice flavor. The second star was because the chicken salad we also ordered was good.
Lemongrass chicken :)
The pho is excellent here.  Noodles are springy, broth is tasty, and beef is tender.

I've never come here and been disappointed.  I've always been seated right away.  Don't get me wrong, they aren't super empty inside - they normally have plenty of customers.  Somehow, they always seem to have seating!

Their garlic noodles are great and their pho is solid. It's not my favorite Vietnamese restaurant though - those are in the Tenderloin or in San Jose for me. However, for Potrero Hill, this place is great. I've been several times now and it's been good every time.

I really really wanted to give this place 5 stars since it's in my hood. We've been ordering take out here for close to 5 years and have eaten here a few times and the food is of great quality but the service just is too lacking.
This place is a total surprise.  I was told about it by a coworker who used to live in the area.  It's a bit up the hill for those who walk there, but it's a great mini-uphill workout for the legs.
Good food!!
Great food and service, but the dishes are mostly made for sharing, so make sure you order with that in mind.

Yum!!!! Love the garlic noodles and the crispy noodles with tofu and vegetables. So good. Love this place because I'm a vegetarian. Every time I come here the food is delicious. Thai iced tea is also amazing.

I was so hopeful reading the reviews, but so let down when I tasted the dishes.  I don't understand the hype.  Plain and simple...it's Americanized Vietnamese food.  All the tradition flavors and seasonings have been washed out and diluted.  Nothing remarkable about the offerings.

Definitely a hole in the wall place, but those are the best sometimes right? Stopped here for lunch during work and the portions are large and delicious. Would totally go back if I was feeling pretty hungry. Love that it's pretty close to work though. Extra + right there!
Was looking for a decent kabob spot in the city.. this place was gross.. never coming here again... almost didn't eat and I was starving
Ganim's serves only the highest quality "Halal beef" than Kobe, and the buns are delicious baked right in S.F.

Not bad at all for the price really good kabobs decent onion rings and even the little side so they give you with the kabobs is pretty good comes with a little pineapple and avocado on it. The lamb gyro was a little dry could have used some tsaziki sauce some tomatoes some cucumbers but it was still tasty meat. Next time I'll try a burger
Only been there once but their surf and turf burger was definitely worth the visit. Nice big windows make the place very enjoyable.

OK place for lunch on the Hill.  Decent burgers,.  The turkey burger is a frozen patty - which is pretty standard, but absolutely nothing is done to liven it up.  A good burger place will spice up a bland turkey or chicken patty with seasonings and maybe even some wine while it cooks.  The fries are great and the staff is friendly.  The wings looked pretty good.  Any place you can get a cheeseburger, beer and fries for $10 is ok by me....
The best burgers out there I've been going scince I was 5 and I love it trust me you will love it to the best food I ever have had besides home cooked food or from 100$ restaurants at minimum.

Went here yesterday 5/28/14. Got a gyro. The guy said it came with lettuce carrots the sauce and hot sauce if I wanted it. Wasn't sure about hot sauce on a gyro but I love Mexican so I said just put it on the side. First off the gyro had lots if lamb which is a huge plus because a lot of places throw two all strips in there and call it a day. Then I tried the hit sauce and to be honest it was amazing and went perfect on the meal! The food was amazing and to top it off the guy working there is hella nice! I recommend this place to all. Take the t to mariposa and walk up 18th about 5 mins and your there! 5 stars from me!
Small, unsuspecting corner store in Potrero with a kitchen.  The cheesesteak, gyro, and crispy chicken sandwiches are exquisite and huge.  Not the most glamorous location, I generally order to go.

So good and a great deal at a great price. There's a small amount of indoor seating but this place never gets busy. Surf n' turf was great, it's basically a burger with a fried fish thrown into it. Pure greasy goodness. Onion rings were fresh and delicious, the fries was weird because some were blazing hot and others were cold -probably got a mixture of old and new fries. They also have a surprisingly large beer selection to attend to almost anyone's tastes.
I get the regular cheeseburger with fries all the time. Pretty good and price is fair. I always call in advance for pickup, and you can bet they'll have it ready in about 10 mins.
The burgers are big, tasty, and pretty cheap.

I went here for lunch and ate a burger with fries and got a turkey sandwich with fries for dinner. The price was pretty good for both and the portions were nice. I beat the lunch crowd but I had to wait quite awhile for my food. The food was good (the sandwich was better probably because the burger was kinda plain).
I've been going to this place for awhile to buy my lottery tickets (I've yet to win by the way, which leads me to believe that it's rigged), and never came in to eat until recently.

i ordered the bacon cheesburger. the bacon was not whole pieces, it was bits and the fat of the bacn. the burger had noflavor whatsoever, all they had to do was add a little salt & pepper and it would have been fine. the fries and the ketchup was great
I usually get the chicken, salmon, ribs plates...awesome for the price and quality. My GF loves the fish and chips, but I have high blood pressure so I can only have one piece. Places rocks!
This place rocks. Burger, fries, beer, under $10. And you gotta love a place that has SFPD consistently as customers.
Actually, it is a great burger, just like you've been told. Traditional, well constructed.

The burgers here are delicious and cheap, and their service is super fast. They are always really friendly. Don't be put off by the fact that this is a liquor store- their food is definitely worth trying.
I couldn't decide between a burger and the fish and chips. No problem! I got the Surf and Turf burger!

We did a groupon for this...and selected burgers instead of the usual...nothing spectacular...I would not go out of my way to hit this place again, but I would't walk away from a chance to enjoy the simple and satisfying menu

They have a really good selection of beer. The owners are really nice. The place has a relaxing neighborhood feel to it. Parking is on the street and is therefore slightly challenging. I had a spicy chicken burrito. It was hot, but beyond that my food was seriously bland. I may come back sometime and try a burger as I heard they are much better than the burritos. For now...... A-OK

I like to call these 'heart attack waiting to happen' burgers. My boyfriend and I came here on a Friday afternoon at around 4pm. There's plenty of parking nearby.. and it's not metered which is definitely a plus! Don't expect a fancy eatery, because after all, it's called Ganim's Market and yes, it really is in a market. The employee who took our orders and rung us up was very friendly and even explained to us what each burger was. After asking a ton of questions, we settled on the Bogie burger and a bacon cheeseburger which both came with fries.
Juicy cheeseburgers at an affordable price with friendly service. A truely great find in the city.

Dont seem to see sam here as of lately have been coming back and have had several great lunches. Love the turkey burger!! If that isnt available I will also eat the crispy chicken sandwich for $7 with fries this is a great bargain!!!
Excellent Indian style burritos!

This is one of the best places in the city to get a huge greasy burger!  It has been in Potrero Hill for decades.  It is basically a corner store that doubles as a restaurant.  It belongs in an episode of "Diners Drive Ins and Dives"  The Burgers are fantastic and cheap.  The chicken strips are great.  The service is wonderful.  We love this place and highly recommend it!  A must go to spot!

This is a decent mid range place for "to go" quick huge portion food at an affordable price. The ambiance is more of a liquor store than anything else, very casual and blue collar. Staff is cordial, they don't take credit cards so expect a hefty in house atm charge if you don't bring cash. No frills or attitude, I will be a repeat customer.
My neighborhood burger joint. Great quality food prepared by great people. When the owner looks like a guy who knows what a good quality burger should taste like, you know it's gonna be good!
When you want a seriously tasty burger but don't have time to wait out in the cold for a coveted spot at Chez Maman, you have an alternative for almost half the price and twice the speed.

If you're looking for a gourmet burger, go to Chez Maman up the street.  If you're craving a relatively healthy sandwich, if somewhat bland, go to Hazel's Kitchen, also up the street.  For anything else, go to Ganim's.  The sandwiches and burgers are super cheap and filling, and always include fries. You probably don't want to think too much about where the meat comes from -- no Niman Ranch or grass-fed cows here --  but the food is far from repulsive.  In fact, as others have opined, it's quite tasty, and service is always with a smile.

This place is bomb. Super delicious, super greasy, and always hits the spot. One of the best burgers in town. We love that it is in a totally unassuming corner store too. A great place for lunch or to finish off the day as they have a huge tall can selection to enjoy with your meal. Extra points for Sriracha + ketchup with the fries.

Just went here for the first time today, a hidden gem that my boyfriend had showed me. It is so good! We had chicken kabob over rice with salad and a grilled chicken burrito. Both were delicious, especially the kabob, it was like being at a BBQ! They also sell beer and wine. I am definitely coming back soon :)
This place is a little strange but good greasy food.
I don't understand peoples love of this place.

They make an excellent burger - 5 stars. I ate the surf and turf burger, with a piece of fried fish on top of a bacon cheese burger. Piping hot and served in a few minutes, the time and place to eat that kind of burger is right then and there: at one of their tables, under the TV and amongst the neighborhood guys.

Uh-Mazing! Delicious fish & chips, burgers (double double is where it's at) and their gyros are even super tasty! Super tasty thick cut fries and perfectly crisp onion rings. Can you tell I'm a regular?

Ah, this place is awesome. Where else can you get a delicious burger and fries for $6? Its obviously a no frills place, nothing fancy, but they serve everything from chicken kabobs to an awesome surf and turf (a fried fish fillet on a burger, yes!), to burritos and chicken wings.

Sometimes it's just a cheeseburger-and-fries kind of day, and you don't want to make a special occasion out of it. You just want to go and order your cheeseburger and try to wash the taste of salad out of your mouth from the other night. You want to come home with your burger and fries and eat them and make a huge mess. And when I am in the mood to completely neglect whatever is supposed to be "good" for me and eat what I WANT, this is where I go. It's so cheap, and fast, and spot-hitting. It's like the burgers I would eat when I was a kid when we were on a long road trip and stopped at some Dairy Queen in the middle of nowhere, and you were so relieved to be eating a cheeseburger and it was sooo much better than what you had for breakfast, you really didn't have any complaints. I'd add a star if milkshakes were also available. I've never bought beer here but I like knowing I could if I wanted to.
I love this place.
I'm surprised this place is open for business!
Fantastic food on the 18th St Potrero foodie hub... Warm, cosy atmosphere.
The service wasn't perfect ( a bit long) and I think 23$ for a small dish is a bit expensive. I ended up spending 35 dollars for myself and I didn't it a lot.
Amazing restaurant with awesome service, great tasting food and very romantic ambiance. We tried it for the first time today and are definitely coming back.
I had brunch here with some friends. The food was good enough that I wouldn't mind eating here again if in the area, but nothing really stood out to me.

This place was great! We've gone twice in the last two weeks and the food and service was incredible! Our handsome waiter (the Australian) is so nice and accommodating (we had a gradually larger group over the course of the meal lol). And the food-I had the eggplant and lamb dish with yogurt, incredible! And the second time was the lamb burger... did not disappoint at all. GO!
Might be a bit biased since my girlfriend's parent's turkish cooking is the amazing.

I came here for brunch on a Monday morning with 7 other people. The restaurant has nice decor and the service was great. However, I thought the food was just okay compared to other places I've tried. I got the lamb skewers and they were flavorful, but tough. I tried someone elses Moussaka and I also thought this was only okay, maybe it was personally too much meat for me. It was also on the more expensive end. Decent place, but I'd probably try some of the other restaurants around the area first!
CHECK YOUR BILL!!!!!

I've been a regular and huge fan of Pera for months now and even the Duke for a bit. I've been telling all my friends about this place and bring visitors from out of town. However, they completely lost my confidence, respect and business. Last night 5 of us went there for dinner and when it came time to settle the bill they included a 15% tip on top of the total, but didn't show that it was there and then left a line for a tip as well. Not only super shady, but also illegal! The manager gave some lame excuse about the computer. Beware if you eat at this restaurant and check your bill very carefully! I am never going back unless with the police and BBB.
Meah food and meah service. Look elsewhere.

A nearby choice turned into an extraordinary surprise. Classic choice of moussaka was spot on.  Flavorful meat and velvety cheese topping served,with a spicy tomato sauce. Baklava was nuts n honey galore. The bar tender made a great Pinot Noir recommendation and it was a satisfying night.

I have yet to try their brunch menu that everyone is raving about. Their dinner menu was satisfying enough for me to return for another dinner, plus they have a great selection of wines, what more can you ask for. Service both times for me was also great, so yes I am willing to go back for brunch or another dinner night.

Came back again for brunch after just 2 weeks.  This is a hidden gem!  Plow was going to take the estimate 2 hours to get a table, we opted for Pera.  No wait, same exact table by window we sat at last time -the owner immediately recognized us and came over to say hi, and he later surprised us with some special yummy light Turkish dessert on the house.  Needless to say I'll be back again.

loved this! Went to Pera before going to see a band at Bottom of the Hill. Excellent service. Tried a new wine - it was Wednesday a bottle for 1/2 price night.  Had flaming cheese dish, and a wonderful fish in claypot dish.

Amazing restaurant with unique tastes and dishes that will keep you coming back for more.  The family owners are personable, attentive and care about quality service.  One of many gems in Potrero Hill!

We live closeby and love coming to this place. The interior, friendly and respectful staff, authentic and delicious meditteranean food are like nowhere else, except in Turkey. My favorite brunch is Harem breakfast - a combination of several small dishes, and for lunch iskender - lamb with tomatoes on soaked bread pieces.
If you are visiting San Francisco this place is AWSOME!!!

the real secret for this place is their brunch: harem breakfast! they have the traditional turkish spread, with sucuk and eggs and everything! highly recommend it for people who have never tried a traditional turkish beakfast and feeling adventurous.

We came here one day as they were about to close (literally the waiter had just turned the sign) but he let us in anyway as the last customers which was AWESOME. I've never had that happen before. The food came quite fast and was delicious. I had the chicken kebab that came with a side salad, rice pilaf, and a cup of soup. The only negative thing is that it came with one small kebab, so it was kind of expensive for the portion. Other than that, the service was fantastic, and the food was delicious.

Absolutely delightful. My daughter had exquisite pancakes w sweetened butter and jam and apple sausages. She nearly licked her plate it was so yummy! I ate every bite of my chicken shish - I love the red lentil soup and the Turkish salad. Charmingly gracious service makes this a particular delight.

This restaurant is on the very hills of Potrero so be ready for a walk uphill. It is a nicely decorated restaurant with some character. The food was great, obviously not as high quality as Turkish food in Turkey but quite good for Turkish food abroad.

1/2 bottles of wine on Wednesdays!! While the food isn't orgasmic, this is a good place to get loopy off of wine while getting your grub on in a comfy environment. I really like Mediterranean places because the dishes are made with just a few simple ingredients but pack a lot of flavor. Pera is no exception.

when I visit San Francisco, I always stop by for a Turkish Breakfast on a weekend at PERA... the service, the tea,Turkish coffee a must... specially the GÖZLEME and HAREM STYLE a must for anyone that would like to get a taste of a traditional Turkish breakfast... can't wait to stop by on my next trip...

Surprisingly disappointed. This is my first negative review since I generally love all food (read: not a food Bay Area food snob), but wow... Starting off we had the Meze Platter. It was pretty good. Then I ordered the lamb shish kebabs for my entree and the waiter replied with "that's boring". I was in shock! In hindsight, he was trying to do me a favor. I had to choke down a few bites of the flavorless lamb and salad. Sadly, the side of rice was the best part because I could taste the butter. Finally, some flavor! My husband had bland risotto with tiny particles of Salmon and a few Tiger prawns for good measure, but I think they described it differently when presented as the special.
Came by for dinner - cute location but food was dull dull dull.
Most delicious Turkish meal I've ever had in US! They make their own bread, dolmas and eggplant are really good. Looking forward to eat the deserts right now! Tam agzimiza layik, afiyet olsun!

Full disclosure, we're friends with one of the waiters here. That said, we love this place. This is a great place to go when we want to mix it up from the usual Thai, sushi, Italian routine. It goes without saying that the waiters are friendly to us, but they are friendly to others as well. One of the guys was kind enough to bring a bowl of water and some snacks out for a customer who'd brought his dog. The ambiance is classy without being stuffy or pretentious, and there are a few outdoor seats as well. The flavors in all the dishes taste very integrated and satisfying the way good home cooking is. If you want a little theatricality, one of their cheese appetizers comes flaming (can't recall what it's called). If you've got a sweet tooth, go for the lava cake, if you have a more subdued taste for sweets, do not miss the stuffed (pistachios and I believe mascarpone cheese) apricots. I'm pretty sure they won some best dessert award for that one.
This place is extremely nice! I haven't enjoyed a restaurant this much in quite some time! I was here on a Saturday evening and everything was just perfect!

Hosted a birthday dinner here with a few friends, and the venue and staff were definitely accommodating to that. We even had our waiter sing a birthday song, opera style. (I believe his name was Serhei? What a character!)

This is a hidden gem.  Great service with some of the coolest owners Ive ever met in a restaurant setting.  They go out of their way to make your experience amazing.  I will be here as much as possible.

Holy moly.  This place just blew my mind. The food is so fresh and light we are full yet don't feel like crap! Service is sincere and the owner took the time to sit and talk with us.  Prices are very reasonably priced.  Will definitely be coming back!
We got harem breakfast, menemen, sucuklu yumurta. But I like sucuks and yumurtas (eggs) separate.

The mediterranean food experience here is as good as it gets. Sorry for the average american that cannot really appreciate simple plates. It is not bland, it is simple.. I am from Italy, and all of my Mediterranean friends (from Italian to Turkish to South of France to Spanish) LOVE this place.
Not many vegetarian options, but good ambience and great service!
I picked Pera for a birthday dinner with friends a year ago and really wanted to like it.
Pros: the wine, baklava, decent ambience

We actually stumbled across this place on accident. We were planning on eating next door at Chez Maman but the wait was too long and we were really hungry. We looked at what was nearby on yelp and right next door we found Pera. Turkish and Mediterranean cuisine. We have never really had Turkish food before so when we walked in we knew we wanted to try as much Turkish stuff that sounded good as possible. We sat down and were seated next to a very noisy group of 4 and a 2 person table with very obnoxious people. We can't blame who the restaurant serves, money is money even if it comes from unsavory people. Anyway we were not greeted with bread immediately, only after we ordered did they bring us bread which is usually not seen, it sort of felt like, "they ordered a lot of food so let's bring them bread." Instead of bringing complimentary bread to the table when you sit down. The oil they gave along with the bread was very tasty stuff and I'm not sure what was in it, maybe olives but it was really good, I could have eaten just bread for the whole meal if it came with the oil spread. Our waiter was nice enough and we cracked some jokes throughout the night and he was a very chill guy, glad we got him. I got a Turkish beer which is a pilsner and it had good flavor and I enjoyed it with my meal. We ordered Saganaki which is a cheese plate of some sort with figs that they bring in a small skillet next to your table and melt with alcohol right next to your table so you get a little fiery show out of it. It was pretty cool and we didn't expect that. The cheese had good flavor and paired well with the fig and we spread it on some bread and it was tasty stuff but could have used more fig. For entrees I got the Manti and the girl got the Iskender. The manti is a meat filled pasta covered in Mediterranean spices and yogurt sauce as the pasta sauce. It was very unique which is the first thing that came to mind when I tried it but I ended up enjoying the flavors and textures of the dish. It is definitely something I have never had before but I liked it. However I tried my girls Iskender and it was my favorite dish. Meat in a red sauce with pita, tomato, side of yogurt sauce and peppers and it was very tasty from start to finish. Both dishes were great entrees and we enjoyed both. For dessert I got a Turkish coffee and we split a deconstructed baklava with pistachios and marscapone cheese. It was to die for, a little honey, some crunch and the creaminess from the cheese made for a perfect dessert to end our night. Overall the food was very different from the norm that I am used to but it tasted fantastic and the service was great as well. A very solid date night with my lady and I'm glad we stumbled across Pera.

Average food; good ambiance; good wine. I ordered the grilled salmon fillet and it was bland. Also, it was a little burned on one side. I wasn't satisfied with my food considering the price I paid. The dessert was the best part of the meal. We ordered baklava and the lava cake and it was good.
Excellent Turkish breakfast! Serhat was a great host. What a great find for us San Diegan Turks who were visiting town. Will definitely be back! Highly recommended!!!

My boyfriend's go-to place for sushi. Cute corner lot on Potrero Hill. It gets busy for dinner but we haven't had to wait to be seated yet. When seated at tables for two, sometimes it gets a bit cozy with the small tables. You can easily eavesdrop on the neighboring parties. Oh well, no big deal. Go and enjoy the sushi!

Live sushi located in Potrero Hill. After seeing people post pictures of their scallop burgers and live uni, my friend and I really wanted to try it . After a month later , we finally tried it and thought the food was pretty good. I really enjoyed their scallop burger and live uni . Their white tuna and toro nigiri was really good . It tasted very smooth and fresh.

It's not cheap but very much worth the price. fresh and tasty and diverse menu. nice collection of sake. service is fast and nice. it does get a little crowded and like I said the price is a little prohibitive. Will go back

Food was good. Dumplings they serve as a appetizer had a strong cabage flavor to it and I did not like it. Also weird smell in the corner seat which was quite annoying. It was a fine 4 star restaurant but there is no way I can give 5 stars. rolls were tasteful but not great or delicious. It was just good. Overall it's 4 stars.
So fresh so good!! Try the DJ Roll. Amazing! Great staff as well. Sit at the bar and they are happy  to make any adjustments you might like. I prefer things extra spicy and they delivered!
I've been here for dinner twice and both times I left with the same impression: not super memorable, but tasty, and MAN that sashimi portion was HUGE!

I really like this place.  Their blackboard featuring the daily special with lots of japanese-turned English I do not understand. their waitresses seemed to know really well what they have and what is best for the day, and were good and quick with making recommendations.  a good vibe too, with some artsy dim light over the sushi bar and a good mix of customers.  felt that I could have nice privacy and also some distant intimacy with other eaters. so it is good and I will go back again.

Is it live as in "we are broadcasting live" or live as in "you only live once?" I'm confused because either way, the name of the restaurant doesn't make much sense. What I'm not confused about though, is the great tastes coming out of Live Sushi Bar.

We have come here a couple times and the service has been declining, servers ignore us until we were ready to pay the check, and then suddenly bills come back within a minute with tea. Now they have the new groupon that it MUST RESERVE on groupon website and doesnt allow same day reserve after 2pm. Unfortunately, we are not those that can schedule our dinner in advance. The food is ok, but there are much better options when you pay that price.
Only for Service. Can't review the food because I never got any.
Best sushi I've had ! Amazingly fresh and loved the variety !

Best Sushi in the US.. I'm a business traveler. It's my job to wine and dine my customers, over the years I've eaten at some of top sushi restaurant in the US and Japan. Live Sushi is in my top three category best service, great atmosphere, and sushi that you crave for.... Trust me once you become a customer I guarantee you will be coming back every time you visit San Francisco..

Found out about this place via a groupon but was happily surprised by the great food. We had some rolls and nigiri which were super fresh and definitely better than other places I've tried in the area. Parking in potrero is always pretty easy to find and it's also only about a block from whole foods if you want to multitask. Their beer selection is limited to the basics from Japan so don't go expecting anything great in that department...

The service here is prompt and attentive. The food on the other hand is nothing to brag about. Tried the SFPD and DJ roll, salmon teriyaki and unagi don, I expected better- no clue what the hype is about. This place is also very loud

Came here for lunch on my trip visiting san Francisco with friends, there was no wait at the time I came, the service was fast, Linh was super nice and helpful on recommend what to get. The food came out fast enough and deliciously fresh. We had one Dragon roll, one beef teriyaki and another roll I forgot the name but they are all very tasty. The bill came out was little over $40, not bad at all for the price I paid in Hawaii. I highly recommended this place to everyone.
Easy parking, and awesome local sushi - what else can one ask for...

The bestie and I met up with an impromptu dinner here. We were seated immediately in an otherwise empty restaurant (at 6pm on a school night) and perused the menu while watered-down green tea and iced waters were brought to the table.
The sushi at Live Sushi rivals that of what I tried in Hawaii. Oh. My. Goddddd.
Very fresh and good quality of sushi. If you looking for quick and value lunch place for sushi. This is right place to go. Love their bento set and definitely good place to go for lunch ^^
Awesome service and food. Order takeout all the time from here. Happy to try it LIVE.

Came here with a friend so we could celebrate her birthday together early.  Once we looked at the menu, we had our eyes on the live uni since we're both rabid uni fans.  Friends who love uni are hard to come by.  Have to stick to them like glue once you find one.  So we came here and spent a lot of $ ordering off the special menu and getting buzzed on the sake sampler.  Well, all the fish from the special menu were delicious, including the oysters.  The sake sampler was very well put together and the waitress seemed to know her sake.  The live uni looked visually stunning--uni lovers would ogle their eyes out to see a mound of uni presented on top of its shell; all the tables around us were interested to know what we had ordered as well.  Too bad it didn't taste as good as it looked; the uni was too cold and not sweet at all, with a hint of dishwashing soap taste.  Sounds horrendous, but it's ok, I didn't get the runs the day after.
My favorite sushi place in the neighborhood! Really fresh sushi and attentive service.

It was hotter than hell in here - to the point that my group and I found ourselves undressing to almost inappropriate levels at the table, but that 49ers roll was def one of the best sushi rolls I've had in recent times so everything else was forgiven at first bite.
It was aight.  Don't believe the hype.
Wow... Rarely do I walk out of a sushi joint with a full belly feeling full in the wallet too. The lunch bento boxes are delicious, generous in portion, at a great price.
Live Sushi Bar = sushi done right! We opted for Monday night takeout and it did not disappoint.

came here on a sat night with reservations for 4 people. Ordered omakase(had saba, salmon belly, uni and some other fish..everything was so fresh!) for one person, hamachi kama(so-so), scallop burger(scallop was so fresh!), chef's special oyster (had tobiko, quail egg & uni- yummy!!), seaweed salad (too small of a portion), seafood salad (fish is fresh), DJ roll & spicy tuna crunch roll....not good!  rolls were too loose and nothing special. Spicy tuna crunch roll with the soy bean paper wrap had sooo little filling in them...not worth it. Service is really good tho. But the rolls, seaweed salad...ehhhh...I think I'd rather stick with Sushi Sam if I'm paying this kind of price here.
this place is a few blocks away from office, and I go there at least once every two weeks or so.
love

Sushi was pretty good. The poor service took away from the meal. I went with a party of four and we were all served at different times and it made eating awkward. Our waitress was not very friendly and it took about 15 minutes to acknowledge us once we sat down.
Nice location. I like restaurants located on street corners.

Omg I love love Live Sushi. Now I'm a sushi snob and I was hesitant . But , the fresh sashimi dish is amazing! The slices of fish are generous and so fresh. My favorite roll is the  Romeo and  Juliet, trust me on this one.  You will enjoy no matter what ur taste so, they have it all and super fresh and delicious!

I'm sorry to burst the overrated overhyped yelp bubble but we need to roll back the clock to circa 2008. Bubbles are meant to be popped so that bigger, better institutions can be put in place to safeguard the public's expectations.

I like the servers and the food is ok.  However, you really have to watch the bill.  I asked for sake sashimi, 10 pieces.  The server asked me if I wanted to split it half and half with baby salmon. I point to the 10 piece price and say, oh you can split it, the server says yeah.  The salmon wasn't bad, it's usually just fine.  I get the bill and the salmon is broken up into two different types 5 and 5.  Five pieces was $17.00 and the other five was $10.  Really?  How deceiving! I paid it and thought, it wasn't the first time they had  a surprise when the check came.  I live in the area but they just lost a customer.  My boyfriend and I come here often.  Nice job Live, you gained another $10 but lost hundreds because I won't be back.  It's too bad one of the sushi chefs is really nice.  Be straight up.  Of course 10 bucks is nothing but it's the principle.

The place is a little small, but it was able to accommodate our group of 14, so not THAT small. Service was a little slow, but when they did come around, the waitress was extremely friendly. But the food. Oh my, the food.

I am a SUSHI SNOB. I've been going to this place for years now. I always sit at the bar, and highly recommend you do the same. Chat with the chefs and take their advice. BEST place in SF in my opinion. Granted I haven't been to all of them, but so far this is still my favorite. I even got my girlfriend of 4 months to agree this place is better than her precious favorite spots. Great customer service, amazingly talented chefs, the highest quality sushi in the Bay Area, impressive sake selection (I always order the summer snow), and a great location in Potrero hill with plenty of parking. Go with the Omekase and maybe some oysters. Great way to judge a sushi restaurant is to compare their omekase.

Sashimi was great, the waitresses were friendly, and other types of food was not bad.  So the low review is for what can ruin dinned.  Went here with the family for dinner.  Two of us ordered a 3 item bento box and rest was sushi or sashimi.  First dish came out 10 minutes after ordering.  The bento box was like $18.50 and it was so little food, overpriced!   Another 10 minutes go by and the other bento box comes out and it was the same little portion.  Then it became a trend to get a dish out every 10 minutes.  there was so much time in between our dishes that our food was getting cold waiting for the other dishes.  People who sat 20 minutes after us where getting their sushi rolls first.  You go to a restaurant to eat as a family not sit there and stare at your food.  Just a really bad experience and really bad bento box.  Time to change your name to WAIT SUSHI BAR

I bookmark Live suhi bar as one of "to try" restaurants.  It is a perfect timing that there is a groupon deal $29 for $45 dinner for two. So i made a reservation last Sunday and had a nice Sunday dinner date with my bf. We love sushi, specially good sushi.
5 stars for food.

Good food. The inside of the restaurant itself is kind of divey, could use an update but it certainly didn't stop me from getting my food! Wish I could have stayed to enjoy a beer with my sushi, but my boyfriend and I decided to order take out. They were fast and courteous. Prices were all reasonable. I would definitely go back. Super convenient for Potrero Hill dwellers.
We have ordered from Hazel's for a bit over 6 months now and about half the time they get the pickup order correct.
The most yummiest breakfast burrito I've ever had so far. Great place to go to if you want to feel satisfied and full

I love Hazel's Kitchen! I eat here at least once a week and it is my go to for food on the weekends. I always order the BLT with Avocado. I don't know what they put in the mayo but it is soooooooo good. Like a little kick to it. The breakfast burrito is fantastic too! Oh and the Chicken sandwich... Everything is great. Service is fast and everyone there is so nice. I'm hooked!

I go to Hazel's kitchen almost every day. Hands down the best place for a quick brunch in the city. My hidden gem. I take people from out of town there all the time and EVERYONE talks about it when they go back home. This spot is the best. My go-to is the tofu melt on a sesame bun. Mediterranean salad with chicken is what I got today. That one comes in second. Your life is not complete until you have tried this place out. gawd damn.
Awesome Grilled Melt sandwiches, especially the Chicken.  You can taste all the flavors; the key is their homemade dressing.  Great Chilli also.
Skip Plow and eat here instead. The food is better, the servings more meaningful, the wait is shorter (by hours), and it's less expensive.

My friend and I decided to come here after not wanting to wait 2 hours to eat at Plow, as it was right across the street. I ordered the 5b I believe it was ... The hummus sandwich with balsamic vegetables and it was amazing. Like one of the best sandwiches I have had. They gave a good sized portion as I could only finish half. There's outside seating which is super cute and the people working there were friendly :) also loved the tree of gratefulness outside. Such a super cute idea where people write notes of things they're thankful for and hang it on the tree. will be back!

Tried the $7 PB&J.  It was literally two slices of bread, peanut butter, and jam. I guess I was expecting them to at least grill the bread. The agua fresca was the saving grace for me.  Better places to eat on 18th.

Some of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Everyones tongue is different, but they just get me. chicken melt is the way to go. Full of veggies and pesto solo. All super fresh. Bread is amazing quality, get seeded roll or Dutch crunch.   Veggie melt and steak melt are also just as good. Breakfast is wonderful, from burritos to waffles. Oh my god the salad. Spinach is where its at. Check the picture. Ide eat here every single day if I could. Ide quit my job to work here to learn their secrets.

Another place I've been coming to for years and am long overdue to review. This is a neighborhood staple for many folks in my household. We might look in the fridge with a frown, "Nothing to eat. What'll we do?" And next thing we know, we're queueing up at Hazel's for that reliable provision of tasty sandwich and salad combo that has kept the neighborhood happy and fed, watching the dogs wriggle by, saying hi to the neighbors. Good stuff.

Shady business practice. Been coming here weekly for years to get lunch for my office. Went one day and spent $100 as usual. When the owner adds up the bill for me she asks if I would like her to add the 10-15% tip. I was confused. She then informs me she usually adds the tip in for orders over $50. Hmmm...that's weird. I usually spend up to $200 here... That really adds up!
This place is super cute. It's a small place with window seating. The window faces the "Thankful Tree", where people have written down what they're grateful for and tie it to the branches.

I'd heard the song countless times. It was on one of my fave childhood albums that I'd play on loop forever. I totally recognized "The Sound of Silence", but I didn't understand any of it since it was a rendition on los sandos hermanos' Spanish iPod.

I love Hazel's! Their menu is pretty big for such a tiny place, and has everything you might want for lunch. The fact that they have gluten-free bagels and bread for their sandwiches is what really wins me over, though. Even in S.F., it's rare that I can enjoy a sandwich or bagel anymore! And they don't skimp on the lox spread.

Very good sandwiches and pretty good lunch burritos.  I had the steak melt on a dutch crunch, which was pretty fantastic, and the grilled chicken + grilled veggie burrito, which was okay.  Not much seating, so either take the sandwich for a walk or sit down next door at Farley's.
Hazel's is a tiny efficient kitchen. It includes four chairs that you might

We originally were headed to Plow for breakfast but the wait time was 45 minutes so we walked back and spotted Hazels Kitchen. I ordered the breakfast burrito and my girlfriend got the Belgian waffle with bacon. The burrito was absolutely delicious the best breakfast burrito I have ever had. The waffles weren't great but we will totally be back to try lunch and get another breakfast burrito.

This is neighborhood goodness at its best. These folks will take care of you like your mom does before sending you off to school. The lunch or breakfast is much better mind you. The breakfast burrito is unique and the sandwiches are fabulous. This is a small place that you come to, grab your food, sit out side, and enjoy the Potrero Hill community.

Fresh and delicious sandwiches! I also love the bagel and lox they serve for breakfast. The employees are really friendly and helpful. They don't have seating but you can enjoy your sandwich next door at Farley's.

The Lunch Sandwiches are very good.   We have order large quantities for group lunches and the orders have been spot on.   Friendly and helpful staff.  We go back there regularly and would suggest, as one of the better Potrero Hill places for lunch!
Just popped in for a sandwich, CUTE place! Ordered a sandwich was made fresh didn't take long and tasted great.

Pretty hit or miss lunch and quick breakfast spot, but overall more hits than misses. The sandwiches are the mainstay of this place.  I've had the pastrami, the John's Special, and the tofu with sauteed vegetables: all were heaping with ingredients (a little sloppy but truly a bang for your buck, especially if you order the half sandwich for 5.25). These are all daily specials, and to mimic what an earlier reviewer said, you can't go wrong with them. The other day I ordered a sandwich from the regular menu and it was a disaster..I ordered the BLTA and there were all of 3 pieces of bacon in the entire sandwich. A very sad thing to behold.
I'm lucky enough to work near Hazels, and my co-workers took me there for lunch on my first week. Absolutely lovely place with lovely employees.

Been 10 years almost since I visited last.  The turkey cranberry smoked provolone is still as good.  It's the perfect little working take out sandwich place.  I love it and always will.  Seems like new owners but the food and quality is the same!  They take cards now which makes it more convenient.

Hazel's, oh god where do I start... The best worst sandwich place ever. They are the best sandwich in Potrero Hill, but only because they are the only sandwich place in Potrero Hill. The customer service is the worst, EVER. I was the Duke of this place for over a year while I was living on 20th and out of my 30+ visits they only got my sandwich order right once or twice. Yes that's correct, once or twice. Complete incompetent assholes as am I for continually coming here as many times as I did. The cashier's have a 2nd, maybe 3rd grade education and the attention span of a 13 year old boy. It is sad because they have the potential be so good. Good bread, good ingredients, great location, great menu. My advice? Pull your head out of your ass Hazel and hire some decent people that care about your customers and can stay awake long enough to make a sandwich correctly.
I love Hazels.
Large, healthy, great quality sandwiches!
This was a great spot for my first meal of the day, and unexpectedly. Just walked by, it looked nice, so I gave it a try.

What a friendly, cute, neighborhood deli! If the home-like vintage decor isn't enough to tickle your fancy, then the food will.  The turkey cranberry sandwich I ordered was to die for, and my boyfriend adored his chicken melt.  We got both on dutch crunch rolls, which were not overly sweet and packed a great crunch.  Portions are huge! Hazel's Kitchen also serve salads, soups and breakfast burritos.  And if that isn't enough, it has gluten free bread too! Space is limited to outdoor seating only, but that won't stop me from frequenting this place even on the coldest of San Francisco days.  Grab a coffee from Farley's next door and enjoy.
Awesome breakfast burrito! I would definitely recommend the chorizo and I am looking forward to coming back for more.
Hazel's is always so amazing. I eat there almost every time I'm in the neighborhood.
Review from a regular at Hazel's:

The first couple of times I went to Hazel's, I liked it. There were quality ingredients in my sandwiches, they were well made and tasty and the staff was nice and helpful. I've come to realize that that's because the owner took my order. I wish she would hire some people with good customer service skills instead everyone's got a bad attitude and the sandwiches have really gone down hill. The last time I went the bread was stale and this time, the ingredients were meager (I could've eaten a plain baguette and been happier) and there was really nothing good about it. I won't be going back.

If you want really yummy food to go (no seating), this is the place.  In general, I don't like sandwiches (unless I dress it up like an Italian sub with foccasia bread). But they have really good sandwiches here. My fave? Anything on their daily special menu especially their tofu sandwich on a seeded roll! I'm no Vegan either! I usually get 1/2 sandwich 1/2 salad for $8.50 and bring it next door to Farley's cafe where I can eat at a real table! Also, you can shorten your wait if you order by phone first!
I'm fond of Hazel's. I'm here a few times a week, grabbing either breakfast or lunch and an agua fresca if I'm lucky.
Hazel's kitchen saved my life when I was was interning at the SFBG. It was a quick walk from work, and well worth the hills.
Delicious breakfast burritos, so good they melt in your mouth!
Pretty good food with a nice menu and a cute space, but the girl who works here is notably unfriendly.
This has turned to my go to quick sandwich place since moving to Potrero. I usually go here for a quick breakfast on the weekends after a run.
Ordered a Jon special turkey and bacon for 8.50 to go. Half a sandwich into it and 4 blocks away I realized that there was no bacon. Honest mistake but a spiteful 3 star deduction.

I give a 4 because i dont like the way the food servicing is set up: you order  - then someone yells your name out (not a number, but your name). And Its hard to understand because the the place feels like a school cafetaria -  its large and loud. Go early so its less busy. One can eat quickly and be in and out fast around 11am.

What a great local joint. Lots of delicious (and HUGE) staple breakfast meals and also some new menu times to keep things interesting. I usually get the chorizo scramble but have also really enjoyed new items like the salmon benedict (the risotto cakes...oh my god) and the panko pork tenderloin (pictured below).
