Fabulous! Real, homemade food at a great price. We ordered the Eggs Benedict, a Corned Beef Hash, a chorizo & eggs dish, and a fried chicken sandwich. All of it was good.

Consistently good food.  I look forward to the weekend menu as the owner, Stuart, put together his "specials."  One of my favorite dishes is his chicken and waffles aong with the Korean loco moco.  Bottom line: would I repeat? I repeat early and often.  Great local eatery and dedicated owner.
Fast service, outdoor seating, lotsa options on their breakfast menu.
Love this place. I try to come here after my weekend workouts at the Worlds Gym across the street and it's one of my favorite parts of weekend mornings.

My boyfriend and I came here around 1:30pm on a weekday and the restaurant was pretty empty.  The set up of this place is kind of different.  You order at the counter and then have to wait AT the counter for your food, grab your own utensils, etc. I saw our food just sitting on the kitchen ledge and was like... Are we suppose to get it? Is someone going to bring it to us? And we also ordered an orange juice that never came so I asked the cashier if it was the odwalla in the refrigerator and she was like "oh, I'll serve you one." Horrible customer service, you could tell the workers just wanted the day to be over and get the hell out of there.
i didn't like my food and the server called the owner over. i think his name was stuart? he wanted my phone # and i said no. he creeped me out and was unprofessional. there was also hair in my food.
Hair in food, weird owner/manager yells and is very rude. Acted like I was lying and crazy for asking for my money back. Can't believe this place has good reviews.

Upon immediately entering the establishment, the customer would had no idea how nor where to go to order their meal.  It feels like you've taken a step into a low-class resort, where it has a foul smell that hits you upon entering.

I ordered pancakes and added fruit and walnuts. I loved the texture of the pancakes, but the pancakes were not very buttery or flavorful. Kept adding maple syrup and butter to give more flavor. So thats why I give it 4 stars. The price matches the portions you get, as in, very generous portions! Could be more welcoming, no greeting at entry or any sort of acknowledgement. Out of apple juice and regular bottled waters.

Visiting SF from LA.  First impression... A little unorganized and the constant yelling of order pick up is startling.  Which brings me to the self service part.  Everything is do it yourself.  Coffee, tea and order pick up which is fine but a little bit of direction would go a long way.  We ordered a tea and a coffee and weren't even told to grab a mug or where to get our drinks from until we asked.  The food was less than mediocre...less than diner quality.  After we ate I was looking for the restroom.  Located outside in the corridor.  You need a key to get in which you wouldn't know unless you go back in and ask.  As I was trying to figure out how to get into the restroom the lady from behind the counter comes up with a key! My thought "oh she brought me the key!" Wrong she opens the door goes in and says only one stall and slams the door in my face! Really!? Needless to say a bad experience all the way around.

We went here, had three people dine in and then got four servings of food to-go.  Finding seating was easy, even on a sunday morning.  The service was very friendly and helpful as the set up is a bit different (order at the counter and seat yourself) food was delicious!  No really, all 7 different orders we got, no one had any complaints.  If you want quick, friendly service and delicious food with some amazing specials, go here!
Great brunch. Nothing fancy but everything was delicious. Good sized portions, not expensive. A great alternative to the pretentious breakfasts nearby with 1+ hour waits.
Came here for Sunday brunch.

Sally's was an excellent brunch and I can't wait to patronize them again! I had the special- a korean loco moco made with a country sausage gravy. The dish was heavy and rich, made with lots of love but the housemade kimchi on top sealed the deal with a fantastic spiciness to cut through what could have been an overwhelming thickness. My only regret was the small supply of parking so I suggest taking alternative forms of transport to driving.

I had the eggs & ham sandwich. . It was off the hook with garlic mayo & when u bite it that melted cheese gets all over your mouth but it's worth it... I'll give it a 3 & half stars just because u gotta get your own food & table but other than that my sandwich was good
Note: It was for takeout

With a cozy neighborhood vibe, this sunshiny diner is perfect parts young people, families, and grandmas (aka diner experts). Expect delicious breakfast food served all day in a casual corner of Potrero Hill, and the sandwiches ain't bad neither. I've tried the salmon Benedict and the portobello Benedict (I love eggs Benedict) and they both we're unusual and tasty. And perfect home potatoes to boot!
Update to 4.5 STARS for amazing service, fresh ingredients, a satisfying brunch with no line on a Saturday at noon!

Sally's is a great brunch spot at the bottom of potrero hill. It is pay at the counter and always has interesting specials. Today some of the eye catchers were red velvet waffles and korean steak loco moco. However if you are only going to get one dish, skip that and get the Italian benedict.
This was quite a find wen babe and I were craving some breakfast food.
Sally's wasn't a destination but since i found parking. i ate here.

Good breakfast....also have lunch dishes. Food fresh, service efficient.....only negatives 1) self service style....ie waking back and forth with condiments. 2) the hot water for tea is physically located above coffee machines...that is an accident waiting happen....with the hot water. Sigh
Delicious upscale diner food. Always hits the spot on a weekend morning. Everything is fresh and they make huge lattes. Great choice in Potrero!
Ok been going here for around 2 years. Just one of the lunch choices i goto sometimes around my job. So I know.
Sooo good. Hearty and delicious. Must try the Mexican Omelet and their Homemade corn-beef with home fries.

Sally's is a long time Potrero Hill establishment that is part diner and part assembly-line style cafeteria. Reliable breakfasts and lunches, roomy, tables accommodate 1 or 2 people up to 7 or 8, and opens early 7 am sometimes 6:30. Also creative weekend dishes starting around 9 am Sat and Sun - look for white board.

I've been coming here for years and it has yet to disappoint. Where else in this area can you get pancakes + eggs any style (fried, poached, scramble with veggies) and sausage for 10 bucks for lunch?!
Pretty good food. Food took about 15-20 min. I got the huevos rancheros and it was delicious with a little tapatio. Coffee is self-serve.

Tuesday, 2:00pm; June 17, 2014; I bought a sald, returned to work, opened it and found that the sald was wrong. Returned to Sally's, the manager tried to say that I had eaten out of it (WRONG); ordered another salad that came with walnuts; the manager made the girl put the walnuts back and he personally made the new salad with slivered almonds. It's okay because I will not be going back there with such poor customer service. I don't want to recite the experience with the clerk on the cash register who did not want to refund my debit card and charge me for the new salad. She said it COULD NOT be done that way. That is another story! STAY OUT OF SALLY'S.

Convenient, good food and reasonably priced. I've never had to wait for a table here. Awesome specials and the regular menu is great too. Outdoor seating for the warmer mornings with a serve yourself set up. I love breakfast and Sally's supports this habit very well!!

Had the pesto eggs, others got the turkey hash. It was all good. Friend had a "brunch miracle" because there was a mimosa there, even though we thought that there wouldn't be any alcohol. Nice and bright dining area and friendly staff, food was ready really quickly as well. A little hard to hear when they called our names for the order, but the cooks were nice when I confirmed the names with them -- don't want to be stealing food! Seems to cater to the post-workout crowd from across the street, so very casual.

This is one of our go-to breakfast places in the potrero hill/dogpatch neighborhood. They have parking right out front, and if the lot is full there is lots of easy street parking nearby. They have a wide variety of brunch items and everything I've had there has been good. The portions are generous and the prices are reasonable. My only complaint is that it can take a looooong time to get food on a Saturday or Sunday, but that's pretty much true of any good brunch place in SF.

We go to Sally's at least once a week and we love it. Today I ordered Italian eggs benedict and my boyfriend had biscuits with gravy and fried chicken. The eggs were perfectly cooked and delicious, and I'm always a fan of their home fries. The chicken was delicious as well, not too greasy and super juicy, just perfectly fried. +1000 points because everyone is really nice and friendly.
Everything hovers around $10, the portions are large.  It is pretty much like a way better Denny's type of restaurant.

I am five stars impressed by the Jerk Pork over rice and two sunny-side up eggs. DELICIOUS!! Amazing flavor and so tender. Wow. Friendly service, family friendly, and super casual environs. This place will surprise you. Simple place with good food.

Ehhh....is the best I got. We came here for breakfast and it was ok. We ordered Sally's breakfast and Huevo Rancheros. Sally's is eggs, potatoes, bacon/ham and french toast. I asked for poached eggs that came over done. The potatoes were plain, the bacon tasteless (no flavor as though it's been frozen for years) and ham was also very plain as though out of a can or something. Overall not impressive. The Huevo Rancheros were pretty good, definitely more flavor and hot sauce helped! The place itself was not busy (which is great cause our kids started going  a bit nuts by the end) and they have some tables to sit outside.

I was recommended this spot as a place to find good breakfast with kiddos. First thoughts. This place is perfect if you have kids. parking out front, a lot of space, friendly and helpful staff. As we wait on our breakfast they jumped right on making sure the kids fruit bowl came right out (as soon a I sat down I thought, ugh I should have asked them for the fruit while we wait) mind readers! surprisingly the fruit was VERY fresh and a good mix without filler fruit that kids don't dig. Our food came out quickly and because I had the kiddos they ran it out to me with spare plates. The girls INHALED their cheese omelet and my turkey hash was amazing.
This place is dirty.  The kind of dirty that makes you wonder about the food prep.  Just look at the floor, chairs and tables, or not.
Pretty much heaven if you like alcohol, chicken wings, fresh air, nice service, and good times. If you don't like those things, don't go.

Great view with mediocre food. Bloody Mary was very tasty as were the oysters. We ordered the Cobb salad which was average and I definitely don't recommended the Fish and Calamari Fritto which was VERY chewy and super oily. Maybe the other dishes are better...
Had the eggs Benedict and it was amazing

It was a good lunch after running 13.1 miles in the nike women's half marathon but as my friend said best " this is how a $13 burger turns into an $18 burger" the burger is pretty basic unless you're like me and want avocado $1, bacon $1, blue cheese $1, grilled onions $1, grilled mushrooms $1...so yeah

Came in on my Birthday and had a ball. Good service amazing outside patio with a killer view. Had the grilled salmon sandwich WITHOUT the bun and it was fresh, light, flavorful and yummy. Perfect place on a sunny day! We will so be back!!
Sunday Brunch!      I am a fan of the Sunday brunch here at the Ramp.
Came here on a Friday afternoon with my boyfriend because he recommended it.

Coworkers decided to eat out and take a longer lunch than usual while all the bosses were away at a convention. Walking around we found ourselves here and decided to go with it since we were hungry. It's an interesting space, hidden from the street and looks like it mainly serves the people that have boats docked nearby.

I've been there twice for brunch on Sundays.   The location is odd...very industrial, but parking was easy both times. The bad is they don't take reservations. The first time I went we were a party of 5 and were seated right away. Today we were 4 and we waited about 40 minutes. So it's random.  The patio is nice and sunny, and we were lucky to get umbrella tables. The people who did not get umbrellas looked very uncomfortable. Hot!

Well here it is Friday night sitting here at The Ramp waiting, waiting, waiting... 30 min now every waitress says "not my table, one waitress advises " we are short staffed and not waiting on all tables" the guy at the bar refused to take orders for tables.  Asked for the manager he/she has yet to show either.  I have come to this restaurant for over 20 years and all I can say is how shitty do they treat their wait service??? AND are there no competent wait staff willing to work here.  I love their Ramp Burger and Calamari but it seems tonite I won't be getting any nor will The Ramp be getting my business!  Nice to have sooo very much business you can't hire good staff an good customers are refused service by bitches who call themselves waitresses!!

I haven't had bad food in a long time, the only thing worth it here is the oysters, but the fish & chips is gross, the oil tasted so old, it made me feel sick after eating one piece, I felt like throwing up, the guacamole is that frozen stuff you find at some supermarkets, the grilled prawns with some lousy tomato sauce and hard bread on the side... even the drinks, I ordered a margarita and it was the stuff from the bottle with some bad tequila, I guess the location is what people go to this place for. And it's been 4 hours and I still have indigestion, avoid this place!!

I enjoyed a sunny SF afternoon with good company. This place is well-suited for groups. There is plenty of outdoor seating. The food is lacking, unfortunately, and the view can't compare to next door's. I wouldn't dine here with one or two. Better options.

I so wanted to love this place because it is in our neighborhood but it is pretty awful.  The food is not good - I had to keep spitting out my Crab Louie (which was $19!!!!  Truffle fries - French fries!! - were $9!!  Wth??) because it had so many pieces of shells in it. After we ate we were cold so we came inside to finish our drinks and wanted to order dessert but the bartender told us that you couldn't order any food at the bar ... While I could see multiple people actually eating at the bar. "You have to get on the wait list for a table" .... "But we already ate at a table".  What a ridiculous policy.  Overall service was poor. The whole place feels dirty and like no one cares. So many better places to spend a Saturday. Plus one star for because there was a good deal on mimosas.

No finer place to enjoy a bloody mary and an order of fresh-fried donut holes while watching the ships come in. This is the kind of place I hope SF doesn't lose entirely. Festive and unpretentious, cement floor and plastic tables and big ole bloody marys in an old-school San Francisco dockyard setting. The morning we were there the clientele seemed equally split between folks gearing up for Folsom Street Fair and Niners fans. So.........awesome. The host and server, god bless 'em, were friendly and very patient with our sprawling birthday group. The food is not fancy schmancy by any means, typical pub grub, but fresh and well-prepared. We will definitely be back.

The Ramp is rad. This off-the-beaten-path can handle large groups with relative ease and still serve healthy, well cooked food. We had a huge party of 25, and they still managed to cook my salmon perfectly (rare) which is a feat many places can't achieve even when I am dining solo or with a small group. A+ for that.

At first reluctantly, but we have gone back a few times. The service has improved, most notably we haven't had homophobic remarks from the bar staff.  Actually, the original schmuck hasn't been seen since, and the replacements very friendly.  Yelp feedback must work!  Kudos, Ramp owners!
Me and girlfriends wanted to enjoy the weather and hangout near the water so we chose this place.
Good place to hang out especially on a nice sunny SF afternoon on a Sunday. There's live music (Latin) on certain days. The beers were perfectly chilled.  Good burgers.
So bomb, came for a Sunday lunch. Awesome service great food& great drinks. I will be coming back.

We made it here for the first time for brunch on Sunday.  It is definitely a bit hidden but our GPS led us there just fine.  Any place in the City with a parking lot always gets bonus points from me.  It is also dog friendly (as long as they are on a leash) so that was a plus as well.  We also noticed that they had boat parking, not that it was a concern for us, but in the interest of being complete.

I'm a SF native and have been away from the ramp for years, but decided to go last Sunday, when they have a live band. Beautiful day on the patio, the place was packed. Unfortunately, they close the kitchen on Sunday afternoon, which I feel is a mistake, as they could've easily pulled in at least a grand in food that afternoon, and have a very mediocre (slow, pricey) bbq thing going outside. Prices are off the hook: half a small brown bag of tortilla chips - $8?! $13.50 cheeseburger, $14.75 fish sandwich?! Local hang with tourist pricing.
Great place to hang out especially if you are a Sports Fan.
Cool spot, and no attitude after you get by the parking lot guys. That part is weird. But, worth it after you shed them.

I have been there several times over the past year, mostly for lunch.  The four star review is for the overall experience of The Ramp. This is not an upscale seafood place where you want to go for a romantic dinner.  It is NOT a tourist place.  The Ramp has been around SF for decades and does not try to be anything it is not.  The food is decent - nothing sing from the rafters about - but good.  Portions are substantial.  The ambiance is of a "workers" bar.  The clientele is a mixture of dock hands, medical folks from UC, cops and hipsters. When it's warm and sunny outside, there is no place better.  Lot's of outdoor seating and no one to rush you on your way.
Hidden gym of the salsa world during the summer Saturday and Sunday there's a cover to salsa your heart out!

Great place, we came here on a beautiful and sat outside right by the water.  It is a casual place, and has a relaxed atmosphere.  I ordered the grilled shrimp skewer which was served on top of a delicious tomato ragu, which tasted very fresh and it had roasted garlic in it which made it a perfect topping for the crostinis that were served with it.  I also ha a house salad with some very delicious ranch dressing. Can't wait to come back.

The chicken wings were so hot that I couldn't enjoy them. Cheyenne pepper tastes good but not mixed in with BBQ sauce heavily. They were over priced as well but that might be because the menu is so small. I wasn't pleased with the selection of food they had on the menu. Who pays 9 bucks for fries??

Unbelievably bad and slow service. We were in no rush but that was beyond laid back. Brunch on a Sunday. Hostess sat us as soon as we arrived. Was not crowded at all. It went all down from there. After 35 minutes nobody had even come to our table to give us anything or ask us for anything. We had to walk around and repeatedly ask a waiter to come to our table. Then the unapologetic waiter just told us how much he loved working outside in the sun. Food was brought late and every single time he gave it to the other table. Wrong count of dishes.Complete mess. We got water after we were done with our meals and coffee about at the time of checkout.  I know this is a relaxed place but their service is idiotic. The only reason I don't give it one star is because the food actually tasted good and being on that old boat ramp is always enjoyable.
My new neighborhood go-to for food and drinks! Gotta love a big plate of fish 'n' chips with an Anchor Steam Ale after a long day of work. Or, even better, a Bloody Mary at brunch.
This review is strictly for Saturday evening salsa dancing.
Sat on the deck by the water. Lovely. Food came quite quickly. Prices were good.

An awesome restaurant by the water. I came here with my coworkers and definitely thought why haven't i gone here before. It was a nice sunny day, so it was great to sit outdoors. I had the calamari and shrimp louie. Both dishes were delicious. I wished i got the oysters because they looked delicious. However, the service was lacking because we were all eating but the restaurant was constantly cleaning around us. They also took one of the umbrellas for shade while we were eating. The restaurant is probably well known for their $1 oysters. Will try to come again sometime for the oysters and the view.
Had a nice sunny day in San Francisco and we were wooed by the Mon & Friday $1 oysters and a chance to sit next to the water.

My mom brought me take out from here today and all I can say is wow. Personally I can only comment on the clam chowder and bacon cheeseburger but both we're absolutely fantastic! Especially the clam chowder, highly highly recommended.

So my partner and I were in the area and thought ... let's try it out.  Well the reason I give it any stars at all was the staff.  The hostess and our waitress was very accommodating throughout our experience.  It was a Saturday afternoon, and very busy with people and their cocktails.  I don't drink... so i think if you really like to drink (any time of day) this might be the spot for you!  But we were very sober and just wanted to have a nice lunch by the water.  Let's cut to the chase:  My partner ordered a "fish n chips" which she liked and I had a crab/shrimp sandwich w/ fries.  My first bite I could taste that none of the ingredients tasted fresh.  My second bite and I realized that I wasn't going to be able to eat any more.

This place is actually pretty cool. Definitely off of the beaten path, but worth it for that view. Great outdoor seating area with a view of the bay. Inside there are a couple TVs that were showing two world cup games simultaneously. Food was nothing special, pretty standard seafood bar type fare. Service was friendly and prompt.

Wow, I'd you are looking for an awesome place to spend a Sunday afternoon in the summer sun... You've found it. I can't believe I didn't know it was even around until just now. Great atmosphere, playing Cuban salsa and dancing to the live band. Great food, make your own mimosas... What can I say, this is a vacation location, right here in SF!!!

Best hidden gem on the water! I love coming back to this place time and time again. When the sun is out, it is one of the most relaxing & enjoyable places.  Thursday Reggae music outside is a must...don't be fooled if it is foggy in your neighborhood, because it may not be here!
If you know SF you know many of its anthems starts with "sitting on the dock of the bay..." I imagine this is maybe where it was written.

I have been coming to the ramp since I was a kid. My mother and her friends (and their children, my friends) would come to listen to live music. I have very fond memories of dancing with my mom to awesome music and eating BBQ by the water. I tried my first oysters here and I fell in love. I order oysters every time. The drinks are yummy and they have a nice wine selection. The service is awesome, everyone that works here is really friendly and efficient. The only thing I've ever had to wait for is a table outside on a nice day, and honestly I don't even mind the wait. The atmosphere at the ramp is so comfortable and homey, the food is good (okay, it's not expensive, fancy five star cuisine, but it's so good for what it is, and it fits the vibe beautifully), there is often live music (check their website/give em a call to see if/when there will be live music), great service, outdoor seating by the water in the sun... Seriously what more could you ask for?

Best blue collar breakfast and lunch in the city. Large portions of good food. Enough to keep any man working all day with a smile on his face. The staff is always friendly and the coffee is always hot!

I really want to give this place a good review because the owner is nice to me, but after having a talk about the food here with my roommate and finding out he has got sick off there food twice its hard to. I came in for lunch the other day and there were dirty dishes on all the tables and flys all around. When I got my food there was an obviously rotten orange on it. With a little more love this place could be a killer spot and I hope to see it improve because it's so close to me and I want to support small businesses like this.
awesome food!!! and so close to my office!!!

Very convenient for a quick breakfast or lunch. Food is very good, quality top notch and consistently so. Love that they have a few Korean items on the menu too. Is it gourmet? Not hardly...but it is tasty and healthy (mostly) and quick and convenient and the new owner is an absolute delight, so very friendly!
Been several years since I have been here, but enjoyed it when I worked down the street.

Korean food, Korean style. No kidding. Bibinbap was incredible. Large menu and friendly service. Saw someone eating the bbq chicken plate and it looked fantastic. Kim Chee too! Breakfast menu looks good. Have to come back. Only open on Weekdays. :(
I randomly come to get my breakfast here..

The food is good, but I waited 20 min for a bacon and cheese sandwich, and an order of veggie kim chi fried rice, I had to remind them about my order. Then when the food finally came, the sandwich was ham and cheese,  not bacon, and the veggie fried rice had spam in it. We had to reorder... the staff was very polite and apologetic, but overall I would have rescinded my tip if given the choice.

I have to admit I've only eaten cheeseburgers & fries & diet coke at Wolfe's, while there are many more options on the menu.  As far as I've tried it, the food's been solid, and I've heard good things about their other options.
Good food, big menu, seldom crowded, low prices. Great lunch. Go eat.
Have they changed owners? Where is nice Korean man? And who is cooking now?

I used to come here for lunch regularly but ever since it changed owners a couple weeks ago (from a Korean man to a Korean woman), the service has declined noticeably.  They have forgotten my order twice now and I had to ask repeatedly about my order after 20 min. Then the last time, they burnt my beef.  Time to look elsewhere.

It's hard to give a good review for this place.  I believe most of their business comes from local residents and employees located nearby.  Also, their lunch hour is where they make their profits.  Anyway, back to the order of business: food.  Usually, I can convince coworkers to go to establishment A or B simply by stating:

Came to this place with some classmates from Le Cordon Bleu down the block.  They have an identiy crisis with their menu and can't seem to focus on what they want to see.  You have donuts, breakfast food, udon, sushi bowls, and philly cheese steaks?  The price isn't bad, but then you have to take into consideration the volume of the food they give you.  My buddy and I ordered the cheeseburgers today with fries.  I had to go back to the counter and courteously teach them how to make fries since they obviously didn't blanch them and they were all limpy. (Thank me if they actually start making some decent fries)  Also, the patty that came with our cheeseburgers were so small and thin, I feel like I can see through them.  There was hardly 3 ounces of meat squeezed into this tiny cookie shaped patty.  I mean com'on, don't skimp out so much guys!!
Awesome French toast
I'm definitely a big fan of supporting my local (Korean) business and I'm always curious to see how they mesh burgers and kimchee together. Well, not literally together but you know what I mean.
Even though this is mainly a burger place, I usually get Korean BBQ dish since there are so many other excellent sandwich shops nearby.
weird place. korean food is ok.

I work across the street so come here sometimes but always feel that the food is expensive and only okay.  The fried rice is good and the service is fast enough, but don't bother with the sandwiches or tempura.
Tasty for sure. Not super healthy. Too expensive. Quick service. Weird hours.
Good bulgogi. Nice staff.
Still waiting for a Vampe's Lunch to open across the street so the Korean #teamjacob vs #teamedward battle can rage on.

I come here a lot for lunch since I attend the college nearby. It's a convenient place to eat since it's so close. They have a large variety of selection, from burgers to noodles. I usually get a burger and fries, but I've gotten their fried rice before, and I enjoyed them both. It gets pretty busy during lunch, as most of the working people nearby and students will come here for a bite.

Good food, llllaaaaarrrrggggeeee variety of choices, kinda bland and dirty inside (bathroom was a little scummy), fast service, good fried diner food, out the door and enjoy your meal.  Cheap, too.  Good for a quick to go lunch!

This place has good basic food at a reasonable price.  I usually get the Korean specials like the Bi Bim Bab or Bulgoki.  Both come with a heaping pile of rice, some house pickled vegetables, and some fatty meat.  It seems to scratch that MSG/pickled food itch but not really worth a special trip.
what else are you keeping from me, potrero hill?
good food and fast! good place for lunch when you just have 30 min break!
The burger is very good, which is surprising because they don't seem like a burger restaurant.

Food is decent, and I come here fairly often because it's so close to where I work.  The owner and his wife are adorable (he takes the order, and then uses a microphone hooked up to speakers in the kitchen to let her know what to make).
This is a Korean owned place that I have lunch at.
Fast, cheap, Asian food in the area. What more could you ask for?
Amazing Korean BBQ and more!  I love this place!

I have been coming here for years and I loved the service every time. The idea of a family owned restaurant is inspiring and adorable. This place is right next to the academy of arts in SF and is convenient for those who want a healthy home maid breakfast/lunch. The scenery isn't quite great but they did remodel one side of the restaurant so it looks very nice and calming.
Food is decent for the price and location of the restaurant.
I love this place and eat here at least twice a week.  They have a wide selection, and everything I've had here is really good!
I like to come here for the breakfast items. One of my favorites are Sausage, Egg, and cheese sandwich ( you can order with egg whites).

Wolfe's is your typical hamburger/deli/teriyaki/donuts place but I have to say that all the food I've ever had here is pretty dang delicious!  I frequent this small spot on lunch some days and the owners are pretty friendly.  they have a woman in the back making all of the food usually and she's quick.  The food is always hot and tastes fresh so no complaints from me.
Eclectic and affordable diner.

I got the Bi Bim Bap. I like a good bi bim bap, but unfortunately, this one was only okay. It comes in a large porcelain bowl, not a proper hot stone bowl like you'll find at a real restaurant. Sure, you might argue that this is only a cafe counter, but I'm just saying what you get. I ordered the vegetable bi bim bap, which really just means the normal order without the meat (chicken or pork, I think the choice was), but for the regular full price. The eggs came fried, rather than cracked fresh into the sizzling hot bowl. It's an unfortunate compromise that makes the cold porcelain serving bowl even more of a disappointment.

Not a fancy place, yet great spot for a traditional diner-style American breakfast. For lunch--sandwiches, burgers, and yes...a handful of Korean dishes like beef bulgogi & bibimbap.  Along with this, a few Japanese dishes are also offered. They make the food quickly and they serve it to you fast. The price is right (inexpensive). If you want to eat here for lunch during the weekdays, parking is hard to find. It's probably because there are 2 schools close by--an art & design school and a culinary school just a few blocks away.

great place for food and drinks, if you're into pub food.  Don't expect to get your ass kissed, thats NOT why local places exist.  Ive seen some bad reviews, I can only guess that they are too entitled to be cooll.  Please don't change or give into the new SF value system, too many places have disappeared!!  Natives will love it's vibe, others should move on, (please)
Good clam chowder. My only regret was that I only had a cup instead of a bowl.

I am very reticent to give a negative review, but people should be warned. I came here on a Sunday evening, starving. Looked like a decent menu with pub food, but before I could finish my first beer the bartender proved to be such a jerk, I could not continue to give him business. He was absolutely rude and insulting, without any provocation. In fact, I and my better half are always very polite. There are too many places in the SF to go here.

I went to the Connecticut Yankee this past weekend to watch the Pats game at 10am, but, unfortunately, had an unpleasant and awkward experience.  They were understaffed, with just one waitress tending to the entire main room.  It went downhill from the start.  My friend and I got the last table there, which was right under the big screen.  We decided to check if there was a table in the back room, but when we explained that to the waitress, her response (under her breath) was "Well, that will complicate things."  Since there wasn't anything in the back, we stayed at our table, and it took a good 10 minutes before she came back to take our order.  Our table was clearly visible too, so I'm sure that she saw us too.  Anyway, rather than explain everything that happened, I'll just say that there was a pattern of that sort of "no-no-no" attitude and lack of service (and borderline intentional ignoring) from this woman.  She made us feel awkward for even being there, much less ask for anything.  I noticed that the table near us was experiencing the same frustration.

This is the place for great food, a beer and a game watch. They have plenty of TVs to accommodate any sports interest.  And the food is so good! Whether you want a killer burger, a tuna melt, home made soups or a great salad, they have you covered.  It's not your typical greasy bar food. It's legit.
Food/drinks  are not good!!!! The locals are very rude, and want you to leave!  If your not from the area don't come!

This place is TOTAL shit.  Once I was completely ignored.  Literally no one ever came over.  I waited patiently at the bar and then just left.  I was invited for lunch there and thought oh this time it will be nice to get someone to bring you some of their shitty food.  I WAS WRONG!  The service was worse than being ignored.

I've been here a few times and the service usually isn't great, but is passable. The last visit was a joke though. A Wednesday night, only semi-busy, and we were immediately seated and then promptly forgot about. For 25 minutes. Waiters walked by us but were mute to our calls and had their eyes glued to the TV, so it was impossible to make eye contact as well. We finally just got up and left without ever even getting a beverage, let alone a glass of water. I don't think they even noticed. So if you like watching waiters watch sports rather than taking your order, by all means, check out the Connecticut Yankee.
This is a great place. A real find. Excellent food and service, with ambiance to spare. It's a one of a kind, with a one of a kind history, and location.

A local bar restaurant  out of the the tourist zone but offering a locals only atmosphere that was still fun and comfortable for a visiting family with teenagers. Great menu and a cozy heated patio. Reminds me of our local pub.  Great time good food.
Sports bar within 2 blocks for the park and a few block way from 280.

This is the place where you want to go to for beer, bar food, quiet, and to lounge allllll day.   We were here from noon to 4pm. It never got too busy, the service was friendly, the ambiance is alright for a hundred year old building, parking was easy to find this Saturday afternoon.

The older man bartender is hilarious!! You seriously could not miss out on his awesome humor and generosity!! The food is amazing especially the veggie chili and garlic fries!! This is one stop not to miss out on!!

I came here last night with my boys for the first time and it was delightfully chill. The patio was a good size with heated lamps and the service was quick and dirty ;) The crowd was eclectic, but refreshingly so and they had a baseball game on for the times you didn't feel like talking. Dude, what more can you ask for?!

They have the best wings I've tried in a long time, really good burgers, and awesome fries. There's also really good entrees, but sometimes the garlic stuff is way too garlicky. Last time we tried the "cajun" chicken, and it was surprisingly good.
Awesome brew-pub style sports bar. Food is great, as is the service. Awesome place to catch a game and get 'hang over' cure food on a weekend morning...

Taken here by local friends. Excellent choices of comfort food. Enjoyed my cheesesteak and cup of chowder, but was very envious of my friends choices; a dish called fowl play and a bowl of seafood gumbo! Now imprinted on my mind need to vome back soon and enjoy these dishes. Looks to be a excellent sports bar!

Quaint sports bar with excellent food and beverage selection.  Staff is courteous and friendly.  Try the Pee Wee Herman.  You'll get the joke when you see the ingredients.  The Dr. J is one of my favorite sandwiches in the city!

People of Potrero, bring your Big Wheel, cause this place has gone downhill!!  The Yankee used to be a chill spot to have a beer, nosh, watch a game, and/or watch a show.  But lately...I don't know what's happened. Surly new bartenders now yell at you to keep your voice down when you're watching a play-off game, but the small children running around screaming is A-ok?  WTF are these kids doing in the bar?
The reason we like coming here is Bob... and the Fowl Play.

Worst service I've ever received in my life. Susanna was beyond rude. I think she was just overwhelmed by the amount of people in the bar. Then.... She brought us a free pitcher of beer AND TOTALLY REDEEMED HERSELF!!! Went from 1 star to 4. I'll be coming back

Came out here with friends last night. It's a cool bar; a nice vibe. A little on the smaller side, but an easy place near the office to grab a bite and a beer. Had nachos, the chicken fingers, and a salad. We all appreciated the quick service, the fact they split the checks, the drinks, and the laid back atmosphere. A little on the pricey side, but I would come here again.
The Yankee is a very special place. Every time I've performed or been to a show there it's been obvious that everyone there really cares about the SF music scene.
Comfort food, alcohol, and live music. What more do you need?
the burgers are good but retardedly pricey. the bloody marys are small and pricey, nothing to write home about.  nice patio for a nice day.  service is iffy.

having recently discovered this place in my hood, i thought i would give it a try.  the place was not full but the service was awful.  it was difficult to get a glass of water or a clean spoon, the one at the table was dirty.  i had the vegetarian chili, which was served warmish and it was also greasy.  the french fries were like the ones made from mashed potatoes and formed into fries.  it has a lot of potential, but i won't be back.

I like the atmosphere at the Yankee.  It's cozy and the food is decent. Not great but decent.  Beer is always good of course.  I like going there when you get turned away from the Parkside because they have a band and refuse to let you in for food without paying $12.

Our band played a gig here last month.  We enjoyed a pretty tasty pre show dinner - I had the veggie burger which was good, but I ditched the overly fluffy bun.  They have a good selection of beers we happily partook in.

Nice pub in Potrero. Inside looks nothing like the inside. I think it's trying to resemble some kind of east coast hunting lodge or something. Good beer selection and the kitchen is surprisingly good. Good place to catch a football game.

My dad and I stopped in here for a bite to eat before a show at Bottom of the Hill.  The waitress was just outright rude.  I asked for water and she never brought it.  I eventually got up, picked up the pitcher of water and poured my own water in front of her and another employee.  They just watched me do it and went back to talking.  We didn't complain about the poor service or act irritated in any way (she seemed like the kind of person that spits in food), but the service just got worse.  The food was average.  Good thing we didn't let her bad attitude ruin our night!

It's a Boston bar in all senses including service.  If you want something else, there are plenty of other sports bars with seatings, more fancy drinks and food, and the way they serve.  But if you want straightforward drinks and food sometimes standing up, this is your place.

my girlfriend and I found this place while visiting SF from San Diego. we were looking for a nice Boston friendly bar to watch the Red Sox game when we can across this place. the place was packed with sox fans when we got there, but our server Bob told us we were more than welcome to share a table. we say down with a couple fellow sox fans and had drinks in our hands right away. my girlfriend and I both work in restaurants/bars, and I can assure you that the service is definitely on point. our visit happened during a Saturday night, but any time our drinks got low, Bob was right there with our next round, matter how busy he was.  the food was great (get the steal sandwich. you won't be disappointed) and everyone in the establishment was incredibly welcoming. we had such a great time that we came back the next night for game 5.  if you're going to SF, definitely give this place a visit and ask for Bob!

Was visiting friends in San Francisco, from Boston, and was looking for a bar in town to watch the Red Sox ALCS game.  My friends said this was the spot to go to for that, and they were right.  We got a table in the back room, and ordered a bunch of beers and some food.  Our server Bob was extremely fast, despite having a packed bar that night, and very funny & personable.  We ended up staying after the game ended for a few more rounds.  Would highly recommend this to anyone looking to watch the game.

Our team ordered a couple pitchers of beer and plates of hamburgers.  After two beers, I asked for a glass of water and was told to go to the bar, or she had some other things to do and there would be a delay.  I said I would wait, please bring it.  Thanks for never bringing it.  Not sure how long a place can stay open with this poor customer service.  Definitely taking the business elsewhere.

I've been here multiple times after softball games and every time we get the blonde haired girl she is so rude and always acts like she is being bothered by business. The same goes for the older gentleman with the glasses and gray hair. Your bar is located by a softball field and I'm pretty sure the players spend a lot of money there. I've been a server and for them to treat us so horrible even when we say please and thank you is just bad business. I hesitate even tipping these servers because they are that bad. I've gotten better service at McDonalds. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone and I suggest you go to parkside for drinks after games. If I could give negative stars on service I would.

Being part of the Red Sox/Pats diaspora, it's hard to find a bar where you can truly let yourself go rooting for them, let alone find them playing on the TV.  Connecticut Yankee fills that void.  It's where like-minded New England transplants ("exPats?") can get together and cheer on Tom Brady or Big Papi.  Someone was saying that Left Coasters don't seem to get as rowdy as New England folks about their sports.  I'm not sure that's true.  But it's nice to be in a bar where the Rs are slipping and people are cheering their hardest for your team.  Give them a try!

Connecticut Yankee bills itself as an east coaster escape from the west/best coast (go in there and order an It's It, I dare you), and having spent many a night in east coast bars this last year, I'd say it's a pretty decent facsimile, but that also doesn't make it all that good.
Been here 3 times and don't recommend it.
I've eaten here twice. One time a band setup and started playing during dinner. It was a great surprise as I love some live music!
Come here to watch the pats with pats fans, but not for the place itself.

Seems a bit overpriced for what you get.  Then to top it off the inexperienced waiter didn't return my credit card.  I didn't realize this until the following morning.   Sure you say I should have asked for my credit card back since he took the credit card it's his responsibility until he returns it to me.   Now I have to make a trip back into the city.

I'd highly recommend going a few blocks up the hill to Umi instead where the quality of the food and exceptional service by far exceeds the sub-par treatment I've received here. I will certainly not be coming back.

I used to come to this restaurant a lot since I lived in the area but moved out so haven't come here as much.  The problems I used to have with the place was the food seemed a little pricey though decent quality and the service was terrible.  I mean, the manager who served us sometimes would act like as if he was doing us a favor by giving us sub-par service and making inappropriate remarks.  The last straw was when I came in here recently and had a couple of rolls with fish and the amount of fish had diminished and my server took forever to get me my food and didnt come around enough to check to see if I wanted more or if I wanted a second drink.  To top it off,  I got an very upset stomach later that night.  I am never coming back.  This place and some of their fish seems to be past their expiration date.
Yummy sushi and one of the only ethnic restaurants in the Dogpatch. I'll be back!
Co-workers took me here for my birthday.
It's been there for 27 years!!! Great food, great bar, great staff, cool ambience!
meh... I can cook better.
Moshi Moshi is was of my go-to places when I am craving for Japanese food.
This is a good neighborhood place, and they are prompt in getting lunch served to us within the hour.
Good sushi and bento boxes. Everything is fresh and service is friendly. The prices are a bit high considering the location though.

This is a great low key date spot. The service is great. Staff is always very friendly. Food is good. Atmosphere is super laid back. If you're a vegetarian sushi eater, the options are some of the best in the city.

Good service and good food but nothing extraordinary. The chicken wings lacked spice although the word spicy was in the name of the dish. The Beef Yaki Udon was tasty and the hamachi Kama tasted fresh. The waiter was kind enough to give us a Miso Soup on the house (for no particular reason). By 8pm the place was full!
friendly place.

I pointed to the little face in the menu, a caricature of the owner I knew from long ago.  "Is he here?" I asked the waiter.  He was not, "not usually on Wednesday" I was told.  It's easily been twenty years.
FOOD: 4.5/5
I live across the street from here and eat here all the time. It's great for a quick and casual bite. Solid spot.

Delicious, high-quality sushi for a reasonable price. I've only been here once for takeout, but the space seemed clean and intimate. Good place for having lunch or dinner with friends. Service was polite but not super friendly.
Again - food is great, but they really need to improve their service. Serious issue in helping people get sitted, giving the menu etc.

Very good.  Not my favorite Japanese restaurant, but still a very good place.  I had the Grill combination with Ahi Tuna, tonkatsu, and sashimi, and liked it all.  Street parking was surprisingly not difficult (the day we went).  We sat in the patio in the back, which had a long table for community-style eating.  It was a lunchtime crowd, mostly young professionals, some had UCSF badges.  There is also what looked like a full bar.

Good food.  Slightly overpriced, but that's Dogpatch.  Nice bar setup.  It's a zoo during lunch hours, some waiting for a table.  I wish they opened earlier to fit into my lunch hour. Parking tends to suck.

The sushi I had was not fresh. How do you mess up a California roll? My crabmeat looked old and tasted older. I'm not trying to be mean, just honest. Another person ordered the combo box and "liked" it which is the only reason I'm giving this 2 stars instead of 1.

This place is not bad at all! Really great selection for lunch and great service. Shared a few rolls with a friend and it was more than enough. Fish was fresh and we left really happy. The prices were also very reasonable, considering anywhere from 9-12 bucks per roll. Specialty rolls are around 15. Not bad and will definitely return!
I live right by Moshi Moshi, making this restaurant a easy place to grab dinner if I'm feeling lazy on a weekend-night.

Love this place!  everyone that works is super nice, the owner is really fun, food is delicious , very eclectic liquor collection, a very nice beer list. the space is split in three ,very different from each other, rooms. cool all wood furnished back yard , comfortable all black bar, and a very sunny white/silver main dining area .
Blog Post -
I have eaten here several times and always found the Sushi good and fresh.  Kinda noisy during the lunch rush but dependable food.

Consistently good for groups. Huge sake and beer selection. The sushi ranges from affordable to fancy, depending on your needs and wallet. The udon is also quite good. They're also one of the few places in the area that is open and still serving food relatively late.

I met a friend from out of town here for drinks and dinner, on Tuesday night. We were well greeted when we arrived, and were shown to a very nice table in a quiet area where we could talk, without being disturbed, or without disturbing others.
THE BEST SUSHI EVER!

Our go-to sushi joint when we lived in Dogpatch. This place looks totally nondescript from the outside, but is a true restaurant on the inside! There's a light room and a dark room -- the light being where most of the family dining takes place, and the dark being where the bar is and is a little more intimate. There's even an outdoor patio area with heat lamps and a cafeteria style table and bench.
So I never write reviews but I had to about this place. Ordered obake maki terrible! Super bad fish odor and waitress was super rude! Never coming back again

Decent sushi place with a pretty standard menu of standard quality. The restaurant is one of the few in the neighborhood, so it can get by as is, but the restaurant is only worth going if you feel like staying close to Dogpatch.
We're here a couple times a week because the rolls are solid, staff is friendly, the owner is insanely charming, and it's mere blocks from my boyfriend's.
In a word, Great!  I went there today and decided it's time to write a review.

I ate here last month and it was a huge disappointment.  The food was mediocre at best and the service poor.   I had high hopes.  The menu looked good, we ordered appetizers and entrees, which all arrived at once in about five minutes.  What?  is this a fast food joint? It tasted like it.   I thought since dog patch is up and coming maybe this place was also, but no.  It lacks sf sophistication and quality.  If I were eating out in Bakersfield I might have thought "hey this is good".  You need to do better than this in san francisco unless you are basically a bar with a secondary restaurant which well may be the case.

This is the favorite sushi restaurant in San Francisco for my wife and myself. I am not a big sushi aficionado, but my lovely wife is. That said, the teriyaki chicken and the tempura shrimp are very very good. I also like that it is not too difficult to park near the restaurant, and the decor is modernistic and quirky.

So as some of you might know, I'm the market for a job up here in the Bay Area. This area is the epicurean capital of California. Don't believe me? There was a buzzfeed article that said so. I'll link it if I find it. (I think I read it in the bathroom a while ago, so bear with me.)

I absolutely love this place!  The sushi is very good, not overpriced at all.  My fav is the new moon roll, so yummy!  But the real standout is the soup.  There is something about this soup that just makes me so happy on a rainy day.  Or an overcast dreary day.  Or a sunny day.  Or any day!
If you want sushi in the Dogpatch, this is the place to go.
Been here several times and it's nice.  The owner, an older man, comes around to greet everyone and is charming.

The BF and I head here at least twice a week to get our sandwich fix. We love their sandwiches and Elizabeth and Ramsey are awesome! It's usually only the two of them, so if it's busy be patient, pet their dogs & take a seat outside, your delicious sandwich will be right with you!
I would be lost without this place and their delicious sandwiches. So well stocked. They know what their neighborhood needs and seem to have everything.

I could write about what a wonderful neighborhood store this has always been and, if the owners, Beth and Ramsey, have it their way, always will be...and how great and convenient the food and service is...but I need to say something much more important: I miss Blue.
Such a great spot to have in the neighborhood--plus the walk up the hill makes me feel like I've earned my delicious sandwich.
I was walking, got hungry, and stuck "sandwich" on the Yelp search engine. Admittedly, it was the rating that led me here over closer locations.

It took them over 20 minutes to get us our sandwiches, and it wasn't crowded. Had they warned us it would take that long, we would have gone elsewhere. Seriously obnoxious how long that took considering how empty it was and how we had places we had to be.
I love love love Chiotras, and not just because I live less than two blocks away.
The best turkey sandwiches!
Ramsey and his wife Beth are two great folks with great sandwiches...and a cold one every now and then.....

stopped by during football halftime.  owner's friendly.  prosciutto sandwich wasn't unique but it was fresh.  meet wasnt stringy or overly salty and there was enough of it.  bread was chewy.  3.5 stars.

Run by a pair of friendly Iranians, the fresh-made sandwiches are consistently excellent, if a little bit pricey.  The thing to do is to go out onto the back porch on a sunny day and eat while watching the chickens in their backyard roam around and peck at things (yes, they keep chickens).
bluuuueee + chickens = friendly neighborhood store
We totally won the lottery by having this be our neighborhood store!  Great sandwiches, great service and good selection. It's a wee bit pricey, but hey, it's quality stuff.
The felafel/ hummus platter...yummy! Expensive, but truly THEE best sandwich on the hill.

Ready for a picnic on a beautiful Sunday afternoon.  I called up Ike's Place, and they said it would be a 1 hour wait for phone orders and a 20 minute wait if I dropped in and ordered...ugh.  So I decided to try Chiotras sandwiches for the first time...
The sandwiches are good, though the pickles, mustard, and mayo overpowers the flavor of the bread, meat, and vegetables.  Substantial in size.

The appearance may say "Sketchyton 9000+" but the interior says "good sandwich".  They stop making them after ~5pm so that is bummer-tastic..but their beer is good, they have wine, they have great sandwiches, good bread/meats/cheese for purchase...and there be hella dogs chillin' outside.

If I were only reviewing the sandwiches it's five stars. But they're really really often out of many kinds of bread and as an actual corner grocery its kind of lacking/really expensive. but the sandwiches are great, especially the hot coppa, and the bread is great when they actually have what I want. plus the owners are incredibly nice and it's a nice little place to sit outside

A neighborhood gem, offering not only great sandwiches, loads of healthy snacks/organic food options (and decent wine selections if you're in a pinch), but some of the best coffee available in the city (Moschetti's).
This is everything you could possibly want in a neighborhood deli.  Fantastic sandwiches, a wide selection  of chips, pop and sundries, and an awesome patio on which to enjoy them all.
Chiotras has an outdoor patio in the back, which overlooks a yard with three free range hens, where you can sit in the sun and eat your sandwich.

Finally got to visit this fabulous Deli, everything served with a smile, fresh, fresh bread and the preparation an art of it's own...if you are anywhere near Potrero Hill...Gift Center, Jewelry Mart, Going to a Game @ Att Park.... stop by you won't be disappointed.
Chiotras is the apex of friendly neighborhood grocery stores.
What makes Chiotras so good? Is it the killer sandwiches? The honestly good and friendly owners? Maybe the awesome patio? Whatever the secret, it works out well for Chiotras and has me hooked.

Stopped by here to pick up some sandwiches and they were delicious!  It has a neighborhood grocery/deli feel to the place which is quite endearing.  We got the Procuitto sandwich and also the meatball sandwich.  It took a bit to make but you could tell each sandwich was made with care and attention.  If you're in the area, definitely give this place a try!
Going to Chiotras is such a great feeling, a happy feeling.

You can judge a deli by its tuna salad sandwich (take it from someone who worked through college at various delis) - and Chiotras has an amazing tuna salad sandwich. I just crushed a toasted wheat bread sandwich with tuna salad, tomatoes, mustard, pickles, pepperoncinis and pepper jack cheese. It was delicious. The woman working there was incredibly friendly and gave me a taste of the tuna before committing. She seemed calm and patient as I made my selection. Two neighbors came in while I was there and she recognized both by name and said, "the usual?" It was wonderful and made me realize I've found my home in San Francisco. Thank you, Chiotras!

Expensive, but truly THEE best sandwich on the hill. I just had the garlic rosemary turkey on chiabatta and HOT DAMN that was one good sandwich!  Everything is fresh and well put together. They didn't have the fresh roast turkey today, but I'll try that next time.  I used to frequent Klein's when they were open and Chiotra's is way better.  Be ready to spend $8 for a sandwich, but it's well worth it.
The best for sandwiches on Potrero Hill by far!!  Go and try.. Super friendly and locally owned.  Support and enjoy.  Take in the view of the city out front on the quaint tables out front .
Great small neighborhood grocery! Moved to Potrero Hill over a year ago and live 1 block from Chiotras, I am an every-day customer.
Good sandwiches, super nice people, cozy little place to eat on a nice day. -1 for being out of most breads :/

I'm new to the neighborhood and was searching Yelp to establish a new list of places to try.  I read a few posts about excellent breakfast sandwiches.  So I went.  There's no menu.  I asked for the breakfast sandwich and it's a bagel with egg, cheese and bacon/ham.  I'm not sure what all the fuss is about.  I watched them microwave my sandwich.  The bagel was OK.  The bacon and egg tasted rubbery after the microwave.  It was a 2-star sandwich, at best.  Giving the place 3 stars because it's a cool neighborhood market that I'm happy to have nearby.

This place is so cozy..sort of like going over to your aunts house while she makes you dinner. The sandwiches are a bit pricey though.. but thats ok given the quality of bread and meat that they use. This is one of those places that charges extra for some toppings.
Very nice for a sandwich if you're up that way.

I'm reviewing Chiotras as a neighborhood grocery store that also serves coffee and pastries.  I haven't tried the deli sandwiches yet, but judging from the other review here, I might have to tack on a star after doing so!

Love that this market is getting great reviews...used to live down the street and come by frequently...couldn't ask for friendlier folks here, and awesome sandwiches!  And Anchor Steam Barley Wine!  Beth, Ramzi, Ali, you guys rock!
Unbelievably fantastic.  Best sandwich I've had in the city.  Laid-back vibe.  View of city skyline from street-side seating.

The little neighborhood grocery/sandwich shop that all others should aspire to become.  Owner Beth is the absolute best, potrero hill native and knowledge hub for all things happening on the hill.  Want to find a babysitter, dogwalker, wondering what the commotion is all about on 20th and Arkansas -- Beth will hook you up.

Chiotras Grocery is one of those little hidden gems that probably looks too sketchy from the street to ever lure you in, but once someone takes you there you are hooked. I used to get off the bus here on my way home from school everyday in high school and never thought twice about going in, that was until a neighborhood friend introduced me to their sandwiches. Who knew there was such delicious sandwiches hiding within what appeared to be a small neighborhood grocery store.
The guys who work here are friendly. Small seating area in the front and back. I hate it when delis mark up Cokes- their can is $1 vs. the deli on Vermont and 19th (85c).

My new favorite place for coffeeshopping and computering. Awesome sandwiches to fuel, decent coffee, wine.  Could use more seating! Even though the barista rolls her eyes at me every time I LOVE THIS PLACE!

I've come back here several times since my first review, and the service has been better. Not one of the best cafés you'll find in San Francisco, but it's a serviceable option if you're stuck in the Dogpatch area.

Super basic coffee shop selection and overall pretty boring fare. Their drinks run a bit more than average but reasonable. But the service is lacking-  why can't they say thanks or just hand you the drink you just ordered with a smile instead of shouting out your order as though there's anyone else waiting for a drink? I think this place only survives because there are no other unpretentious options.

i've gone here over half a dozen times and I've ALWAYS gotten great smiling frirendly service.  Their rooms are clean.  It helps a lot that they have a back spacious room + 2 clean modern bathrooms when they get busy with lots of customers.  If my order is going to take a while, I usually just let them know I'll be in the back spacious room and go there to hook up to the wifi and electrical outlet and they serve me my food or drinks there once they've gotten it done and/or busy with other patrons.  The spacious room is quiet for you to work on your laptop on their sofas or chairs/tables and it's interesting to see with many different art paintings/drawings or other art items that the employees themselves may have had a hand in.  Their food menu isn't very extensive, but they do have sandwiches which are kind of pricey with vegan options like their bagels with hummus and tomatoes which are pretty delicious.  Sometimes (i guess when they want to clear some of their old inventory for fresher), they have "deals" where they'll put day old bagels/bread in a brown bag on their front counter for $1.  Yes, $1!!  I usually go in there for that and an organic coffee to do work on the wifi.  The only thing i wish is that they stayed open longer past 6pm.   It's right next to the T bus stop.  I wouldn't go out of my way to go there, but if you're in the neighborhood and want a quiet roomy place to relax, use free reliable wi-fi, have pleasant service, it's a good cafe to check out.

The spot is pretty cool---I love the artwork in the second room gallery.  The coffee is "okay"...seems more expensive than other places in the area, and can be quite bitter.  Otherwise, it's a cool spot to hang out and surf the web to kill time.

I'm so frustrated by this place and it's my fault that I've gone back three times. Every single time I've gone to get a breakfast wrap or sand which they ALWAYS leave something off and I have to go back. And it takes forever. Today I was distracted and didn't check right away like I should have and walked all the way back to my office to only find they didn't put the tomato on the sandwich. And note, this isn't something I ADDED, it's the way the sandwich is sold...egg, cheese and tomato. The other funny thing is that I've been in there before when I watched a woman walk up to them saying they forgot the tomato, so I guess it's my fault for not checking.
Having a quick breakfast at Dogpatch Cafe, it's delicious!  Having the BEC and coffee, had to buy a second one for lunch.

Definitely won't recommend to my friends. The house coffee was good but the SERVICE was horrible. I am a regular there, go into the shop three times a week and it really ruined my mood in the morning today when the guy server (the one without glasses) gave me a raisin bagel without cream cheese when i clearly asked for a plain bagel with cream cheese and ACCUSED me with really rude attitude of not having said things clearly and being on the phone. I already hang up when I was ordering.
Power sandwich is fantastic!
Free Wifi and baristas without pretension? Yes, please! Found myself in the Dogpatch with a few hours to kill... Where did I end up? Dogpatch Cafe!

I've been to the cafe many times, because I enjoy their sandwiches.  The coffee is ok at best and the decor is nice, but the girl who works on Saturday morning is the worst barista ever.  Her coffee is like her personality which is inconsistent.
i won't be returning here because i was kicked out when my order wasn't right. here's what happened:

I don't write reviews often and when I do, they're usually positive. However, I work in the area and unfortunately there aren't many options for coffee/bagel runs, so I often find myself here. There's always a wait with no sense of urgency from the staff. I've now decided that I will no longer give this cafe my business until they get rid of the girl with the jet black hair. She's rude, never smiles, and always carries herself as if I'm inconveniencing her with my order. I refuse to stand in line and be treated like that over coffee that's mediocre at best to begin with. Definitely worth the out-of-the-way walk to Piccino for coffee instead.

Service & coffee is usually good here. I have probably been here at least 100 times over 3 years & have only had a few espresso drinks be unpalatable. (I blame the new baristas or a distracted one.) On a few ocassions I have gotten what I call Nuclear coolant temperature espresso here that took a good 15 minutes to cool to non-nuclear levels (once again, distracted barista.) If they recognize you, they tend to be friendlier, & the staff is consistently polite to everyone. Saying "can I please have..." & "thank you" is appreciated by baristas everywhere by the way. The place is clean, well lit & the WiFi doesn't have the same problems Peets or Starbucks usually has. There are 2 rooms, so you can avoid the equipment noise & hang with a friend or a laptop if you want.
Decent for the immediate needs in the morning. Solid coffee, espresso, and free wifi.

There are better places to spend your money. I  recommended this cafe to a new client as a place conveniently located in my neighborhood for a quick weekend bite at noon. No sooner than he took his seat we were both confronted by the owner to either buy something or leave right away. None of the other patrons were treated or confronted in such a rude and racist manner - just us. If you're are a person of color or someone who respects the locals in the neighborhood of Dogpatch, don't patronize an establishment. Their staff practices are racist and their staff is extremely rude, paranoid and unworthy of your business!
Nice place, good coffee, the staff is very nice, the egg and bacon sandwich turned out to be the best I've had in awhile!

Their sandwiches are great! I've tried the veggie and and hurricane and they were both delicious. I love sandwiches that have great bread, and this place does. The only thing is that they took quite a while to make my sandwich. I just stopped by there to grab a quick bite, and it took 20 minutes after I ordered to get my sandwich (there was nobody in front of me).

Been going to this place since I moved to the city. The coffee is good and the food is decent. The staff is super friendly and personable. My favorite part about this place is that it allows my dog to hangout inside with me. Can't beat that.

Nice relaxing place to grab a coffee and some light breakfast for a great price. Atmosphere is definitely chill/friendly. Would be back again if I'm looking for a coffee shop on the area. Free and usable wifi here.
This is a great place to stop by - especially in the morning.

ICK. Met a friend here for coffee and needed a snack. Ordered a green salad which I paid $3.95 for. As I stood there watching, the counter guy went over and started making my salad WITHOUT EVER WASHING HIS HANDS. Ick and double ick.  I couldn't eat it after that. I'll never go back.
Spot is right around the corner from my work. Corner spot (upstairs & a lower level).

I love this small coffee shop. I only came once because I was working at a photoshoot in a studio nearby. I bought their almond croissant and it was DELICIOUS! The service was great, I wish I would have tried their coffee even though I dont like coffee!
I feel like I should like this place more than I do, since I'm such a fan of local coffee establishments. However, it continuously fails to wow me.

This was the only coffee place I could find on my way to work for my first day at China Basin so I had no choice but to try it.  I was pleasantly surprised by their veggie sandwich $5 (and they heat it up for ya).  Coffee is aight but the service was great and I cannot wait to try that Power Sandwich with the apples and peanut butter.  It was a tough choice but I had to have the gruyere cheese and mushroom cuz once again a bit hung over!  It definitely hit the spot but do not come here if you are in a hurry since that would not make you a happy camper.  They do take their time and only had 2 gals workin on a Tuesday morning at 8:30ish with a steady line.  Also they are dog friendly- makes sense for Dogpatch Cafe!

The place is nice and ample but  when I walked in the morning to order a pastry which name I had forgotten and I pointed at it, the big girl with the crew cut yelled out at me "Describe what pastry you want, don't point at it!" Keep in mind that my finger was pressed right against the glass and it was clear what I was pointing at, and it wasn't some obscure vague pointing.
Friendly workers, and their credit card minimum is a dollar, which is nice when your train is coming and you want to grab a quick coffee.

This has become my go to coffee spot.  Coffee is definitely solid.  Always hot and good.  A little bit on the pricier side than average but you can get a 16 or 20 ounce here which is getting harder to find with the local spots.  Great ambiance with a cool art gallery in the back room.  Place is pretty quiet and i've never had to wait an absurd amount of time to get my coffee.

My husband and I were walking around the area and the sweet smell of bacon drew us into this cafe. We already had lunch so we weren't able to try one of their bacon egg sandwiches. However we tried the organic coffee and it was delicious. It was really smooth and clean tasting; similar to the way americanos taste.

If you like your coffee served with a side of attitude, you've come to the right place! The two younger women who typically work here are clearly annoyed at all the customers interrupting them, and can't be bothered to do something as simple as handing your order to you (versus flinging it on the counter, for instance, and expecting you to know that it's there).
affordable drinks in SF?  Good drinks, good food, wifi, lots of seating arrangements, extra space next store with rotational art installs. good music when it's on (turn it on, leave it on DPC!)

Such a great space for the awesome Airbnb event that I went to here. There were plenty of bathrooms and a large amount of space for people to roam around in. The only downside is that it's pretty far away from everything else, but the Dogpatch is becoming more populated as of late, so this shouldn't be a big problem for long. Check it out!
Great vibe, great music, lots of sun.

I came here a few months ago en route to the Giants game. I ordered an bacon and egg sandwich on a baguette and was very tasty. I also ordered a an iced green tea which was very good as well. If ever in the area this would definitely be a place to stop by for a snack!
Ok, sometimes the barristas are a bit aloof, whatever, I get there early in the morning & I'm just glad they are there to hook me up.

I know.....another 5 star gazing waving raving review from me.   The thing is I really like this place and I been hesitant sharing. Because I don't want it crowded and I like all the space and art, and noshing (Grub for sale), and coffees and specials on iced teas, and SERVICE.   Service with a smile, good service always and great service this Sunday a.m. Via Sarah!

Cafe Dogpatch is an establishment that I will not ever step foot into again.  The counter people there are indifferent, and management should really look into training them as they do not know the meaning of customer service.  I was in there the other day, and one of the women there talked down to me as though I was an idiot, but this was after some time as they ignored me while I was standing there, and I decided that I won't waste my time and money there, and walked out.  If they are not careful with their bad attitudes, one would think they are racist.

Dogpatch Cafe' is a gem. Relaxed and comfortable.. Super nice people, Art exhibits, and beautiful environment. A true Cafe' locally owned. When in the Dogpatch neighborhood stop by have a great cup of coffee and enjoy the art exhibit.  While Dogpatch Cafe' sandwiches are tasty, there is a Mexican/Salvadorean restaurant next door in the same building, called "The New Spot" which is very good.

Gallery. Coffee. Free wifi. And the breakfast sandwich. Oh the sandwich. This is a great place to hang out at either to catch up with a friend, read a book or do some work. The t-line is right outside. Perfect if you live in the neighborhood.

Nice little place in PH... service is mediocre (hey staff: it's okay to crack a smile), Americano was solid, and the outdoor seating is pretty awesome. If you're in the area already, go for it, but I wouldn't make a trip out here from other parts of SF.

Guy taking orders was very rude, our coffee and chai order took forever and then when we checked, he gave us some "you caught us on a Sunday" excuse. It was 30 minutes already and they realized that they screwed up only after we checked for the second time. Even then the guy who was rude never apologized and the guy who gave the money back also slammed the change on the table. Took our money, left their free coffee on the table. Someone needs to teach them customer service.
Best coffee cake here.Great coffee.This place is spacious.Has a good magazine collection and a unique music taste.

Great place to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon working and drinking a coffee. It has lots of natural light and some outdoor seating if you want to hang and read a book. Doesn't have that many outlets, so you got to approach this place strategically. Left side of the cafe has all the outlets (by the benches). We ended up buying black coffee there and getting sandwiches next door as the kitchen was closed.
I was in SF this last weekend and I was able to go to Farleys for coffee 2 days in a row.
Simply the best Cappuccino in town!
Almond latte!

The welcoming baristas here are always up for asking how your day is going and I make it a point to visit here whenever I'm in the city even though it may be somewhat out of the way.  The weathered hardwood floors, high ceiling, communal table and magazine rack stocked with various periodicals help create an airy and pleasant environment.  I especially appreciate the fact that they have magazines related to architecture such as Abitare, Dwell and Mark.
Great local coffee shop with a cool vibe and a big magazine rack for you to grab any mag you want while drinking your coffee/tea.

This is my first time here at Farley's. I've heard from a lot of friends that I should check it out since I'm a coffee shop lover. Right on point! Great customer service, quality espresso, and the quiche is to die for! Would definitely recommend this place to my friends!

Pretension at least needs to be backed by skill. This place has oodles of the former and seems particularly lacking in the latter. If I ever want over roasted beans and scalded milk with a side of back talk, I guess I know where to go next time.

I'm not a coffee person so a little disclaimer that this review is only for the ambiance not the taste of the coffee. I happened to stroll in here with a friend while waiting for brunch lines to die down. The second I walked in I immediately was brought back to New York-style cafes with its modern look and feel. It's a very open cafe with tons of seating and airy feel. What I loved most was the little news stand in the corner -- with every magazine you could think of (minus trashy tabloids). People were sitting around reading their magazines while sipping coffee. I loved it! Such a different vibe that what I'm used to. I would definitely sit and study/ read here on a weekend.

Been going to farleys from the year it opened and have always enjoyed the ambiance and coffee. However lately. It takes at least 10 minutes to get a latte even when it's not busy and the croissants are verging on terrible and tasted a day old. I hope they step up their game. There's more cafe choices and great coffee in the nabe so that should be a motivator.

Farley's is a very cool neighborhood cafe located over in Potrero Hill. I really like the laid back feel once you get inside. Everyone here seems to be very friendly, and I really enjoy their outdoor seatings too. They are very dog friendly and you always see someone sipping their favorite beverage outside with their dogs.
Nice coffee spot in Potrero Hill. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Excellent gibralter and a very good ginger scone.
They have beef empanadas. 'Nuff said.
